title: P-8 Flight Test Engineer/NFO
description:
Title:

P-8 Flight Test Engineer/NFO

KBR’s Mission Engineering Division delivers complex technical solutions and expert support to the U.S. Department of War, specializing in modeling and simulation, cyber transformation, air vehicle mission integration, and lifecycle support. As a trusted partner with a proven history in mission technology, KBR collaborates closely with clients to develop innovative and effective solutions. With a strong ethical framework, KBR prioritizes data security, privacy, and responsible information management to ensure mission success.

KBR is seeking a P-8 Flight Test Engineer/Navy Flight Officer (NFO) – Top Secret + SSBI. This position supports tasking at Naval Air Station (NAS) Point Mugu near Oxnard, CA. The successful candidate will provide qualified Flight Test Engineering and Navy Flight Officer (NFO) support during airborne system testing and reporting for the Navy’s Advanced Sensor Technologies Program Office (AST PO). The work is primarily conducted in and around the Point Mugu area, but up to 35% travel is required.

ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Systems operator for P-8A training flights, support services flights (logistics, transport, VIP, demonstration), maintenance, acceptance testing, and flight testing (operational test, developmental test, Integration and test, and science and technology).
Participating in all aircrew training, ground training, and flight training.
Preparing and executing detailed test plans. Preparing test reports. Supporting technical meetings. Supporting acquisition reviews and milestone decisions.
Other duties as assigned.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: 

Education & Years of Experience (options): 

BS/BA & 8 years of experience. 
OR AA/AS & 12 years of experience. 
OR High School Diploma & 16 years of experience. 

Experience must include: 

Within your overall years of experience, at least 8 years of experience must be in the operational employment of airborne search, detection, and tracking systems, as utilized on maritime surveillance aircraft
Experience working in aviation testing
Personnel and program management experience

Designations/Certifications/Aircraft Requirements: 

A minimum of 1500 hours in the P-3/P-8 family of aircraft
Past or current designations as a P-3 or P-8 Tactical Coordinator (TACCO) and Mission Commander
The ability to maintain physical standards for flight status

Citizenship & Clearance: Must be a U.S. citizen. Must have TS Clearance. Must have completed a Single Scope Background Investigation (SSBI) within the past six (6) years or currently enrolled in the Continuous Evaluation (CE) Program

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Operational experience with DoD active duty customers
Experience with AST systems such as Littoral Surveillance Radar System (LSRS) or Advanced Airborne Sensor (AAS)
DT and/or OT systems test experience of P-3/P-8 family systems.
Recent experience with RDT&E and/or acquisition for advanced military electronics/computer systems.
Advanced Sensor Technologies Program Office experience.
A Test Pilot School Graduate will be preferred.

Additional Notes: Applicant selected may be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. A Single Scope Background Investigation (SSBI) completed within the past six (6) years (or currently enrolled in the Continuous Evaluation (CE) Program) is required.

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40 hours/week.

Travel: 35%

Compensation: $131,000-196,500.  The salary range posted is based on the national average. The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s location, knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience, contract affordability, and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation: KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of a sign-on bonus, relocation benefits, short-term incentives, long-term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

KBR Benefits​: KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development. #LI-ML2

title: Engineering Technician
description:
Title:

Engineering Technician

KBR’s Mission Engineering Division delivers complex technical solutions and expert support to the U.S. Department of Defense, specializing in modeling and simulation, cyber transformation, air vehicle mission integration, and lifecycle support. As a trusted partner with a proven history in mission technology, KBR collaborates closely with clients to develop innovative and effective solutions. With a strong ethical framework, KBR prioritizes data security, privacy, and responsible information management to ensure mission success.

Engineering Technician to support the Electromagnetic Effects (E3) Engineering Program, focused on F-18 and EA-18G Growler aircraft at NAS Patuxent River, Maryland. This role involves hands-on technical work related to aircraft systems, weapons integration, and electromagnetic effects testing and evaluation. The ideal candidate will have experience with F-18/Growler platforms, weapons systems, and maintenance or testing in a high-security, military aviation environment.

Job Duties & Responsibilities

Perform hands-on inspection, maintenance, and troubleshooting of F-18 and EA-18G Growler aircraft systems.
Support weapons systems integration, testing, and functional verification. Assist in diagnosing malfunctions related to avionics, sensors, communications, and electromagnetic systems.
Set up, calibrate, and operate test equipment for electromagnetic compatibility and effects testing. Assist engineers in conducting EME experiments, including RF exposure, EMI/EMC measurements, and signal testing.
Document test conditions, configurations, and results accurately in compliance with NAVAIR standards.
Assist engineers in evaluating design modifications or system upgrades.
Prepare reports, technical drawings, and test documentation to support engineering decisions.
Provide feedback on technical procedures and recommend improvements to test protocols.
Additional duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications

Must be a US Citizen with an active Secret clearance
Must have a High School Diploma/GED.
5+ years of experience.
Hands-on experience with F-18 or EA-18G Growler aircraft systems.
Experience supporting weapons systems, including integration, maintenance, or operational testing.
Knowledge of electrical, electronic, or avionics systems relevant to military aircraft.
Proficiency in reading and interpreting technical manuals, schematics, wiring diagrams, and engineering drawings.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience supporting NAVAIR
Prior experience in Electromagnetic Effects (EME), EMI/EMC, or RF testing.
Experience with automated test equipment, diagnostic tools, or lab measurement systems.

This is an SCA Position. Pay Rate is dependent on experience.

Engineering Technician III $28.79, Engineering Technician IV $ 35.64, Engineering Technician V $43.61

title: Site Lead & RF/EMI Test Manager
description:
Title:

Site Lead & RF/EMI Test Manager

KBR’s Mission Engineering Division delivers complex technical solutions and expert support to the U.S. Department of Defense, specializing in modeling and simulation, cyber transformation, air vehicle mission integration, and lifecycle support. As a trusted partner with a proven history in mission technology, KBR collaborates closely with clients to develop innovative and effective solutions. With a strong ethical framework, KBR prioritizes data security, privacy, and responsible information management to ensure mission success.

KBR is seeking a Site Lead & RF/EMI Test Manager to lead operations, drive business development, and provide deep subject matter expertise in RF, EMI/EMC, and EMP disciplines at our Lubbock, TX site. This unique role combines leadership and growth responsibilities with hands-on technical authority in MIL-STD-461 certification, electromagnetic pulse (EMP) research, and anechoic chamber design, installation, and operations. The Site Lead will serve as KBR’s senior representative in Lubbock, managing daily operations, guiding program performance, and strengthening customer relationships while advancing technical testing capabilities. This is a rare opportunity to both grow an organization and shape its technical direction, making an impact on mission success for KBR’s defense customers. Join our team and help drive innovation at the intersection of leadership, business development, and RF/EMI expertise.

Roles and Responsibilities

Lead day-to-day site operations, ensuring organizational performance, program success, and alignment with KBR’s core values, Zero Harm culture, and Quality Management System.
Serve as KBR’s senior representative in Lubbock, building strong customer and partner relationships with Texas Tech University and the Critical Infrastructure Security Institute, attending conferences, and hosting key stakeholder meetings.
Champion a culture of growth, innovation, and collaboration, working with Senior Technical Advisors across KBR to expand site capabilities.
Design, develop, and oversee advanced RF/EMI/EMC test facilities, programs, processes, and systems to ensure compliance with MIL-STD-461 and related standards.
Lead pulsed power, radar, microwave systems, directed energy, and EMP (Electromagnetic Pulse) research initiatives and resilience testing, providing technical direction and evaluation of system responses.
Oversee design, installation, and operations of a local anechoic chamber, including setup, test execution, and analysis of RF/EMI test data.
Develop and maintain advanced test procedures, debug protocols, and simulation environments; analyze results to validate system performance under electromagnetic conditions.
Manage and maintain laboratory test equipment, coordinating with external vendors for calibration, upgrades, and repairs.
Mentor and guide junior engineers and technicians, fostering technical growth in RF, EMI/EMC, and EMP disciplines.

Basic Qualifications

Clearance & Citizenship: U.S. Citizenship and the ability to obtain/maintain a DoD Secret clearance.
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Physics, or related discipline (advanced degree preferred).
Experience: 7+ years of experience in EMI/EMC and RF testing, including MIL-STD-461 certification testing and qualification.  Demonstrated expertise in EMP (Electromagnetic Pulse) analysis, research, and testing. Hands-on experience with anechoic chamber operations and RF/EMI test campaigns.

Preferred Qualifications

Texas Tech University alumni preferred.
Prior site leadership or program management experience with direct customer interface.
Experience supporting capture management and proposal development efforts.
Strong background in technical consultation and collaboration with internal design teams and external customers.
Familiarity with laboratory management, including equipment lifecycle, calibration, and vendor coordination.

Benefits: KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include a 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Network System Admin
description:
Title:

Network System Admin

KBR’s Mission Engineering Division delivers complex technical solutions and expert support to the U.S. Department of Defense, specializing in modeling and simulation, cyber transformation, air vehicle mission integration, and lifecycle support. As a trusted partner with a proven history in mission technology, KBR collaborates closely with clients to develop innovative and effective solutions. With a strong ethical framework, KBR prioritizes data security, privacy, and responsible information management to ensure mission success.

Are you ready to take your networking expertise to the next level? KBR is seeking a Network Systems Admin (Network Engineer) with an active Secret clearance to join our Counter-UAS team at St. Inigoes, MD ( Webster Field Annex). This is a highly technical, customer-facing role where you’ll lead network design, implement cybersecurity standards, troubleshoot issues, and support next-gen system integration efforts. You’ll contribute directly to mission readiness while collaborating across engineering and IT teams. This is a full-time, on-site role (5 days/week), with the schedule subject to change based on contract needs.

Roles & Responsibilities

Network Design & Integration – Analyze and optimize network architectures across local, regional, and wide-area networks. Lead system design, integration, and on-site installation of advanced hardware and software systems to support mission-critical operations.
Security & Compliance – Implement Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs) for network and operating systems security. Support IATT and ATO package preparation to ensure lab environments meet DoD cybersecurity standards.
Documentation & Reporting – Create and maintain detailed documentation, including system diagrams, configuration templates, procedures, and technical reports to ensure operational transparency and compliance.
Troubleshooting & Performance – Utilize tools like Wireshark to identify, analyze, and resolve network issues. Apply engineering expertise to maintain system reliability, performance, and continuous improvement.
Collaboration & Project Execution – Work cross-functionally with internal teams and government stakeholders. Contribute to the planning and executing IT development projects while actively engaging in team meetings and infrastructure coordination.

Basic Qualifications

Citizenship & Clearance: Must be a US Citizen with an active/current DoD Secret Clearance.

Years of Experience & Education Requirements: BS/BA  from an accredited US institution and 8 years of experience. Additional experience or advanced degrees accepted /credited.

Travel: Ability to travel for work 25% to 40% (CONUS and OCONUS)

Preferred Qualifications

Master's Degree
Familiarity with Webster Field and NAS Patuxent River RDT&E network infrastructure
Cisco CCNP Certification.
Proficiency with Microsoft Visio. Experience with wireless or microwave point-to-point networking.  Experience with IPSEC VPN and L2TP. Familiarity with Linux - RHEL, SUNOS systems.
Current U.S. Passport

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40 hours/week

Compensation: $84,000-$160,000. The salary range posted is based on the national average. The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s location, knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience, contract affordability, and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation: KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of a sign-on bonus, relocation benefits, short-term incentives, long-term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

KBR Benefits​: KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development. #LI-ML2

title: Comms & Radar Electronic Technician
description:
Title:

Comms & Radar Electronic Technician

We are adding a skilled Comms & Radar Electronic Technician​ with specialized experience in Spy Radar systems to join our team at Wallops Island, VA. By joining our team, you’ll enhance US warfighting capabilities by supporting various NAVSEA and Program Executive Office Integrated Warfare Systems (PEO IWS) missions and projects performed at the Surface Combat Systems Center (SCSC). This is an SCA position. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in electronics repair, maintenance, and troubleshooting, particularly within advanced radar systems. Military experience, particularly in the United States Navy, is highly valued for this role, as it provides a unique understanding of radar systems used for surveillance and reconnaissance. This role is critical in ensuring the operational readiness and effectiveness of our radar technologies.

RESPONSIBILITIES: 

Installation and Maintenance: Install, maintain, and repair Spy Radar and Aegis systems, along with associated electronic equipment, to ensure optimal performance.
Troubleshooting: Diagnose and troubleshoot complex electronic issues related to radar systems, including signal processing and transmission problems.
Testing and Calibration: Conduct tests and calibrations on radar equipment, ensuring compliance with technical specifications and operational requirements.
Provide technical support and training to personnel on the proper use and maintenance of radar systems and Aegis technologies.
Documentation: Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, repairs, and system modifications in accordance with established protocols.
Work closely with engineering teams to support the development and integration of new radar technologies, including Aegis system enhancements and upgrades. Compliance: Ensure all work is performed in accordance with safety regulations and industry standards. Technicians read and interpret schematics and block diagrams and apply general working knowledge of electricity and electronics to repair equipment and interfacing devices. Localize malfunctions, repair or replace faulty parts or subassemblies, and align, adjust, calibrate, and perform corrective maintenance on navigation equipment.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: 

Education: High School/GED
Experience: 3+ years of experience as an electronics technician (or similar military rating), focusing on radar systems (I.E., Spy Radar, AEGIS, CIWS, etc.)
Clearance & Citizenship: Must have or be able to obtain & maintain a DOD Secret Clearance.
Technical/Software Proficiency: In-depth knowledge of radar system components, including antennas, signal processing units, and electronic circuit design, particularly in Aegis systems. Familiarity with radar system software and tools used for diagnostics, testing, and calibration, including tools relevant to Aegis systems.

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Military Service/Experience: Prior service in the United States Navy, preferably in an electronics or radar technician role, is highly preferred. Designations such as Electronics Technician, Submarine, Navigation (ETV), Interior Communication Electrician (IC), Fire Controlman Technician, or similar/related positions.
Certifications: Relevant certifications (e.g., Certified Electronics Technician (CET), Military Electronics Training) are a plus.

Hours: Candidates must be flexible, as shifts may vary between weekdays and weekends. There is also an opportunity to earn overtime to support mission requirements.

KBR Benefits​: KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development.​

title: Engineering Technician III
description:
Title:

Engineering Technician III

KBR’s Mission Engineering Division delivers complex technical solutions and expert support to the U.S. Department of Defense, specializing in modeling and simulation, cyber transformation, air vehicle mission integration, and lifecycle support. As a trusted partner with a proven history in mission technology, KBR collaborates closely with clients to develop innovative and effective solutions. With a strong ethical framework, KBR prioritizes data security, privacy, and responsible information management to ensure mission success.

KBR is seeking an Engineering Technician III to join our team supporting the Navy at Webster Field in St. Inigoes, Maryland. In this role, you will play a key part in the integration, testing, evaluation, installation, maintenance, and configuration of Area Control Systems (ACS) and Air Traffic Control (ATC) systems. Working closely with KBR’s ACS Hardware team and government representatives, you will contribute to the safe and efficient operation of critical mission systems. This position offers the opportunity to apply engineering principles in a hands-on technical environment while supporting the broader mission of national defense. We are looking for a candidate who is detail-oriented, collaborative, and eager to take ownership of technical challenges.

Roles and Responsibilities

Install, integrate, test, and evaluate ACS and ATC system hardware and components.
Perform routine to moderately complex maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair tasks following documented processes.
Configure system components including computers, switches, routers, firewalls, and related hardware.
Assemble and install equipment, parts, and supporting hardware as required.
Perform network cabling and ensure proper connectivity across system components.
Conduct equipment and system testing by following established test procedures.
Collaborate daily with KBR team members and Navy customer representatives to ensure successful operations.
Support field activities and travel up to 25% to perform system work at customer locations.

Basic Qualifications

Clearance & Citizenship: U.S. Citizenship required; ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret clearance.
Education: High School Diploma or GED.
Experience: 3–5 years of technical experience as an engineering technician or in a related technical role.
Certification(s): Security+ certification or ability to obtain within six months of hire.

Preferred Qualifications

CompTIA A+ certification.
Experience with the Standard Terminal Automation Replacement System (STARS) or other ATC platforms.
Previous experience supporting Navy or Department of Defense technical systems.

Compensation: $28.79/HR. This is an SCA Position.

Additional Compensation: KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

title: Electrical Engineer
description:
Title:

Electrical Engineer

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR is seeking an Electrical Engineer to supervise and lead a group of engineers and provides technical direction over a group and is responsible for training, mentoring and/or quality checking project deliverables from less experienced team members. You will plan, budget, organize, and control an important segment of a very extensive and highly diversified engineering program or an entire engineering scope. You may also be responsible for a measurable asset such as an assigned staff and budget.

Functional job responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

Must have experience leading teams of electrical engineers and designers on projects for constructing new and renovated industrial facilities. Preferably for the chemical biofuel, biochemical and/or refining industries

Experience is required related to the development of task analysis for engineering and design hours; working with project schedules and understanding the links to the other project disciplines; and tracking earned value on the completed electrical engineering and design

Strong communication skills are required along with the ability to work in a team environment

The candidate must be able to travel to client operating plants for client meetings and surveys of existing operating facilities. Travel may be by car or plane, and the candidate must be physically able to walk around industrial facilities and perform field surveys. Access to client sites will require a drug screen and background check and may require additional safety training, where needed.  PPE may be required for client sites.  

Professional Engineering (P.E.) license is preferred.

Must be proficient on the following technical topics: Power System Analysis, Front End Engineering & Design, Medium Voltage and Low Voltage Distribution Systems, Motors, Generators, Transformers, Switchgear, VFDs, UPSs, Heat Tracing, Lighting, Hazardous Area Classifications, ​Lightning Protection, Electrical Schematics, Physical Design Drawings, and the National Electrical Code.

Required Education, Experience, & Skills:

College degree, preferably in fields related to Engineering or Construction.

10+ years of experience required.

In lieu of formal education, 15 years of related experience.

Excellent communication skills.

Well versed in Microsoft suite of tools (Word, Excel, Power Point, Teams).

Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills:

Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering or equivalent work experience

15+ years of professional working experience

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. title: Associate Project Manager - Engineering
description:
Title:

Associate Project Manager - Engineering

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR is looking for an Associate, Project Manager - Engineering to execute all phases of planning of site medium projects (less than $100 million), administrative supervision of all KBR site engineering personnel.

This position is located in Corpus Christi, Tx. No relocation or per diem will be offered. Must be a US Citizen.

Functional job responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

Plans, organizes, coordinates and controls projects in accordance with the established policies, procedures, systems, and requirements approved by the company.

Has responsibility for day-to-day contact and communication with the client and focuses on providing client satisfaction.

Possesses knowledge of the respective industry. Supervises personnel assigned to the project through subordinate leaders.

May also serve as the proposal manager of medium-sized projects.

Job role has budgetary type of accountabilities.

Required Education, Experience, & Skills:

title: Senior Mechanical Engineer - Chemicals and Biofuels
description:
Title:

Senior Mechanical Engineer - Chemicals and Biofuels

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR is looking for a Chemical and Biofuels Mechanical Engineer to lead a large international chemical project.

·You must be a licensed Professional Engineer with proven track record of highly complex mechanical design efforts from conceptual design through construction support for world class Chemical and Biofuel clients. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity to be a part of a team leading new technology deployment on a wide range of sustainability initiatives for our key clients. In-depth knowledge of mechanical equipment normally found in the chemical industries and biofuels industries along with industry codes is critical to provide leadership on these challenging projects.

You will be expected to function primarily as a Lead Mechanical Engineer.

You are expected to function in a hybrid work environment and must have the ability to travel to client sites to attend walk-downs, kick-off meetings and design reviews.

Functional job responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

Early project planning and coordination while handling two to three small to mid-cap sized projects with ability to quickly provide engineering work hour estimates and risk memos.

Develop and manage the preparation, review and checking of mechanical specification packages in accordance with Client requirements and industry best practices.

Manage and successfully influence the entire procurement life cycle while working closely with all disciplines.

Ability to effectively manage building services groups such as Fire Protection, HVAC and plumbing as a work group lead.

Managing development of complex multi-discipline Construction packages including diagrams, drawings, equipment schedules, details, and Scopes of Work.

Maintain positive relationships with clients, vendors, and contractors in a professional manner.

Track Project Scope and Schedule and notify project manager of deviation from original design, budget, or schedule.

Required Education, Experience, & Skills 

Preferred bachelor's in mechanical engineering or another related field.

· 10+ years (minimum) of experience in the EPC industry or chemical / biofuels operating companies. Will consider experience with chemical site team or project engineering backgrounds in related industries. Operations / Maintenance and Reliability experience is a plus.

· Professional Engineering License (P.E.) is preferred.

· Proven experience with any of the following core areas:

o Broad experience with any chemical’s technologies and / or biofuels experience.

o Heat transfer technology and equipment such as boilers, heat exchangers, char boilers, gasification, mechanical vapor recompression systems etc.

o Large complex packaged equipment systems such as thermal oxidizers, cooling towers, process units, plastics handling packages, extruders, material handling packages for biomass etc.

· Working knowledge of other engineering disciplines while providing proactive leadership on all interdisciplinary design coordination efforts.

· Ability to travel as needed to survey client sites.

· Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with supervisory experience

Decarbonization – Energy Transition – Sustainability

title: Lead Machine Safety Engineer
description:
Title:

Lead Machine Safety Engineer

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR is looking for a Lead Machine Safety Engineer, to function as the overall technical lead while developing a core team to execute all aspects of the Machine Safety life cycle requirements in accordance with ISO 12100 AND ANSI B11.0 and other industry standards.  You will be expected to use your leadership skills developing the strategic execution for this design service for our clients worldwide. Certified Machine Safety Expert (CMSE) and Functional Safety Engineer (FSE) certifications will be required.  Your second role will be Reliability, Availability and Maintenance modelling, Lead Mechanical Engineer, Subject Matter Expert in pressure vessels, machinery, material handling equipment etc.

These roles are expected to function in a hybrid work environment and must have the ability to travel to client sites to perform the machine risk assessments and conduct follow-up safety function design review meetings.

Functional job responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

As the team leader, you will be expected to provide overall leadership to a multi-discipline team that creates a vision and core values for this high performing team.

Develop multi-discipline execution strategies for executing risk management projects under international standards such as ISO 12100 and ANSI B11.0.

Actively engage key clients while extending our already successful collaborative relationships into this new specialty design services arena.

Provide consultation to Engineering Leadership Team, KBR’s clients, and offices worldwide on an as needed basis.

Train and mentor early-to-mid career engineers in machine safety, risk assessments and RAM modelling when required.

Develop and manage machine safety risk program for office and KBR’s clients worldwide.

Act as subject matter expert (SME) for KBR worldwide.

Track Machine Risk Assessment program with use of dashboards to inform office leadership and clients overall health of program.

Fulfill a dual role within the Mechanical department when requested to maintain a balanced workload between projects.

Required Education, Experience, & Skills 

Preferred Bachelors’ in Mechanical Engineering or another related field.

10+ years (minimum) of experience in EPC industry. Will consider experience with chemical site team or project engineering backgrounds in related industries. Operations or Maintenance and Reliability experience is a plus.

Professional Engineering License (P.E.) is preferred.

Certification in Machine Safety from accredited certification organizations offering CMSS and CFSE certifications.

Working Experience with any of the following core areas:

Equipment safety assessments

Risk Assessments

Process Safety

Working knowledge of other engineering disciplines and the ability to coordinate with them to meet design requirements.

Ability to travel as needed to survey client sites.

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with supervisory experience

title: Senior Process Engineer (LNG, Team Lead)
description:
Title:

Senior Process Engineer (LNG, Team Lead)

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR is looking for a highly experienced Senior Process Engineer with a strong background in Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) and large-scale capital project execution. This role is responsible for leading and mentoring a team of process engineers, driving technical excellence, and ensuring the successful delivery of process engineering scope across multi-billion-dollar LNG projects. The Senior Process Engineer serves as a key technical leader, supporting project development from early concept through detailed engineering, construction, and commissioning.

Functional job responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

Leadership & Team Management

Lead and manage a group of process engineers, providing technical direction, mentoring, and performance feedback.

Coordinate workload distribution, resource planning, and staff development within the process engineering team.

Foster collaboration across engineering disciplines to ensure integrated and optimized project solutions.

Technical Expertise

Serve as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) in LNG liquefaction, regasification, storage, and associated utility systems.

Oversee process simulations, heat & material balances, equipment sizing, and PFD/P&ID development.

Review and approve key engineering deliverables, including process design packages, specifications, and datasheets.

Provide guidance on process safety, operability, and reliability in design.

Project Execution

Support project development through all phases, including feasibility studies, FEED, detailed engineering, and EPC execution.

Interface with clients, licensors, and vendors to align on technical requirements and ensure compliance with project objectives.

Lead technical risk assessments, HAZID, HAZOP, SIL studies, and other process safety reviews.

Ensure deliverables meet schedule, budget, and quality requirements for large capital projects.

Business & Strategic Impact

Contribute to technology evaluations, value engineering, and optimization studies for LNG processes.

Support business development efforts by providing technical input on proposals, estimates, and client presentations.

Champion innovation and continuous improvement in process engineering practices.

Required Education, Experience, & Skills:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Chemical Engineering or related field.

Professional Engineer (PE) license preferred.

10+ years of process engineering experience, with at least 5 years in LNG design and operations.

Proven experience leading engineering teams on large-scale (> $500MM) capital projects, preferably LNG liquefaction or regasification.

Strong knowledge of process simulation tools (e.g., Aspen HYSYS, PRO/II).

Demonstrated expertise in process safety and regulatory compliance.

Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder management skills.

Decarbonization – Energy Transition – Sustainability

Independently perform all aspects of the Mechanical handling  activities for Detailed Engineering projects involving both FPSOs and Offshore Platforms.
Plans, schedules, and conducts work requiring judgment in the independent evaluation, selection, and adaptation of engineering techniques, procedures, and criteria.

title: Spacecraft Subsystem SME
description:
Title:

Spacecraft Subsystem SME

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

KBR is seeking a motivated and experienced spacecraft or spacecraft subsystem SME to join our team in El Segundo, CA.

KBR is the prime contractor on the Military Satellite Communications (MILSATCOM) Systems Engineering, Integration and Test (MSEIT) contract. By applying to this position, you are in consideration for KBR employment; however, you also have the option to be hired by one of our subcontractor teammates.

The MSEIT effort provides leading-edge Systems Engineering & Integration (SE&I) for the United States Space Force’s (USSF) Space Systems Command (SSC). We acquire state-of-the-art Military and Commercial Satellite Communications (SATCOM) systems, providing global secure, survivable, and protected communications for our nation’s warfighters. We seek technical individuals who will thrive in a highly collaborative work environment of small teams, using the most modern tools and methodologies to tackle the challenges of integrating complex space and ground communications systems.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key Responsibilities:

Provide the technical leadership and assessment for the ESS Program Office in the prime contractor delivery of the space vehicle in the area of Mechanical, Electrical or Test
Lead the trades for unit and subsystem designs if necessary, integration and testing into the spacecraft bus, payload and space vehicle
Ensure the technical design and interfaces within the space vehicle, along with the ground and terminal segments
Support all component and unit test programs, including space qualification testing ensuring survivability in the space environments.  Develop test documentations, e.g. test plan and reports as necessary
Support the space vehicle test program, ensuring survivability in the space environments.  Develop test documentations, e.g. test plan and reports as necessary
Building and maintaining strong, collaborative relationships with various government customer organizations, contractors, and FFRDC teammates

Work Environment:

Location:  On-site
Travel Requirements:  Infrequent
Working Hours:  Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

An active Secret Clearance is required for this position.  Ability to obtain, or currently cleared for TS/SCI is a plus. 
BS in technical field, such as engineering, mathematics, physics, software or computer science
15 years’ experience with spacecraft bus or subsystems, or Master’s degree and 12 years’ experience
Previous proven coordination experience
Effective communication (both written and oral), and interpersonal skills.
Ability to perform in highly visible and stressful situations
DOD or IC space experience preferred
Space systems engineering experience desired at the unit, subsystem, spacecraft or space vehicle levels
Requirement to work on site at LAAFB 100%. Remote work unavailable
Approximately 10% travel within Southern California and CONUS, depending on prime contractor selection of unit suppliers

Basic Compensation:  $150,000 to $229,000 in California

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Ready to Make a Difference? If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team.

KBR Benefits  

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Junior Software QA Engineer
description:
Title:

Junior Software QA Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

KBR (formerly LinQuest) is the prime contractor on the MSEIT contract. By applying to this position, you are in consideration for KBR employment. However, you also have the option to be hired by one of our subcontractor teammates.

You will join a systems engineering team defining the next generation of space communication systems supporting US Space Force (USSF) satellite communications. You will support Systems Engineering & Integration (SE&I) activities in a multidisciplinary and collaborative environment. You will interface and collaborate with SE&I team members, contractors, government civilians and members of the USSF. You will lead and support several working groups responsible for leading technical discussion, resolve and identify risk, requirement gaps, developing briefings, writing, and tracking action items, and authoring meeting minutes.

The MILSATCOM Systems Engineering, Integration, and Test (MSEIT) effort provides leading edge Systems Engineering & Integration (SE&I) for the US Space Force’s Space Systems Center (SSC). We support the Space Force’s acquisition of state of the art satellite communications systems, providing global secure, survivable, and protected communications for our nation’s warfighters. We seek technical individuals who will thrive in a highly collaborative work environment of small teams, using the most modern tools and methodologies to tackle the challenges of integrating complex space and ground communications systems.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key Responsibilities:

Analyze and test software prototypes and/or applications as part of a multi-disciplinary team.
Collaborate across infrastructure, development, and QA teams.  Work closely with software developers and other stakeholders to understand software requirements and specifications.
Maintain automated testing suites, detailed test plans, test cases, test scripts, test reports, and other documentation.
Identify software defects and issues, communicate defect reports, and provide detailed information on defect occurrences.
Perform root cause analysis of defects and implement corrective actions.
Conduct performance testing through load testing, stress testing, and scalability testing to ensure that applications can handle expected user loads without compromising speed or stability.
Work with complex algorithms to deliver optimized solutions for the end user.

Work Environment:

Location: On-site/Hybrid
Travel Requirements: Minimal
Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

Security Clearance: Ability to obtain and maintain a Secret clearance is required for this position
Experience and Education: BS degree in Computer Science or Information Systems; other degrees will be considered with relevant work experience
1-3 years of software development, including object-oriented design, coding, and/or testing, with a focus on QA methodologies, tools, and processes.
Solid understanding of test development and test execution.
Working knowledge of performance testing, security testing, and usability testing.
Practical experience in one or more of the following: Python, Java, or Go.
Working knowledge of automated testing tools like Selenium or Cypress.
Excellent problem-solving skills.
Strong passion for conducting research, tackling complex problems, and continuously learning and adopting new technologies.
Organization capability with ability to handle competing priorities.
Strong interpersonal skills, communication (oral and written), and presentation skills.

Desired:

Familiarity with web applications and microservices architecture.
Familiarity with database technologies such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, and others.
Knowledge and experience in Jira and Confluence.
Experience in implementing Agile Software Development methodologies for efficient and iterative project management.
Proficient in using GitLab or other Tools for version control, CI/CD pipelines, and collaboration.

Basic Compensation:  $84,000 - $104,000 in California

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Ready to Make a Difference? If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team.

description:
Title:

Junior Software Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

KBR (formerly LinQuest) is the prime contractor on the MSEIT contract. By applying to this position, you are in consideration for KBR employment. However, you also have the option to be hired by one of our subcontractor teammates.

You will join a systems engineering team defining the next generation of space communication systems supporting US Space Force (USSF) satellite communications. You will support Systems Engineering & Integration (SE&I) activities in a multidisciplinary and collaborative environment. You will interface and collaborate with SE&I team members, contractors, government civilians and members of the USSF. You will lead and support several working groups responsible for leading technical discussion, resolve and identify risk, requirement gaps, developing briefings, writing, and tracking action items, and authoring meeting minutes.

The MILSATCOM Systems Engineering, Integration, and Test (MSEIT) effort provides leading edge Systems Engineering & Integration (SE&I) for the US Space Force’s Space Systems Center (SSC). We support the Space Force’s acquisition of state of the art satellite communications systems, providing global secure, survivable, and protected communications for our nation’s warfighters. We seek technical individuals who will thrive in a highly collaborative work environment of small teams, using the most modern tools and methodologies to tackle the challenges of integrating complex space and ground communications systems.

location:
locations

Alice Springs, Northern Territory, Australia
description:
Title:

Procurement Specialist

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

KBR is seeking a diligent Procurement Specialist to support our National Security Solutions (NSS), Procurement Department. The Procurement Specialist will be responsible for purchasing and negotiating materials, equipment, and supplies from suppliers in accordance with company policies and Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR). They will rely on instructions and pre-established guidelines to perform job functions.  

Job Duties/Responsibilities:

Job duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:

Negotiates favorable terms, volume discounts and long-term contracts with suppliers for the procurement of goods, services and supplies

Takes responsibility for purchases in support of customer-related business processes or for internal use

Discusses defects and delivery problems with suppliers, and is responsible for negotiating refunds

Coordinates with operations, maintenance, warehouse and engineering to ensure proper scheduling and movement of goods and supplies. Under general supervision, solves complex problems requiring detailed knowledge of field and industry best practices

Uses experience and problem-solving skills to develop and improve processes

May provide guidance to less experienced team members

Review and approve supplier invoices with KBR’s Accounts Payable Department

Provide input to Supplier Performance Evaluations

Required Education & Experience:

This position requires US Citizenship or Permanent Resident status due to the sensitivity of customer related information

Skills required for this job are typically acquired through the completion of an undergraduate degree and 5+ years of experience

Should have a thorough understanding of FAR, DFARS and NAICS; commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures within Government Prime Contractor purchasing

Must be organized, detail oriented and demonstrate strong time management skills and be able to coordinate and prioritize multiple projects with general supervision in a fast-paced environment

Have excellent written and verbal communication skills and be able to adapt to changing work efforts and manage shifting priorities

Must be able to develop and maintain professional relationships with peers, suppliers, and customers, and contribute to a professional work environment by demonstrating integrity, teamwork, and a positive attitude

Working knowledge of MS Office - Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint

Must have problem-solving skills to develop and improve processes

Knowledge of Contractor Purchasing System Review (CPSR) procedures

Security Requirements

Candidates must possess or have the ability to obtain a Top Secret/Sensitive Compartmented Information (TS/SCI) clearance or an Australian TS/PV clearance. A polygraph examination may be required as part of the US clearance process.  

This is a contingent position based upon contract award

This role will be located in Alice Springs, at a 4,400-acre facility with approximately 687,000 square feet of mission and support space.  This position is expected to be onsite 100%.

You’re a skilled Vehicle Mechanic with a strong background in diagnosing, repairing, and maintaining a wide range of vehicles to ensure they operate at peak performance. With expertise in engine systems, electrical components, hydraulics, and more, you’re committed to safety, reliability, and efficiency in every repair. Your hands-on experience and problem-solving abilities ensure that vehicles remain ready for critical missions and operations.

At KBR, you bring attention to detail, technical proficiency, and a dedication to high standards. Known for your thoroughness and ability to work under pressure, you effectively troubleshoot issues, perform preventive maintenance, and collaborate with a team to support mission success. Using manual and computerized diagnostic methods to identify potential problems in a vehicle.

Explaining mechanical problems and possible solutions to customers.

Testing parts and systems to ensure they work correctly.

Ensuring all critical parts are checked and tested.

Performing basic automotive care, including changing oil and rotating tires.

title: Senior Pipeline Designer
location:
locations
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
description:
Title:

Senior Pipeline Designer

"Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR !

The KBR team of teams delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets."

Job Description- Senior Pipeline Designer

Position Title: Senior Pipeline Designer
Company: KBR Corporate – In-house Engineering
Location: Abu Dhabi, UAE 

Job Purpose

Execute pipeline design activities within Concept, FEED (Front-End Engineering Design) and Detail Engineering for Oil & Gas projects.
Ensure high-quality, safe, and timely delivery of pipeline design and related deliverables in accordance with project requirements, international codes, and standards.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior engineers and coordinate with multi-discipline teams and clients.

Key Job Responsibilities

Independently perform the pipeline design scope drawings for Concept, FEED and Detail Engineering phases.
Ensure compliance with applicable codes and standards (e.g., ASME B31.4, B31.8, API RP 1101, etc.) and project specifications.
Coordinate and interface with process, piping, mechanical, instrumentation, electrical, materials & corrosion, safety, construction, geotechnical, structural and civil teams to resolve technical issues.
Mentor and train junior engineers; provide technical reviews and feedback.
Ensure engineering integrity, quality assurance and document control for all pipeline-related deliverables.
Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives, toolbox talks, and knowledge sharing.
Support field execution and construction activities as needed, including site visits when required and as-built documentation.

Experience

12+ years of experience and proven track record in delivering onshore pipeline deliverables in Concept, FEED and Detail Engineering and EPCM experience in the Oil & Gas industry.
Key Requirement 1: Previous ADNOC EPC experience + familiarity with ADNOC procedures & requirement (procurement, permitting, interfaces, etc.) is highly preferred. 
Key Requirement 2: Highly capable and efficient in preparing (hands-on) all onshore pipeline engineering drawings independently and simultaneously working on multiple pipeline projects. Owns assigned tasks with high degree of responsibility. Flexibility & adaptability to maneuver dynamic and evolving project environment. 
Key Requirement 3: Experienced in Iraq field development projects. 
Experience in onshore pipeline constructability is highly desirable.
Familiarity / experience in offshore pipeline and subsea engineering is a bonus.

Education & Qualifications

Minimum Diploma, Preferably Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (e.g. Pipeline, Mechanical or similar applicable degree).
Proven pipeline drawing software proficiency (eg. AutoCAD Plant 3D, Microstation, etc.) 

Technical Skills

Strong knowledge of pipeline drafting standards and industry applicable norms.
Proficient in relevant codes and standards (e.g., ASME B31.4, B31.8; API standards;).
Experience with 3D design and visualization tools and 2D drafting.
Familiarity with pipeline material specifications, line lists, and isometrics.
Knowledge of HSE practices & requirements and risk assessment methodologies applicable to design and construction phases.

Soft Skills

Integrity: upholding engineering integrity amidst challenging priorities.
Communication: clear and concise communication with internal teams and clients; effective technical writing and presentation skills.
Problem Solving: strong analytical and troubleshooting capabilities.
Adaptability: comfortable operating in dynamic project environments and across multiple projects.

What We Offer:

Opportunities for professional development and career advancement in a challenging work environment.
Engaging and collaborative work environment with a commitment to safety and sustainability.

KBR’s Global Asset Management (GAM) group provides comprehensive manufacturing and supply chain solutions globally, serving both commercial and government clients. With a wide range of services including Government Property Management, Production Maintenance, and Equipment Tracking, GAM is dedicated to ensuring excellence in every aspect of the supply chain and asset management process. This commitment ensures the seamless operation of our clients' enterprises across diverse locations.

Job Summary

As the Government Property Supervisor, you will support the Government Property Manager in conducting Customer and DCMA audits to ensure compliance with Material Management standards, including those related to capital assets and US Government Property Audits. You will also provide coaching, guidance, and support across all functions and levels within the site organization. Your responsibilities will include setting unit objectives, developing work plans and schedules, and ensuring that resources are available to meet established requirements and assignments. Are you prepared to thrive in this crucial position? Submit your application today and make an impact!

Roles and Responsibilities 

Ensure adherence to FAR 52.245-1 Government Property standards, demonstrating regulatory compliance expertise.
Assist with or oversee Self-Assessments of the 10 Government Property Management Outcomes outlined in FAR, especially FAR 45 and 52.245-1.
Supervise staff by delegating work assignments, providing training, conducting evaluations, and offering coaching.
Participate in budgeting, scheduling, planning, and reporting activities to align with objectives.
Set unit objectives, develop work plans and schedules, and ensure the availability of essential resources to meet requirements and assignments.
Create and compile metrics and reports using Visual Management techniques and analyze metric data to enhance existing processes.

Basic Qualifications 

This is a hands-on supervisory position that requires practical knowledge of day-to-day property management functions and demonstrated experience in commercial and government environments. Candidates must have direct involvement in operational processes, not just oversight or theoretical knowledge.

Must be a U.S. Citizen.
Bachelor’s degree along with and 6 years of relevant experience.
Alternatively, a High School Diploma or equivalent with 8 years of related experience.
3 years of experience in managing a team or personnel.
Proficiency in FAR 52.245-1 Government Property standards.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience managing Aerospace property owned by the US Government and customers, overseeing contracts, and providing support for Government/DCMA and Customer On-Site & Limited Surveys.
Current Certified Professional Property Specialist (CPPS) certification from the National Property Management Association (NPMA), or ability to obtain within one year.
Proficiency in SAP or eQuip software.

description:
Title:

Joint/COCOM Account Executive

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

The Joint/COCOM Account Executive (AE) will play a pivotal role in advancing KBR’s mission within the Office of the Secretary of War (OSW) Research & Engineering (R&E), Mission Capabilities (MC), Science & Technology (S&T), and Critical Technologies (CT) and reporting agencies, connecting Joint Forces and Combatant Commands with new technologies and capabilities.  The selected candidate must possess an understanding of Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff (CJCS) and Combatant Command (COCOM) environments. This includes a basic knowledge of Joint Operations and Requirements addressing integration challenges in support of COCOMs Operations by establishing strong working relationships with senior leaders and decision-makers across the OSW R&E, Joint & Combatant Commands, the Department of War (Defense), the Intelligence Community, and other federal agencies in the Washington DC area. This role is responsible for strengthening KBR’s customer relationships and driving business growth across the company’s Air, Space, and Intelligence portfolios in support of OSW R&E, Joint, and COCOM-related national security programs, services, and solutions.

Key Responsibilities:

Account Management: Oversee and manage critical OSW/Joint/COCOM accounts in national security programs ensuring client satisfaction, retention, and growth. Develop, manage, and implement account strategies to meet client needs and achieve business growth objectives. 

Develop and strengthen a trusted relationship with current and potential KBR customers while serving as the primary company executive representative.
Ensure a coherent and integrated KBR message to the customer while promoting corporate capabilities and solutions to meet customer needs.
Build, improve, and manage significant key individual customer relationships.
Promote and introduce corporate capabilities, technologies, services, and solutions to the customer.
Possess an in-depth understanding of the customer's missions and KBR services, solutions, and products.
Possess an in-depth understanding of the competitive landscape, including competitors and potential partners.
Develop, track, and execute a strategic-level Customer Engagement Plan, including regular, periodic meetings with strategically relevant influencers, decision-makers, and leaders.
Host senior customer visits to KBR and arrange visits to customer sites, as appropriate.
Function as senior representative responsible for customer engagement and government relations related to customer matters, issues, and concerns, including approved conventions and symposia.

Business Development: Identify, qualify (MileStone-0), and pursue new business opportunities within accounts and potential new clients in the Joint/COCOM markets (Horizon 2: 12 – 18 Months out). Align engagement strategies with developing new business opportunities throughout the growth lifecycle (Beginning, Middle, and End Game). Lead positioning, solutions, and thought leadership opportunities, in coordination with MARCOM, through strategic customer outreach (Trade shows, Symposiums, Panel Moderation, Social Media Presence, and other Government and Industry outreach). Create and assist in creating white papers, thought leadership pieces, proposals, and other artifacts that position KBR as a leader in the areas aligned with growth objectives. 

Define KBR to the customer by communicating the full breadth and depth of KBR’s services and solutions that can support their missions.
Define the customer to KBR Business Area and Growth stakeholders to ensure a comprehensive understanding of customer needs and trends.
Track pertinent account information horizontally across all KBR Groups and communicate it to leaders to aid in business development, capture, and program execution.
Provide senior customers an avenue to communicate satisfaction or dissatisfaction with the KBR program and contract performance.
Communicate internally across KBR by hosting monthly Account Calls to facilitate planning and execution, coordinating engagement and events, tracking account financial performance, disseminating customer information, and monitoring emerging opportunities and strategies.
Tracking account financial performance, disseminating customer information, and monitoring emerging opportunities, issues, and results.
Build a sense of community among KBR for Joint and COCOM stakeholders.
To promote KBR brand awareness and technology leadership, exercise active thought leadership through speaking, writing, and personal communications.

Strategic Planning: Collaborate with internal teams to develop NSS Strategy and execute strategic account plans. Develop and refine OSW R&E, Joint, and COCOM Staff account strategies aligned with KBR and NSS growth objectives. Analyze market trends, competitor activities, and client needs within the community to identify growth opportunities. Develop and execute engagement strategies focused on NSS strategic priorities.  Work with MARCOM and cross-functional teams on KBR brand recognition initiatives and positioning KBR as a thought leader and market driver. Provide feedback and insights to drive KBR investments that are aligned with accounts. 

Inform the annual strategic planning process by providing insights into trends, requirements, challenges, and opportunities.
Help develop new ideas and solutions to capture new business. Contribute to strategic planning by providing insights into changes in joint defense, intelligence, and federal government missions, acquisition, procurement, contracting approaches, and funding profiles.
Identify requirements and create novel solutions for OSW R&E, Joint clients, and COCOM partners and affiliated government agencies.
Demonstrate critical thinking, assessment, and analysis of published articles, plans, speeches, and doctrine.

Client Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with clients focused on critical customers aligned with NSS strategic priorities. Serve as the primary point of contact, addressing client inquiries, resolving issues, and providing exceptional customer service. In coordinating with the relevant Profit & Loss VPs, manage customer relationships and engagement strategies aligned with strategic objectives.  Ensure engagement strategies provide continuous and consistent engagement and touch points across crucial account stakeholders.

Compliance and Risk Management: Ensure all account activities comply with company policies, industry regulations, and contractual obligations. Identify and mitigate potential risks to the business.

Work Environment:

Location: Hybrid (National Capital Region presence needed)
Travel requirements: 25%
Working hours: Standard

Required Qualifications:

Must be eligible for a U.S. Government Top Secret clearance with SCI access
Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, engineering, or a related field
20+ years of experience (10+ years of industry experience and 10+ years of experience in business development). Equivalent Government experience in the NCR within one year of active service be considered 
Industry experience includes strategic policy, planning and/or orchestrating Joint/COCOM focused operations at the Operational and Strategic environments as a senior leader serving on COCOM or Interagency Staffs OR minimum; account management, sales, and business development, aligned with OSW R&E and Joint accounts
Understanding of Joint Staff/COCOM technology and employment requirements accounting for US Air Force, US Space Force, US Navy, US Marine Corps, US Army capabilities along with key allied and coalition partners
Experience working within a minimum of two COCOMs OR experience with one COCOM and working with OSW R&E, interagency, and/or CJCS Staff
Understanding of and experience in integrating Intelligence Community (IC) capabilities to enable National Defense and Joint/COCOM operations and future concepts
Proven track record of managing key accounts/large and complex programs and achieving growth objectives or describe how candidate would implement this approach
Strong understanding of the Joint/COCOM experimentation and linkages to service acquisition processes to accelerate innovation deploying new capabilities, including industry trends and competitive landscape
Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills with experience presenting to executive levels
Ability to think strategically and develop innovative solutions to complex problems
Strong analytical skills and proficiency in growth forecasting and reporting
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in INDOPACOM within the last ten years
Master’s preferred, MBA highly desirable
Active TS/SCI clearance preferred

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40 hours per week.

Basic Compensation:  $202,000.00 - $278,000.00

(This range is for the Colorado area only).

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

title: Senior Proposal Specialist
description:
Title:

Senior Proposal Specialist

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

KBR is seeking a talented and dynamic Proposal Specialist to join our National Security Solutions (NSS) Group. NSS provides high-end engineering, intelligence, cyber security, missile defense, and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. An active Top Secret security clearance is required.

The Proposal Specialist will assist Proposal Managers in preparation of Requests for Proposal (RFP), Requests for information (RFI), and other related customer response deliverables to Federal government agencies and/or partners. The Proposal Specialist will be an integral member of the Proposal Services team working with Proposal Managers/Coordinators, Subject Matter Experts (SMEs), and business partners to win new business and execute KBR’s strategic vision.

The Proposal Specialist will focus on the proposal and requirements compliance, adherence to the approved proposal preparation/review schedule. The Proposal Specialist will help refine cohesive proposal themes and potential discriminators; coordinate the day-to-day proposal preparation process and provide timely responses to requests for supporting material. The Proposal Specialist, when assigned, will also be able to write and edit proposal sections with emphasis on Management, Past Performance and Corporate Experience volume, and Resumes.

Responsibilities include:

Supports the assigned Capture and/or Proposal Manager on strategic proposals in developing and maintaining the proposal plan, schedule, outline, action item lists, and their associated deadlines; provide team communication and tracking support; coordinate and track the progress of documents and other materials through the proposal process.
Collaborate with key members of the team to include BD/Capture/Proposal Team members, Operations, Contracts, SMEs, and subcontractors to get the information needed to prepare a compliant, compelling, and complete response.
Manage, write, and edit proposal sections with emphasis on the Past Performance and Corporate Experience volume, Resumes, and Plans (Security, Safety, OCI, etc.), ensuring compliance and complete understanding of the solicitation and FAR requirements.
Coordinates Past Performance Questionnaires (PPQs) if required by the solicitation.
Synthesizes, interprets, and translates RFP requirements and proposal submission instructions.
Creates proposal outlines with instructions to assist technical authors based on compliance matrix.
Under direction, coordinates with subcontractors to ensure their capability is integrated into the effort. 
May coordinate and document results of meetings.
Prints and copies documents for meetings, proposal reviews, or delivery to customer.
May create and/or assists in development of graphics/visuals and information tables for proposals.
May perform internal research and document capability or past performance.
May assist in organizing corporate capabilities or other proposal content. 
May support development of white papers, sources sought/RFIs, and market research.
Creates innovative ways to improve the proposal development process.
Supports the structuring of the standard proposal center operations, including file sharing, templates, model content, and subcontractor integration.
Uploads / Maintains submitted proposals and responses to the company’s knowledge management database/library.
May perform desktop publishing duties (graphics, editing, formatting) and coordinate the final proposal submission.
Provides feedback and lessons learned to help improve the quality of proposal responses, boilerplate content, tools, and processes.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Journalism, Marketing, Communications or related field
5 years of experience performing proposal development roles for one or more Federal Contractors
Willingness to flex work schedule (when coordinated in advance) to meet proposal objectives
Highly experienced with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project) and Adobe products
Excellent writing, editing, and communication skills, with the ability to write and edit technical and non-technical content.
Proficient in Microsoft Office and federal proposal development software, such as Adobe Acrobat and SharePoint

Preferred Qualifications and Skills Requirements:

Association of Proposal Management Professionals (APMP) Certification
7+ years of proposal development experience.
Experience working as a Proposal Lead on smaller proposal efforts.
Has worked in the intelligence, cyber, information technology and/or space environments.
Demonstrated ability to write with clarity and articulate value and advantages.
Microsoft TEAMS or SharePoint administration
Prefers to work in collaborative team environment.
Graphics development experience is a plus with working knowledge of Illustrator.

Security Clearance Requirements:

Active Top Secret clearance (with SCI eligibility preferred)

Work Environment:

Location: Hybrid
Travel Requirements: Minimal, up to 10%
Working Hours: Standard
