title: Advanced Aerospace Model Based Systems Engineer (MBSE)
description:
Title:

Advanced Aerospace Model Based Systems Engineer (MBSE)

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

KBR’s Digital Research, Engineering, Acquisition, and Materiel Management Team (DREAMM Team) provides comprehensive Systems Engineering, Digital Engineering, Model Based Systems Engineering, Modeling & Simulation, Data Analysis, DevSecOps, technical solution development, and training capabilities, serving our DoD customers. With a wide range of services and contract options, the DREAMM Team is dedicated to ensuring excellence in every aspect of our customer’s Digital Transformation journey, including strategy and implementation plan development, technical execution, and training and development courses. This commitment ensures smooth and manageable design, implementation, test and deployment of technical solutions, streamlined processes, and digital methods and approaches.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Job Summary

Are you ready to embark on a journey where your expertise meets meaningful impact? As an Advanced Aerospace Model-Based Systems Engineer, you’ll engage in system design, requirements analysis, and engineering challenges related to modernizing and sustaining advanced aircraft and systems for Air Force Life Cycle Management Center (AFLCMC) programs. Join our team at KBR supporting AFLCMC and be at the forefront of modeling, designing, and engineering near-term and future advanced aircraft capabilities, contributing to our ongoing success. You’ll collaborate closely with a diverse team, fostering innovation, disciplined problem-solving, and excellence at every step. If you’re ready to make a difference and thrive in a dynamic environment, apply now and let’s shape the future together!

Key Responsibilities:

Analyze, model, design, and engineer current aircraft capabilities and future upgrades for AFLCMC programs.
Design, build, and apply digital methods to the acquisition process to enhance future aircraft capabilities.
Manage system models using Systems Modeling Language (SysML) and tools such as Cameo System Modeler.
Lead the implementation of large-scale system models across multiple organizations.
Modify and update system models to reflect current acquisition strategies, technical designs, and system decisions
Define system use cases, activities, and system behaviors.
Support management of models and derived work products consistent with project configuration and data management processes and standards.
Develop scripts and/or applications to implement needed features and UI elements enabling seamless data integration, better usability, and streamlined accessibility.
Collaborate with systems engineering leads as well as domain and discipline subject matter experts (SMEs) to tailor MBSE to project scope and cost and schedule constraints.
Translate processes from traditional document-based system engineering efforts to delivery of model-based work products to customers, including the generation of acquisition documents
Work in a fast-paced environment, coordinating across diverse teams to ensure efficient development and integration of systems.

Work Environment:

Location: Hybrid
Travel Requirements: Minimal 0-20%
Working Hours: Standard

Required Qualifications:

BS Degree in Engineering or applied science
At least 10 years of related system modeling experience
Experience with SysML and tools like Cameo System Modeler/MagicDraw.
Expertise in modeling complex systems and managing enterprise models.
Ability to work in a collaborative, high-paced environment.

Ability to obtain and maintain DoD secret Clearance

Desired:

MS Degree in technical engineering field.
Software development skills in Python, C, and/or C++
OCSMP-MBF Certification (Object Management Group - Certified Systems Modeling Professional – Model Builder – Fundamental) or the ability to obtain it within 12 months of employment.
Experience with aircraft engineering or large-scale system modeling.
Expertise in modeling complex systems and managing enterprise models.
DoD weapon systems engineering and acquisition experience

title: Systems Engineer
description:
Title:

Systems Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

KBR is seeking a Systems Engineer (SE) to support the SSPO Systems Engineering and Integration Division. The Systems Engineer is a technical/engineering professional who performs system or enterprise level systems engineering across the life cycle on complex Space Systems acquisition processes.  The SE provides expert advice and manages systems engineering processes and implementation for System Program Office (SPO)-developed collection system, including space vehicle, payloads, and associated ground command and control elements.  Requires experience in multiple aspects of the program systems engineering life cycle to aid the customer’s  SPO in the acquisition, verification and validation, and initialization of current programs.  The position includes requirements management, interface definition, customer engagement, and proposal technical evaluation support.  The position requires a moderate level of knowledge in modern model-based systems engineering (MBSE) techniques in order to aid the customer’s SPO in appropriately applying digital engineering to their next-generation program.  Member should be able to translate program capabilities into required architectural products.

Key Responsibilities:

Manage and develop requirements from higher level Enterprise governing documents to the Segment level and lower

Support relevant specification development and test planning activities across the enterprise and with development contractors

Lead coordination and completion of segment specification sell-off, along with other verification and validation activities

Coordinate across the SP for any proposed specification changes and facilitate integration of changes into the baseline

Lead the transition and stand-up of the above specification management activities into an appropriately scoped and purposed MBSE framework

Develop model queries and supporting documentation to enable use of model results

Plan MBSE model development in support of systems engineering objectives and program milestones

Identify and assess segment-level impacts of new capabilities, including across specification, internal and external interfaces, and facilitate integration into the current program baseline

Identify risks to mission closure in the collection segment and evaluate proposed burn-down plans

Liaise with mission analysis and acquisition teams to ensure completeness across the acquisition

Leverage a variety of software tools including DOORS, and perform analysis and automation of tasks

Support customer design reviews, providing technical insight to evaluate developer design

Lead integration of new capabilities to the program baseline

Manage external interface definition and coordination of changes with external stakeholders and developer

Provide technical insight into evaluations of developer proposals

Support customer in CONOP development

Support initialization and on-orbit calibration and validation activities

Support ground site integration and test activities

Develop productive relationships with development contractor counterparts, functional counterparts, and other spacecraft, payload and ground subject matter experts

Advise and mentor customer personnel regarding segment architecture, specification, verification and validation

Other duties as specified by the customer

Work Environment:

Location: On-site

Travel Requirements: Up to 25%

Working Hours: Core hour support required

Qualifications:

Required:

Active TS/SCI with polygraph clearance

Bachelor’s degree in STEM (science, technical, engineering, math) or related discipline with at least 10 years of relevant experience

Demonstration knowledge of MBSE at program through architecture level

Basic understanding of DOD/IC satellite systems and architectures

Excellent interpersonal, leadership, team building and problem solving skills with a demonstrated ability to be independent and effective in a government/contractor team environment

Experience in DOD/IC acquisition and program management processes

Excellent oral and written communication skills

Excellent oral and written communication skills

Demonstrated sustained superior performance

Available to travel domestically

Education and experience with MBSE for requirements management

title: Senior HVAC Engineer
description:
Title:

Senior HVAC Engineer

The HVAC Lead Engineer  shall have 10-15 years of hands-on experience in Concept / Detailed design and engineering functions of HVAC systems preferable in the Oil & Gas and Hydrocarbon domain. He or she should be capable of leading a team of design engineers and modellers  to complete the deliverables within Schedule and budget.

The Candidate shall be a self-starter and manage communication with all stakeholders including Client, Contractor, vendor, etc independently. He should be able to take independent decisions to support the project requirement and be accountable.

Skillsets

Prepare / Review heat load calculations, ventilation calculations, pressure drop calculations for ducting and piping, duct sizing, pipe sizing, etc.
Preparation of Air Flow Diagrams,  P & ID’s, Equipment and duct layout, piping layout, etc. Exposure to Offshore projects like Fixed Platforms, FPSOs is an added advantage.

Independently to prepare Technical bid Evaluation for HVAC System including equipment and accessories.

Knowledge in Design Software like Carrier HAP, Trane Trace

Participation in the progress and coordination meetings of the project.
Necessary coordination with vendors and other department for related interfaces as applicable.
Interface directly with clients and other stakeholders.
Preparing technical proposals and reports.

title: Principal Technical Professional - Static
description:
Title:

Principal Technical Professional - Static

Under general supervision, independently applies advanced engineering techniques, makes decisions on engineering problems and methods, and represents the organization in conferences to resolve important questions or to negotiate with key Engineers and officials of other organizations.
Subject matter expert in Process Equipment that includes but not limited to Pressure Vessels, Spheres, Storage Tanks, Process Columns, Column Internals, Reactors, Scrubbers, Unfired Heat Transfer equipment, Electric Heaters, Silos, Bins, Mounded Vessels, Pig Launchers and Receivers.
Provides technical guidance to designers and less experienced engineers and is consulted extensively by associates and others with a high degree of reliance placed on scientific interpretations and advice.
Job role is responsible for a measurable asset such as an assigned staff and budget.
Willing to travel globally and undertake short term assignments with other KBR offices/ client offices or with project site facility as needed to support projects.
Responsible for effectively meeting the Project schedules and able to suggest improvement methods for effective handling of Projects.

SKILLS

Skills are typically acquired through a graduation in Mechanical or allied Engineering with a minimum of 12 years of demonstrated experience and average experience ranging from 12 – 18 years.

Hands-on experience with FEED and EPC/EPCM activities including but not limited preparation of Material Requisition, Technical Specification, Design using ASME, API and other International Codes/ Standard, Mechanical Data Sheets, Supplier offer review, Technical Bid Evaluation, Vendor Documents Review and Interfaces with Inter disciplines as required. At least 8 years of experience in EPC is preferred. Experience in fabrication Industry is a plus.
Experience in PMC projects (a plus).
Experience in the mechanical design of heat exchangers (a plus).
Shall be able to lead a team of Engineers/Designers and to effectively communication/ work with other KBR Centers and Client; Willing to work as a Requisition Engineer as well if Project demands; Responsible for the hours estimate and hours allocation to the resources allocated to Project, based on the tasks and effective completion of the tasks within budgeted hours.
Good oral and written communication skills.

title: Technical Writer (Fed Civ)
description:
Title:

Technical Writer (Fed Civ)

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR.

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers.  But we all share one goal:  to improve the world responsibly and safely.

KBR is seeking a skilled and experienced Technical Writer with a strong background in developing and writing Federal Civilian (Fed Civ) proposals.  The ideal candidate will have proven experience in working with Solution Architects and Subject Matter Experts to develop and deliver compelling proposal narratives. A technically adept individual, able to draft technical narratives from interviews with SMEs, will be ideal for this role.

Candidate will be responsible for the development and curation of technical content, leveraging information gathered via multiple methods (interviews, research, content review) and turning it into compelling and compliant proposal content. The role requires the ability to extract solution and win theme information from Capture Teams, SMEs, and Solution Architects, as well as leverage new AI technology to draft content. The candidate will have a demonstrated understanding of technological concepts necessary to draft content for technical approaches, management plans, and past performance in the areas of data analytics, cybersecurity, DevSecOps, engineering, technical operations, human performance/medical, or supply chain and sustainment.

This position reports directly to the Senior Manager of Proposal Operations. 

The successful candidate should have a keen understanding of the needs of the Fed Civ market, ensuring that all proposal content aligns with KBR’s strategic goals and objectives. Able to collaborate effectively with business development teams to identify key priorities and incorporate them into the proposal narratives, ultimately contributing to the growth and success of KBR's Fed Civ sector.

Additional Responsibilities Include:  

Interview Program Managers, Subject Matter Experts, and Solution Architects to draft technical proposal content that is compelling and compliant to the solicitation requirements.
Ability to harvest win themes and key discriminators to develop and articulate compelling proposal content that reflects an understanding of the customer’s needs and the KBR’s solution strategy
Broad depth and understanding of proposal requirements combined with technical acumen to successfully storyboard and write sections such as Technical Approach, Management Approach, Transition Approach, Risk Management Plans, Quality Control Plans, Executive Summaries, etc.
Ability to incorporate comments gathered from storyboard reviews, pink teams, red teams, and gold teams to deliver compelling and compliant content under tight deadlines
Ability to articulate the "How" and the "Why" from the "What"
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather, analyze, and synthesize information from various sources.
Attend capture, solution, and proposal meetings to ensure complete understanding of opportunity and ability to tailor proposal messaging
Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
Able to prioritize responsibilities to meet critical deadlines
Ability to work with geographically dispersed, virtual teams.

REQUIRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

Education: Bachelor's Degree in a technical field 10+ years professional work experience. Flexible on Degree and years' experience if candidate has technical certifications and/or proven Fed Civ technical/proposal writing experience.
Strong writing and communication skills with ability to assess and digest vast amounts of information to develop tailored proposal content under tight deadlines
Technical background and/or proficient understanding in a technical field such as data analytics, cybersecurity, DevSecOps, engineering, technical operations, human performance/medical, or supply chain and sustainment.
Experience writing narratives for Fed Civ IT/Cybersecurity/ Engineering/Operations solutions and pursuits.
Experience with Fed Civ agencies

PREFERRED/DESIRED SKILLS

Experience with Shipley proposal development methodology.
Association of Proposal Management Professionals (APMP) or similar certification.

Basic Compensation:

$94.7K - $142K

The offered rate will be based on contract affordability and the selected candidate’s working location, knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience, and in consideration of internal parity

title: Senior Technical Professional - Electrical
description:
Title:

Senior Technical Professional - Electrical

Provides technical guidance to designers and less experienced engineers and is consulted extensively by associates and others with a high degree of reliance placed on scientific interpretations and advice.
The Senior Technical Professional is part of the engineering design team and has a reporting line Electrical Discipline Manager. The responsibilities include ensuring that the discipline design is carried out in accordance with the stated objectives and that an appropriate level of inter-discipline co-ordination is maintained, through project meetings, document reviews, model reviews and coordination meetings to result in a fully coordinated final design.
Responsible for study, design, specification and services related to electrical and electronic systems including power generation, transmission and distribution, power systems performance and control, cabling and wiring, lighting, motor control centers, communications systems, cathodic protection, grounding lightning protection, heat tracing etc. 
Under direct supervision, evaluates, selects, and applies standard engineering techniques, procedures, and criteria, using judgment in making minor adaptations and modifications.
With additional experience within one functional area, assists in the design of larger and more complex assignments which involve conventional types of plans, investigations and surveys with relatively few complex features for which there are precedents. 
Job tasks, correctly performed, impact indirectly on cost containment, efficiency, profitability or operations. 
Assignments are generally well defined with clearly specified objectives. Assignments usually include one or more of the following: design and development, testing of materials, preparation or checking of design calculations and specifications, studies, research investigations, report preparation, and other activities of limited scope.
Experience for delivering Cables and Bulks packages.
Experience on Heat Tracing Design and Engineering works

Minimum 8 + years’ experience in Oil and Gas field.
Bachelor of Engineering, Electrical and Electronics
Master degree will be considered as advantage
Caspian Project experience
Package Management experience
7 to 10 years brownfield mods, Pre FEED/FEED, offshore / subsea power

description:
Title:

SHIPBOARD ORDNANCE (ARMORED VEHICLE) EQUIPMENT MECHANIC -MCPP

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

THIS POSITION IS LOCATED IN JACKSONVILLE, FLORIDA

Program Summary

The Marine Corps' Prepositioning (MCPP) Program is based on Blount Island in Jacksonville, Florida, WITH DUTY ASSIGNMENT ABOARD A SHIP IN GUAM, SAIPAN, OR DIEGO GARCIA.  We provide maintenance and logistics services to the U.S. Marine Corps (USMC) and U.S. Navy.  We are seeking a Shipboard Mechanic (Motor Transport).

Job Summary

Performs basic automotive mechanic duties incident to inspection, maintenance, and repair of the Ordnance family of vehicles, (LAV, AAV, M1A1, AVLB and Towed Artillery) which are diesel powered vehicles having utility systems or special hydraulic, pneumatic or mechanical systems features, and controls designed combat, logistical or other special applications.  Provides technical assistance, guidance, or training to lower level mechanics and assists higher level mechanics.  Performs other tasks as assigned.

Basic Qualifications 

High school graduate or equivalent. 

Four (4) years of directly related work experience. 

Complete the Light Armored Vehicle Repairman Course; or equivalent. 

Knowledge of how engines, hydraulic systems, transmission, and other parts and systems work.

Ability to detect faulty items, determine cause of malfunction, and determine best repair methods. 

Ability to assemble, disassemble, repair, or modify components and systems. 

Ability to read and interpret parts lists, manufacturers’ repair manuals, diagrams, and electrical schematics. 

Thorough understanding of the principles of operation and required repairs of all components and sub-components to include, the Hull, Suspension, Engine, Transmission, Turret, crane, winches, and sub-components. 

Working knowledge of requisitioning requirements utilizing appropriate Stock List, Parts Manuals, etc. 

Knowledge in the proper utilization of test equipment, diagnostic equipment, and special tools to cause repairs. 

Must maintain a valid passport.

Posses a valid State Motor Vehicle Operator License. 

Ability to comply with all established methods, quality standards, and time schedules applicable to this position. 

U.S. Citizen. 

Must be able to obtain and maintain a Common Access Card (CAC) and Base Access.  

Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret Clearance.

title: ARC Analyst Part-Time Position
description:
Title:

ARC Analyst Part-Time Position

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

At KBR, we define the future. We share one goal: to improve the world responsibly as a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers.

About the Role

KBR has an immediate opening for an energetic and dynamic Security Operations Center (SOC) Analyst, known as an Active Response Center (ARC) Analyst at EROS, supporting the United States Geological Survey (USGS) Earth Resources Observation & Science (EROS) Center (http://eros.usgs.gov/) near Sioux Falls, SD.

This position is part of the Center-wide Information Technology Team (CITT). You will work as part of a 24x7 ARC team responsible for monitoring networks for security issues using SIEM/log analysis tools, performing vulnerability scanning, threat intelligence, and responding to security incidents.

The goal of this role is to ensure EROS Center’s information and systems remain secure and protected, following the principles of availability, integrity, and confidentiality.

*** Three years of continuous U.S. residency required ***

Key Responsibilities

Monitor networks for malicious activity using SIEM tools; investigate alerts and document activity in ticketing systems.
Triage issues escalated to the information security team and ensure appropriate follow-up actions.
Develop and maintain ARC documentation and processes.
Monitor open-source intelligence for potential threats and take defensive actions.
Run vulnerability scans, interpret results, and follow up with support teams.
Collaborate with developers and analysts to advance automated tools and security processes.

Required Education & Experience

Working toward a degree in an IT-related field (experience may substitute at manager’s discretion).
Minimum of 1 year of directly related technical/professional experience.
Strong understanding of information security principles and best practices.
Good infrastructure and technology experience, including security operations.
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal).
Ability to prioritize workloads and seek guidance when needed.
Willingness to work shifts, including nights, weekends, and holidays.

Desired Skills

Experience with ticketing/triage systems.
Familiarity with SIEM tools and vulnerability scanning.
Knowledge of open-source threat intelligence.
Technical ability in Windows/Unix/Linux environments, Active Directory, networking systems.
Experience with Amazon cloud hosting platforms, VMware virtualization, and malware analysis.

Special Requirements

Three years of continuous U.S. residency for issuance of a Government Security credential.
Ability to obtain and maintain a national agency check and background investigation for facility access and user accounts.

Equivalent education and/or experience will be considered.

KBR partners with several other companies to fulfill its requirements as a government contractor. The selected subcontracting companies align their benefits as closely as possible to those above.

title: UABOS Turkey: Supply Supervisor
location:
locations
Incirlik Air Base, Adana, Turkey
description:
Title:

UABOS Turkey: Supply Supervisor

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR will sustain the operational well-being of U.S. armed forces at Morón Air Base (Spain), Incirlik Air Base, Izmir Air Station, and various facilities in Turkey. Our services encompass program management, civil engineering, morale and recreation support, postal operations, safety services, logistics, and more. With a five-year base period and three one-year options, KBR ensures these bases operate smoothly, allowing deployed personnel to focus on mission execution.

Job Summary

Supports the Program Management Office’s Chief of Supply in maintaining the smooth operation of a fast-moving supply-chain environment for both Task Order Spain and Turkey. Responsible for the daily management of the Supply Chain, to ensure company's targets and objectives are met to meet customer requirements, ensuring compliance with health, safety, and standard operating procedures. Provides leadership by directing the efforts of personnel involved in providing a variety of support to programs involved with Supply, Property, Transportation, and Disposal. Provides operational oversight to ensure work is accomplished in a timely and cost-effective manner. Ensures awareness and monitors employee compliance with all applicable company directives, policies, and procedures. Coordinates activities involving the customer, other organizations, and/or company functions. Responsible for defining training requirements, developing employee skills, and promoting continuous improvement. Develops and implements performance standards and internal controls. Skills are typically acquired through completion of an undergraduate degree and 10-12 years of experience.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Provides end-to-end Supply Chain Support and Supervision; analyzes and implements Supply Chain management systems and techniques.
Assists in the performance of the annual internal Contractor Self-Assessments (CSA’s) of all twenty-two (22) processes to ensure the KBR Government Property Management System is FAR-Compliant.
Forecasts, Plans, and Approves Requisitions for Material requirements in the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system.
Performs receiving, issuing, and physical inventory of Government Furnished, Contractor Acquired, and/or KBR Owned-Property in the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system as required.
Utilizes the Procurement Integrated Enterprise Environment (PIEE) Government Furnished Property Application Module to manage the life cycle of Government Furnished Property.
Updates the Government Furnished, Contractor Acquired, and KBR-Owned property records in the Accountable Property System of Record (APSR) as required.
Assists in the supervision, oversite, and tracking of the Project VAT Exemption Form Approval Program
Assists in the supervision, oversite, and tracking of the Project Purchasing Card Program according to FAR policies, corporate purchasing guidelines, and project-specific work instructions.
Performs other tasks as assigned.

Basic Qualifications 

US Citizen
Bachelor’s Degree
Possess a valid driver's license, minimum Class D
Combined experience of 10 years in Procurement. Logistics, and/or Supply Chain Management with a minimum of 5 years of Supply Chain Management experience in a LOGCAP or BOS contracting environment
Experience with CostPoint ERP & Inventory Management
Knowledge of FAR & DFAR Property Clauses
Previous experience managing 3+ direct report employees
Previous or current Purchasing Card or Procurement experience in a LOGCAP or BOS contracting environment
Advanced knowledge of MS Teams, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, OneDrive

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with RFGen Mobile Barcoding and Data Collection
Experience with PowerBI
Experience with PIEE Government Furnished Property Module
Certification and experience with Defense Property Accountability System (DPAS) Maintenance & Utilization, Warehouse Management, and Property Accountability Modules
Knowledge of Air Force Instructions (AFI) 24-302, 32-1001, and 32-1032
Previous experience managing union member employees

title: Structure Engineer
description:
Title:

Structure Engineer

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets. 

KBR is looking for a Structure Engineer to support the largest offshore oilfield in Qatar, Bul Hanine. This will play a vital role in the country’s oil production portfolio. The expansion project is part of Qatar’s broader strategy to sustain and enhance its oil output while simultaneously investing heavily in its liquefied natural gas (LNG) production growth. This role will perform global analyses of offshore structures. 

Responsibilities: 

Carry out detailed design of primary nodes 

Create detailed design of secondary and tertiary steel including equipment supports, access platforms, material handling structures, monorails, stair towers, etc. 

Compile design reports 

Qualifications: 

Degree in Civil/Structural Engineering or related engineering field 

4 + years of experience, with average experience of 6 - 10 years of designing FPSO modules and fixed offshore structures for upstream oil and gas projects 

Proficient in SACS and STAAD PRO software 

Good knowledge of the latest revisions of offshore design codes including: 

ISO 19901-3 

ISO 19902 

AISC-360  

Applicable API and DNV codes 

Decarbonization – Energy Transition – Sustainability

location:
locations

description:
Title:

Senior Piping Engineer

"Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR !

The KBR team of teams delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets."

Title: Senior Piping Engineer

Location: Abu Dhabi, UAE — KBR Office

Job Purpose

Define piping design bases, codes, standards, and deliverables to ensure safe, reliable, and cost-effective solutions.
Single point of contact for Piping deliverables and Activities.
Interface with client and other stakeholders for successful execution of the project
Coordinate with multi-disciplinary teams (process, mechanical, civil, electrical, instrumentation) and vendors to ensure integrated piping systems.
Mentor engineers, drive quality, and ensure schedule adherence for piping deliverables across project phases.

Key Responsibilities

Engineering design and engineer piping systems, supports, routing, isometrics, stress analysis, and related components.
Develop and review piping design basis, piping material specifications, datasheets, and technical bid evaluations.
Perform and supervise piping stress analyses, thermal expansion, pipe routing optimization, and vibration considerations.
Ensure compliance with applicable codes and standards and project-specific requirements.
Review and approve technical deliverables (isometrics, P&IDs, BOMs, MOC/Change Notes, design change requests, technical queries).
Development of standard deliverables, various datasheets, and requisition packages related to piping.
Experience in Non-metallic Piping Stress Analysis and Procurement. Provide in-depth technical support for material selection involving metallic, GRE, and HDPE piping systems.
Participate in material selection and corrosion review sessions to ensure suitable materials for service conditions.
Understand the MOC process and employ effective change management throughout the lifecycle of the project
Contribute to Lesson Learnt from the Project
Report to Department Manager/ Lead Engineer for the project.

Experience

12+ years of experience in Concept, FEED and Detail Engineering and EPCM experience in the Oil & Gas industry.
Experience in Middle East clients like ADNOC, BP, BOC, PDO, Total Energies & Qatar Energies others are highly preferred.
Familiarity of Onshore and Offshore facilities and carried out Greenfield and Brownfield Projects.
Experience in working with multicultural project teams across the various project execution center’s
Familiarity with international piping codes and standards such as ASME B31.3, ASTM, API, and NACE MR0175/ISO 15156.

Qualifications

Master or Bachelor of Engineering in a related field.
Professional membership or relevant certifications (e.g., PE/Chartered Engineer) are a plus.
Certification related to piping design or stress analysis is advantageous.

Technical Skills

Strong background in piping design, engineering, stress analysis, and support design.
Proficiency with piping design software and calculation tools (e.g., CAESAR, AutoPIPE and 3D modeling tools).
Technical experience to prepare manhours estimation for different types of piping activities & deliverables of different phases of the project like Select phase, FEED & Execution etc.
Familiarity with codes, standards, regulations and practices applicable to the design and construction of Various facilities.
Hands on knowledge of codes and standards relevant to piping.
Experience with high-pressure piping, thermal insulation, coatings, and corrosion considerations.
Diverse working experience in project management, conceptual, FEED and detailed design, and construction.
Knowledge of Interdisciplinary Work Processes/Interface/Deliverables
Responsible for the training and development of engineers in his/her Team.
Adherence to company processes and procedures and handle internal and external project audits.
Proven experience in vendor qualification, technical bid evaluation, and factory audits.

Soft Skills

Communication: Clear, concise communication with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Problem Solving: Proactive identification and mitigation of piping-related risks.
Project Management: Planning, scheduling, risk management, and deliverable tracking.
Influence & Collaboration: Effective collaboration with clients, vendors, and internal teams.
Adaptability: Comfort in dynamic project environments and changing technical requirements.
Attention to Detail: Rigorous approach to reviews, calculations, and documentation.
Safety Mindset: Commitment to health, safety, and environment (HSE) standards.
Critical Thinking: Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems

Job Description- Lead Piping Designer

Position Title: Lead Piping Designer
Company: KBR Corporate – In-house Engineering
Location: Abu Dhabi, UAE 

Job Purpose

Execute piping design activities within Concept, FEED (Front-End Engineering Design) and Detail Engineering for Oil & Gas projects.
Ensure high-quality, safe, and timely delivery of Piping design and related deliverables in accordance with project requirements, international codes, and standards.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior engineers and coordinate with multi-discipline teams and clients.

Key Job Responsibilities

Independently perform the Piping design scope drawings for Concept, FEED and Detail Engineering phases.
Ensure compliance with applicable codes and standards and project specifications.
Ensure engineering integrity, quality assurance and document control for all Piping related deliverables.
Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives, toolbox talks, and knowledge sharing.
Support field execution and construction activities as needed, including site visits when required and as-built documentation.
Independently developing complex piping designs, equipment layouts, plot plans, and general arrangement drawings. They utilize advanced 3D modeling software like E3D, SP3D, or AutoCAD to create detailed models and generate isometric drawings.
Conducting site visits to verify / collect field data and assess project conditions. 
Review and provide comments on vendor drawings to ensure compatibility with the overall design.

Experience

20+ years of experience and proven track record in delivering onshore and Offshore piping deliverables in Concept, FEED and Detail Engineering and EPCM experience in the Oil & Gas industry.
Experience with ADNOC, BOC, BP , Qatar Energies, TTE, PDO , KOC. 
Highly capable and efficient in preparing (hands-on) all onshore Piping engineering drawings independently and simultaneously working on multiple projects. Owns assigned tasks with high degree of responsibility. Flexibility & adaptability to maneuver dynamic and evolving project environment. 
Well versed with Upstream Facilities, Single and Multi-Well pads, Pipelines, Manifolds. 
Carried out visits to Onshore and Offshore facilities 
Carried out Brownfield projects in Onshore and offshore facilities. 
Experience in Preparing Plot plans, Key plans, Piping GA and other Piping deliverables 
Experience in Production Facilities, Well pads & Pipelines, CPF, Production Platforms and Gas Plants. 

Education & Qualifications

Minimum Diploma or ITI in Piping and Mechanical Design 
Relevant 2D and 3D software proficiency (PDMS, E3D, SP3D, or AutoCAD Plant 3D)

Technical Skills

Strong knowledge of drafting standards and industry applicable norms.
Proficient in relevant codes and standards 
Experience with 3D design and visualization tools and 2D drafting.

Soft Skills

Integrity: upholding engineering integrity amidst challenging priorities.
Communication: clear and concise communication with internal teams and clients; effective technical writing and presentation skills.
Problem Solving: strong analytical and troubleshooting capabilities.
Adaptability: comfortable operating in dynamic project environments and across multiple projects.

What We Offer:

Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Engaging and collaborative work environment with a commitment to safety and sustainability.

location:
locations

description:
Title:

Operations Coordinator - Event Coordinator

Who We Are
KBR Mission Technology Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. Our solutions help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.


The Mission Ahead
This role is with KBR’s Mission Technology Solutions division.  At KBR Mission Tech, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. Our legacy of delivering advanced full life cycle professional and technical solutions is matched only by our commitment to operational readiness and innovation. As stewards of critical missions for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA, and other key federal entities, we excel in engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow.


Who You Are
You’re a highly organized and detail-oriented Event Coordinator with a proven ability to plan, manage, and execute events in complex, regulated environments. Skilled at balancing multiple priorities, you excel at coordinating logistics, ensuring compliance, and delivering seamless experiences that meet operational and security requirements. Your strong communication skills and ability to work across diverse teams make you an essential partner in achieving mission objectives.

At KBR, you bring a combination of strategic planning and hands-on execution, ensuring every event runs efficiently and aligns with organizational goals. Known for your adaptability, problem-solving, and commitment to excellence, you thrive in high-stakes environments where precision and professionalism matter most. Your dedication to collaboration, continuous improvement, and operational success reflects the values and mission of our organization.

What You'll Do
In the role of Operations Coordinator – Event Planner, your duties will include:

Event Planning & Logistics

Develop detailed event plans, timelines, and budgets for internal and external events.

Coordinate venue arrangements, catering, transportation, and audiovisual requirements.

Ensure compliance with government security and safety protocols for all events.

Stakeholder Coordination

Liaise with internal departments, contractors, and external agencies to align event objectives.

Serve as the primary point of contact for event-related inquiries and approvals.

Compliance & Documentation

Prepare and maintain event documentation, including permits, security clearances, and risk assessments.

Ensure adherence to procurement guidelines and government contracting requirements.

On-Site Management

Oversee event setup, execution, and breakdown.

Manage staff, volunteers, and vendors during events to ensure smooth operations.

Post-Event Reporting

Conduct evaluations and prepare after-action reports to identify improvements.

Track event metrics and maintain records for auditing and compliance purposes.

Requirements:

Must be a US or Australian citizen

Must Possess an active US Top Secret/SCI w/ Counterintelligence Polygraph or AUS PV Clearance.

Minimum 3 years of event coordination experience, preferably in a government or regulated environment.

Strong organizational and project management skills.

Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.

Proficiency in MS Office and event management software.

Desired Qualifications: 

Bachelor’s degree in Event Management, Public Administration, Business, or related field.

This role will be located in Alice Springs. This position is expected to be onsite 100%.

We Deliver – Together.

BENEFITS
KBR offers a best-in-class total compensation and benefits package including a 401k plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We also support career advancement through professional training and development. Learn more about our benefits.

KBR EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER STATEMENT
KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

The KBR team of teams delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals. KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise,

KBR Abu Dhabi is currently looking to fill a PMC role for Specialist Engineer Onshore Construction - E&I for an Offshore project to be based in Abu Dhabi Offshore site 6/3 Rotation.

Profile matching below criteria only will be contacted.

Requirements


1)    Minimum Overall 17+ years of experience in Oil and Gas industry. 
2)    Having good experience in Detailed Engineering projects in the Oil & Gas industry. 
3)    Minimum 5+ years of experience in Offshore projects would be a mandatory requirement.  
4)    Having experience in Offshore Island specification is a mandatory. 
5)    Experience in Offshore Construction/ Site activities is a prerequisite for the role
6)    Must have worked at least 5 years’ of experience in similar position for mega oil and gas FEED/ EPC project ( more than US$ 1 Billion) 
7)    Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering is a MUST.

title: Data Manager, Information Management
description:
Title:

Data Manager, Information Management

Job Responsibilities:

Manage engineering project data, including collecting information from multiple sources and distributing it to relevant stakeholders.
Configure and implement engineering data warehouse systems (e.g., SmartPlant Foundation, Aveva Engineering, Aveva ISM) and data exchange interfaces between engineering tools and the data warehouse.
Set up and maintain tag and data progress measurement systems, as well as tag/data register exports.
Understand client and internal requirements for data collection, conditioning, reporting, and turnover.
Configure data repositories to meet project needs and coordinate with discipline leads on application usage and data flow.
Manage data interfaces between engineering applications and repositories across internal and external locations.
Resolve data inconsistencies, errors, mapping issues, and tagging queries in collaboration with project disciplines.
Perform data cleanup to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Export data for internal use and client deliverables in required formats.
Review vendor data for completeness and accuracy from a data collection perspective.
Train and support project teams on data management tools and reporting.
Oversee project close-out activities for data management systems and ensure seamless data turnover to the client.
Support detailed engineering design and ensure compliance with contractual data turnover requirements.

Job Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or a related field.
Minimum 10 years of experience in Oil & Gas offshore/onshore projects with hands-on involvement in project data management.
Strong understanding of project execution and ability to develop and implement data management plans.
Experience leading a team of data controllers and providing guidance.
In-depth knowledge of:
Class libraries, naming rules, and attribute data definitions.
Tagging philosophy and implementation.
Data collection, validation, and exchange methods.
Tag and data progression planning.
Engineering and supplier tag/data management.
Engineering software systems and tools.
Proficiency in engineering data warehouse systems (SmartPlant Foundation, Aveva Engineering, Aveva ISM).
Strong skills in database management, SQL development, VBA, and SQL Server Reporting Services.

title: Corrosion Control Technician - 2nd Shift
description:
Title:

Corrosion Control Technician - 2nd Shift

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

The Marine Corps Prepositioning Program (MCPP) is based in Jacksonville, Florida. We provide maintenance and logistic services to the U.S. Marine Corps (USMC) in support of this program.  For over 35 years we have planned, coordinated, and executed the maintenance and logistic services for ground combat vehicles and support equipment for USMC Expeditionary Forces.

Job Summary

Performs duties involved with setting up, operating, and performing preventative maintenance on complete stationary and portable sandblasting equipment and machines used for cleaning metal and nonmetal surfaces.  Performs duties involving the application of coating materials (i.e., paint, varnish, lacquer, shellac, etc.), on wood, metal, glass, concrete and other surfaces, using brushes, rollers, spray guns, and other related methods and techniques.  Provides technical assistance, guidance, or training to lower level painters and assists higher level painters.  Performs other tasks as assigned.

Basic Qualifications 

High School graduate or equivalent.
Eight years directly related work experience. 
Complete the Vehicle Body Repair Course or equivalent.
Apprenticeship as a painter/sandblaster is preferred.
Must possess a valid State motor vehicle operator license and able to obtain and maintain a Tactical Operator License as necessary. 
Working knowledge of the operating and preventive maintenance features of sandblasting equipment and machines, cleaning characteristics of metals and nonmetals, cutting or abrasive quality of a variety of sand-like abrasives, and the optimum air pressures with specific abrasives to obtain desired finish without damage to work pieces. 
Ability and skill to position and hold work pieces and blasting nozzles, and perform blasting operations and procedures in a safe manner. 
Working knowledge of OSHA, SPCC, and EPA regulations concerning sandblasting procedures and the use and disposal of sandblast materials. 
Complete the Small Boat Preservation Course, or equivalent. 
Working knowledge of standard surface preparation and coating methods and techniques.
Apprenticeship as a painter in a shipyard environment. 
Working knowledge of Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) regulations, Steel Structures Painting Council (SSPC) standards, National Association of Corrosion Engineers (NACE) standards, and Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) regulations concerning painting. 
Medically and physically capable of wearing a respirator. 
Able to climb ladders, work in confined spaces, in extremely high or low temperatures and at heights. 
Able to lift 50 pounds unaided.  
Ability to comply with all established methods, safety standards, quality standards, and time schedules applicable to this position.  
U.S. Citizen. 
Must be able to obtain and maintain a Common Access Card (CAC) and Base Access.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Logistics Coordinator
location:
locations
Alice Springs, Northern Territory, Australia
description:
Title:

Logistics Coordinator

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

This is a contingent position based upon contract award.

Who We Are
KBR Government Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. Our solutions help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.


The Mission Ahead
This role is with KBR’s Government Solutions U.S. division.  At KBR Government Solutions, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. Our legacy of delivering advanced full life cycle professional and technical solutions is matched only by our commitment to operational readiness and innovation. As stewards of critical missions for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA, and other key federal entities, we excel in engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow.


Who You Are
You’re a proactive and organized Logistics Coordinator with a strong background in planning, organizing, and managing the flow of goods and materials. With expertise in coordinating shipments, managing inventory, and optimizing transportation routes, you excel at ensuring timely deliveries and efficient use of resources. Your problem-solving abilities and keen attention to detail ensure that operations run smoothly and that logistics challenges are resolved quickly and effectively.

At KBR, you bring a combination of logistical expertise, organizational skills, and a commitment to operational excellence. Known for your ability to manage multiple tasks, communicate across departments, and maintain accurate tracking systems, you play a vital role in supporting mission-critical operations. Your dedication to efficiency, accuracy, and seamless coordination aligns with KBR’s mission of delivering innovative and reliable solutions.


What You'll Do
In the role of Logistics Coordinator, your duties will include:

Maintains documentation to record all issues, receipts, transfers, and disposals of property in accordance with approved property accountability procedures for USG property.

Ensures material and equipment are catalogued to a standard nomenclature in automated Integrated Data Management System (IDMS) to enhance tracking, reordering, and excess identification processes.

Conducts weekly stock reviews to ensure accuracy of inventory records and that stock items are serviceable.

Creates and maintains a Critical Spares Inventory of parts essential to mission activities and stock items accordingly.

Requirements:

Must be a US or Australian Citizen

Must Possess a US TS/SCI with Polygraph or AUS PV Clearance.

Must have a minimum of 5 years of logistics experience on large contract with OCONUS experience.

Strong organizational and logistical skills.

Knowledge of supply chain processes and related software.

Attention to Detail: Precision and attention to detail to ensure high-quality service delivery and compliance with safety standards.

Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing conditions, technologies, and requirements.

Decision-Making Ability: Strong decision-making skills to resolve issues quickly and effectively under pressure.

This role will be located in Alice Springs. This position is expected to be onsite 100%.

INCLUSION AND DIVERSITY AT KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people, sustainability, and our Zero Harm culture.

These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to and ongoing journey toward being a more inclusive and diverse company. That commitment is central to our team of teams philosophy and fosters an environment of real collaboration across cultures and locations. Our individual differences and perspectives bring enhanced value to our teams and help us develop solutions for the most challenging problems. We understand that by embracing those differences and working together, we are more innovative, more resilient, and safer.

We Deliver – Together.

BENEFITS
KBR offers a best-in-class total compensation and benefits package including a 401k plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We also support career advancement through professional training and development. Learn more about our benefits.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Senior Systems Engineer
description:
Title:

Senior Systems Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

The JMETC user support team is in need of a Systems Engineer with a background in Digital Engineering to support the TRMC Digital Engineering project to establish a Digital Engineering environment for the Dept of War enterprise called Golden Forge.

Applicant will work with a distributed team to develop the requirements and be a part of the overall program leadership to plan for and implement the required environment including the related artifacts to support digital engineering across the Dept of War with a specific focus on Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) tools. 
Works with government to provide technical direction, acting as a liaison between the end users, application developers, and senior leadership within the DoW and across the Mission Engineering, Systems Engineering, Test, and Training community.
Applicant will be responsible for planning and coordinating technical support with the military, civil service and support contractor personnel for Test Resource Management Center Data Strategy.
Applicant will monitor and support the pursuit of viable opportunities by supplying the resources and training necessary to assess, screen, and prioritize opportunities to optimize utilization of resources by assisting in defining requirements, developing specifications, developing and implementing timelines and milestones.
Applicant is expected to Optimize results for customers as well as the company by establishing goals and objectives for operations and making operational decisions.
The position requires the ability to work with military acquisition programs.

The JMETC program is focused on developing and deploying the processes, architecture, and BD/KM to facilitate cost effective integration of live, virtual, and constructive entities needed to support the DoW acquisition community needs utilizing a distributed approach. JMETC, TENA and CHEETAS will be integral to testing systems-of-systems applications within a realistic joint mission construct.

REQUIREMENTS  

Masters degree in Engineering or Systems Engineering
Active Top Secret DoD clearance with SCI eligibility
Minimum of 20 years’ experience to include the following:
Experience Identifying and communicating best practices throughout the company, Experience with MBSE
Experience working with OUSD (R&E) and TRMC,
Military or Space Acquisition Program knowledge,
Experience with Project Management
Communication and Presentation skill

Knowledge of one or more of the following:

Digital Engineering
Testing and Training
Strategic Relations
Joint Testing and Training 
Test Event Operation, Planning and Analysis
DoD Programs and Acquisition process
Enterprise Software Development
Computer operating environments

title: Automotive Diesel Mechanic
description:
Title:

Automotive Diesel Mechanic

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

The Marine Corps Prepositioning Program (MCPP) is based in Jacksonville, Florida. We provide maintenance and logistic services to the U.S. Marine Corps (USMC) in support of this program.  For over 35 years we have planned, coordinated, and executed the maintenance and logistic services for ground combat vehicles and support equipment for USMC Expeditionary Forces.

Job Summary

Maintains, services, inspects and repairs combustion-powered automotive vehicles, over-the-road trucks, and comparable vehicles such as light combat vehicles, and trucks as well as other motor transport equipment. Must be able to lift 50 pounds.  Performs operator, intermediate and limited major rebuild levels of maintenance which includes spot painting.  Performs other tasks as assigned.

Basic Qualifications 

High school graduate or equivalent. 
Four years directly related work experience. 
Certificate from a vocational school or other recognized source with a major study in electrical or automotive repair is preferred. In lieu of formal course work, a combination of college credits, on-the-job training, other formalized training, or experience may be considered.
Completion of the basic automotive mechanics course, or equivalent. 
Completion of the automotive organizational maintenance course, or equivalent. 
Completion of the automotive intermediate maintenance course, or equivalent. 
Maintains MVAC 609 Technician Certification. 
Completion of the advanced motor transport maintenance courses.  In lieu of formal course work, a combination of college credits, on-the-job training, other formalized training, or experience may be considered. 
Working knowledge of how heavy duty machinery, engines, hydraulic systems, transmissions and other parts and systems work. 
Ability to detect faulty items, determine cause of malfunction, and determine best repair methods. 
Ability to assemble, disassemble, repair, or modify components and systems. 
Ability to read and interpret parts lists, manufacturers’ and Government repair manuals, diagrams, and electrical schematics. 
Thorough understanding of the principles of operation and required repairs of all components and sub-components including but not limited to the Suspension, Engine, Transmission, Transfers, Differentials, wreckers, winches and sub-components. 
Ability to utilize Technical Manuals, Lubrication Orders/Instructions, and Modification Instructions to repair all rolling stock assets. 
Possess a valid State Motor Vehicle Operator License and able to obtain and maintain a Tactical Operator License as necessary. 
Ability to comply with all established methods, safety standards, quality standards, and time schedules applicable to this position.
U.S. Citizen. 
Must be able to obtain and maintain a Common Access Card (CAC) and Base Access.

title: Special Operations Licensed Clinical Social Worker (AFSOC GSU/Fort Benning, GA)
description:
Title:

Special Operations Licensed Clinical Social Worker (AFSOC GSU/Fort Benning, GA)

THIS POSITION OFFERS RELOCATION.

We are looking for a Special Operations Licensed Clinical Social Worker to join the team who is responsible for integrating the physical, mental and psychological wellness of our service members and their families for the Preservation of the Force and Family (POTFF) contract to optimize and sustain Special Operations Forces (SOF) mission readiness, longevity, and performance through integrated and holistic human performance programs designed to strengthen the Force and Family.

Core Tenets include:

POTFF is Performance and Readiness Focused.
POTFF utilizes Embedded and Specialized Professionals.
POTFF is composed of Multi-Domain Cross Functional Teams.
POTFF is a Proactive and Holistic Approach.
POTFF is Evidence-Based.
POTFF provides Centralized Oversight and Decentralized Execution.

At KBR we maintain a highly qualified workforce to help care for Special Operations service members and their families – Could this be you?

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

Engage all quality improvement and staff meetings, conferences
Conduct applied research and clinical investigations in clinical/behavioral health/organizational social work.
Consult with medical personnel, legal authorities, military commanders and school districts as required.
Maintain accurate medical records of all patients seen and produces reports of evaluation and/or treatment.
Participate in military specific training.  This position may include clinical supervision of unlicensed providers or trainees.
May be required to perform some, or all, of the following activities: Participates in and successfully completes required DoD or service required training; Contact referred patients to assess treatment adherence; Use validated symptom inventories to assess current symptom severity; Assess barriers to treatment adherence and help patient problem-solve solutions to barriers; Provide patients with education regarding their mental health condition and treatment regimen; maintain patient information in a patient registry; maintain accurate and current notes in the electronic medical records of all patients contacted for review by the managing physician; Routinely staffs difficult cases with the referring provider, behavioral health consultant and/or psychiatry consultant; and Performs case management functions.

Required Education/Experience/Skills/Training: 

Position requires U.S. Citizenship or Permanent Resident Status.

Must have a Secret Clearance or the ability to obtain Secret Clearance.

Master of Social Work (M.S.W.) or equivalent (MSSW, MSSA) degree from a graduate school of social work fully accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE).

• Maintain a current, unrestricted clinical license to independently practice social work in any one of the 50 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, or the U.S. Virgin Islands.

Maintain credentialing requirements in good standing at a local MTF.

A minimum of two (2) years peer-reviewable clinical social work experience in a mental health setting. 

Demonstrate a working knowledge of professional standards and ethics regarding the delivery of clinical social work services.

Experience in brief behavioral interventions.

May be required to receive and maintain clinical practice privileges.

Fluent oral and written communication skills in English.

Must maintain current certification in Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS) by the American Heart Association; must provide front and back proof of all training/certs/documentation.

Desired Education/Experience/Skills/Training:

Experience working in a Government setting such a DOD or Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) MTF.

Standard Company Requirements: 

Must comply with Safety, Health and Environmental plan, policies and procedures. 
Must comply with the Quality Assurance plan, policies and procedures. 
Must maintain regular and acceptable attendance. 
Responsible for completing all required training. 
Perform other assignments and duties, as required. 

KBR Benefits​

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development.​

title: Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) Manager
location:
locations
Alice Springs, Northern Territory, Australia
description:
Title:

Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) Manager

Who We Are

KBR Government Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. Our solutions help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community (IC), NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.

The Mission Ahead

This role is with KBR’s Government Solutions U.S. division.  At KBR Government Solutions, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. Our legacy of delivering advanced full life cycle professional and technical solutions is matched only by our commitment to operational readiness and innovation. As stewards of critical missions for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA, and other key federal entities, we excel in engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow.

Who You Are

As a highly motivated EHS Manager, you will lead a dynamic team in managing EHS program activities. In this pivotal role, you will be responsible for aligning the EHS program with the Government Environmental Safety Management System (ESMS).  The ideal candidate possesses a deep understanding of US Government and Host Nation guidance and bilateral agreements on environmental protection as well as occupational health safety principles.

An adept leader, you're no stranger to navigating large-scale projects with finesse. Your expertise in resource management, strategic planning, and process improvement is surpassed only by your commitment to balancing stakeholder expectations with concrete business outcomes. Your eye for compliance and your strategic mindset ensures that each contractual requirement is not just met but exceeded. As a navigator of complexity, you are prepared to architect the integration of project data, optimize resource allocation, and achieve operational excellence across the board.

This role will be located in Alice Springs, Australia at a 4,400-acre facility with approximately 687,000 square feet of mission and support space.  The EHS Manager will be expected to travel between our facilities in Alice Springs and the local area.  This position is expected to be onsite 100%. 

What You’ll Do

As the EHS Manager, you will:

Develop & Implement environment, health and safety policies and procedures consistent with the Government ESMS
Stay apprised of legislative changes in the US and Host Nation that may affect the Government EHS program and report, document and, implement changes
Develop, maintain and disseminate general safety guidance to the Government workforce
Develop, maintain and implement Occupational Health and Safety programs to identify, monitor and correct any physical, chemical or biological hazards
Develop and maintain an EHS Induction and Safety Awareness Training Program for the entire workforce
Prepare appropriate environmental management documentation to maintain compliance as required by the current Host Nation Department of Defense issued Environmental Assessment Report and Heritage Environmental Assessment Report
Develop, maintain, and implement all site environmental procedures, plans, and programs; coordinate environmental management activities of all contractors working on site, and report significant concerns and deficiencies 
Manage the operational compliance of EHS responsibilities
Promote EHS performance improvement
Conducting audits and incident investigations
Lead the investigations of serious accidents or incidents having the potential for serious consequences, facilitate root cause analysis evaluation
Audit ESH compliance, training, and record keeping
Coordination and supervision of EHS activities on site
Provide guidance and training in EHS matters to the Environmental Safety Officer

Qualifications:

Must possess an active TS/SCI U.S. Security Clearance with an adjudicated CI polygraph, or Host Nation TS/PV clearance
A minimum of five (5) years of experience managing similar projects of size, scope and complexity
Minimum of two (2) consecutive years of supervisory experience in Environmental Health and Safety Management
Understanding of US and Host Nation bilateral agreements governing EHS
Experience providing high-quality customer service
Ability to maximize technical, performance, and operational efficiencies and minimize lifecycle costs
Ability to work in fast paced environment with excellent oral and written communication skills
Familiarity with a 24/7/365 operational environment

INCLUSION AND DIVERSITY AT KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people, sustainability, and our Zero Harm culture.

These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to and ongoing journey toward being a more inclusive and diverse company. That commitment is central to our team of teams philosophy and fosters an environment of real collaboration across cultures and locations. Our individual differences and perspectives bring enhanced value to our teams and help us develop solutions for the most challenging problems. We understand that by embracing those differences and working together, we are more innovative, more resilient, and safer.

We Deliver – Together.

BENEFITS

KBR offers a best-in-class total compensation and benefits package including a 401k plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We also support career advancement through professional training and development. Learn more about our benefits.

#FS

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

Title:

Property Coordinator

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

This is a contingent position based upon contract award.

Who We Are
KBR Government Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. Our solutions help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.
