RF knowledge expertise (basic understanding of RF principles), knowledge of GEOINT and SIGINT constellation and tasking process.

title: Ground Systems Engineer
description:
Title:

Ground Systems Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

KBR is seeking a Ground Systems Engineer to work on complex projects crucial to our national security objectives. They will provide Systems Engineering and Technical Advisory (SETA) services to assist the government in implementing and executing systems engineering processes to integrate ground systems into the operational baseline at a customer facility in Chantilly, Va.

Key Responsibilities:

Advise and assist the government with the planning, engineering, integration, and O&M activities of ground systems.

Analyze and document site system architecture and impacts associated with system updates/deliveries.

Collaborates with Headquarters Directorates, site organizations, and mission partners to ensure understanding of project requirements and risks (cost, schedule, technical).

Document, develop and deliver analysis, recommendations, plans, reports/briefings to the Government.

Develop and maintain Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) models of ground systems, integrating MBSE tools into a digital thread to connect siloed information systems.

Leverage digital twin technologies and modeling and simulation tools to support early-stage risk reduction, operational rehearsal, and system performance verification.

Support the development and integration of automated test solutions and continuous improvement in software design and architecture.

Work Environment:

Location: On-site

Travel Requirements: Minimal

Working Hours: Standard

QUALIFICATIONS

Required: 

Active TS/SCI clearance with polygraph.

Bachelor’s degree in science, technology, engineering, mathematics (STEM) field required (contractual requirement) and three (3) years or more relevant experience; master’s and one (1) year or more experience.

Knowledge of customer’s space and ground domain mission and technical capabilities.

Systems engineering background; understanding of systems development life cycle from concept, requirements, engineering design, integration and test, deployment, maintenance, through decommissioning.

Experience in requirements definition, system architectures, systems analysis and design, interface and data architectures, validation, and verification.

Polished communicator and proven collaborator; demonstrated ability to coordinate across all levels of government to ensure contracts effectively deliver required services and capabilities.

Self-starter, proactively addresses customer requirements with no supervision; expert at defining solutions for broad, abstract topics.

Familiar with model-based systems engineering and digital engineering concepts and tools; Agile/DevSecOps development methodology, cloud technologies.

Desired:

Experience in initiating, planning, executing, monitoring, and controlling DoD or Intelligence Community projects or Programs.

Experience in architecture management, baseline audit, and verification.

Familiar with JIRA, Confluence.

Proficiency in using modeling tools and software (e.g. Sparx Enterprise Architect, or Capella).

Familiarity with modeling languages such as SysML or UAFML.

Experience with cloud-based technologies and automation to optimize platform performance and reliability.

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

location:
locations

MCPP Philippines (Site 1), PHL, Subic Bay Freeport Zone , Saddler Pier / NSD Compound (Port Site 1) Block K, NSD Compound, Zambales
description:
Title:

Project Manager – MCPP (GPN Philippines)

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

THIS POSITION IS LOCATED IN SUBIC BAY, PHILIPPINES

Program Summary

The Marine Corps’ Maritime Prepositioning Force (MPF) and Marine Corps

Prepositioning Program has been operationally invaluable in supporting our Nation’s interests across the world. This unique program provides the essential elements needed to support and execute crisis response, global reach, and forward presence. The Marine Corps’ Prepositioning Program enables the rapid deployment of Marine Air Ground Task Forces (MAGTFs) and/or augment individual Marine units

forward deployed. These forces are uniquely capable of strengthening alliances, securing strategic access, and defeating hostile adversaries. MPF is keystone in the Marine Corps’ capability for setting the conditions for national security. The prepositioning of equipment and supplies to support MAGTFs from Marine Expeditionary Unit (MEU), Marine Expeditionary Brigade (MEB), to Marine Expeditionary Force (MEF) level employment, enables Marine forces to fulfil their role and responsibility as our Nation’s force in readiness. Our prepositioning programs will continue to enable operations across the Joint Operational continuum – including shaping, deterrence, seizing the initiative, domination, stabilization, and enabling of civilian authorities. When combined with the forces and their equipment arriving in the fly-in echelon (FIE), prepositioning programs

provide forward deployed equipment and supplies needed to sustain a MEB-sized MAGTF for 30 days of operations; thus reducing total strategic lift requirements.

Job Summary

The scope of this position is to manage the overall execution of the Marine Corps Prepositioning Program – Philippines (MCPP-PHIL) Task Order to include the development and enforcement of administrative and operational policy and the resourcing and allocation of people, equipment, materials, and budget. The MCPP-PHIL Project Manager will report directly to the MCPP GPN Manager.

Initial training for this position and onboarding will occur in Jacksonville, FL with follow-on USMC Contractor Replenishment Cell (CRC) training for ultimate placement in Subic Bay, Philippines.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Plan, coordinate, execute and/or supervise the performance of all functions for the MCPP-PHIL Task Order by implementing the following: 

Lead, coordinate, and manage the accountability, readiness, and sustainment of MCPP-PHIL and MCPP-PHIL Organic equipment.
Plan, develop, and maintain a competent and complete program that follows the contract Statement of Work and adheres to Marine Corps policy and procedures.
Coordinate and implement Task Order deliverables in support of MCPP planning and execution requirements.
Plan, coordinate, and manage customer requests over and above the scope of the Task Order.
Identify specific requirements for money, manpower, materiel, facilities, and services needed to support the Task Order.
Plan, coordinate, and manage the budget execution of the Task Order.
Review and approve requisitions for equipment, materials, and supplies within budgetary guidelines.
Develop administrative and operational policies and procedures and ensure compliance.
Develop and coordinate personnel management and support. 
Enforce compliance with established safety and environmental regulations, methods, and procedures for utilizing, handling, and storing various materials and equipment.
Prepare technical reports and correspondence, identify problem areas/deficiencies, and direct personnel in the development of reports and records.
Establish performance objectives/goals and supervise direct reports.
Maintain MCPP-PHIL ISO policies and procedures and enforce compliance.
Develop and sustain a culture of quality improvement.
Perform other duties as needed.

Basic Qualifications 

BS degree in business or another related field. MBA Preferred.
In lieu of a degree, a combination of college credits, professional certification, formalized training, or education, and directly related work experience may be considered.
Fifteen years of progressive experience with specialized knowledge of maintenance and logistic support activities involving motor transportation, engineering, ordnance, and communications equipment, including ten years in a management capacity involving various aspects of cost/schedule controls, performance monitoring, report writing, program planning and customer interface.
Must be a U.S. Citizen.
Must possess a valid state Motor Vehicle Drivers’ License.
Must be able to obtain and maintain a Department of Defense secret security clearance.
Must possess or be able to obtain a U.S. Passport.
Applicants must be able to pass an FBI Background investigation with no criminal, civil, or security violations.
Must be able to obtain a work visa and an Alien Employment Permit for the Philippines.

Preferred Qualifications

Understanding of Marine Corps policies, regulations, and orders.
Industry Certification
Automation and Scripting
Working knowledge of military storage procedures.
Working knowledge of general maintenance procedures for military tactical equipment and supplies.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Ability to comply with all established methods, quality standards, and time schedules applicable to this position.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Remote Deputy Program Manager (Behavioral Healthcare Operations)
description:
Title:

Remote Deputy Program Manager (Behavioral Healthcare Operations)

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR. 

 

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers.  But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely. 

 

We are seeking a highly skilled Deputy Program Manager (DPM) to provide leadership, oversight, and operational management for multiple contracts. 

THIS POSITION IS CONTINGENT UPON CONTRACT AWARD

This remote position requires 25% travel and offers the opportunity to drive high-quality program execution while supporting customer and subcontractor relationships. 

Key Responsibilities 

Leadership & Program Execution: Support the Program Manager in directing and managing multiple work groups across planning, task order management, budgeting, property management, and procurement. Ensure all work meets quality, schedule, and cost expectations. Work with the Program Manager to adjudicate regional allocation of headcount/workshare among teammates. Travel to assigned sites, meet regularly with the client and employees. Understand regional compliance with all contract requirements. Support regional/service area for continuous improvement and implement improvements. Work closely with the Program Manager on any staff or resource issue within the assigned regional/service area of the Program, including the direction or re-direction of resources to facilitate execution of any task. Other duties as assigned. 

Operational Management: Oversee cost, schedule, and technical performance of program task orders. Lead technical and cost proposal development, approval, and submission. In absence of the Program Manager, act as primary POC to the client to ensure communication specific to that client. Develop, monitor, and recommend strategic plans to support contract requirements and emerging client needs. Monitor innovations/ improvements for success in contract execution. Work closely with Program Management to make overall operational decisions regarding deployment of resources among regional/service locations. Provide management/inputs in selection, training, and performance of assigned and/or matrixed personnel. Manage regional staffing plans, oversee regional resources, and project execution; comply with all reporting requirements. Prepare and participating in, presentation of monthly internal program reviews and status reports as needed. Plan regional Teammate, PMO, and client meetings as needed.  

Stakeholder Engagement: Act as the primary point of contact for customers in the Program Manager’s absence, providing updates on program performance and ensuring customer satisfaction. Interface with customers on a consistent basis to ensure that team meets expectations, modify plan/processes to successfully meet client requirements. Implement customer satisfaction process, reporting and response; ensure metrics are captured and reported. Participate in investigations for corrective actions/nonconformance.  

Financial & Compliance Oversight: Serve as funds manager, ensuring compliance with contracts, task orders, and company/government policies. Monitor safety, cost, and technical performance. 

Quality & Process Improvement: Lead portfolio-wide Quality Improvement Initiatives and maintain document control processes, including Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and Quality Management Plans. 

Staff Development & Team Management: Promote team morale through mentorship, training, and career development. Conduct performance evaluations, manage staffing needs, and oversee resource allocation. Assist with defining staffing needs, recruitment, retention and development. 

Strategic Growth & Business Development: Support Business Development efforts, including proposal writing, past performance documentation, and technical submissions. Identify opportunities for growth and expansion within existing contracts. 

Qualifications 

Education & Licensing 

Master’s degree in a related field with an active clinical license at the highest state level in counseling, social work, or psychology. 

 

Experience:  

6+ years of leadership experience in behavioral health care operations within the Department of Defense, corporate, or civilian sectors. 

Extensive experience in clinical supervision of non-medical counseling, negotiating and formalizing Service Level Agreements (SLAs), and wellness services (CEAP preferred). 

Strong knowledge of military mission activities, military treatment facilities, civilian behavioral health, wellness, and EAP services. 

Experience in a Program Management Office (PMO) is a plus. 

Experience managing subcontractors. 

 

Certifications & Skills:  

PMP certification (or ability to obtain within six months). 

Lean Six Sigma or Certified Professional in Healthcare Quality (CPHQ) preferred (or ability to obtain within six months). 

Clinical supervisory credential preferred (or ability to obtain within one year). 

A Secret level clearance, at a minimum. 

 

Leadership & Strategy 

Proven ability to lead, mentor, and develop teams in a government contracting and matrixed management environment. Strong strategic mindset to drive growth and expand business opportunities.

title: QA/QC Inspector Welding - Onsite
description:
Title:

QA/QC Inspector Welding - Onsite

Job Title: QA/QC Welding Inspector

Job Description

QC Welding Inspector will be responsible for the site-based welding activities including piping, tank, structural welding for main development facilities and equipment located in Majnoon Oil Field. A good candidate would have a solid multi-discipline Oil & Gas operations knowledge and related supervisory and inspection experience in a similar capacity with a good understanding of project specifications, norms, and regulations as well as international codes.

Support and promote project HSSE requirements within QA/QC activities and inspections. QA/QC Welding inspector will monitor contractor and subcontractor welding work including piping/structural, tank, vessels, equipment, works progress/performance, interface with responsible engineers and construction supervision team.

QA/QC Welding Inspector reports to report to Site QA/QC Lead and has a reporting line to the Quality Assurance Discipline.

Roles and Responsibilities: 

Responsible for monitoring and reporting compliance with project specifications, drawings, codes, standards and procedures of all fabrication, installation, erection and testing processes during construction leading to mechanical completion. Witness inspection/test within their disciplines based on approved ITPs. Monitor execution of field welding & NDT work activities in conformance with project drawings, specifications, quality requirements, procedures, safety standards Prepare inspection reports outlining specific recommendations and liaise with field supervisors regarding their implementations. Monitor all welding activities on site and ensure that all welding joints are welded as per approved WPSs. Attend all WPQR's mechanical testing to ensure complete implementation with the requirements. Witness all Contactor`s welding qualification tests and evaluate their visual and NDT results. Witness all site NDT activities, carry out interpretation for test results and evaluate the finding outs. Monitor the clean build policy on site and make sure it is implemented on site Make sure preservation procedure is applied and ensure the relevant inspection records signed off Witness all line walk and hydrotest packages as per test packages and subsystem.

Maintain records of calibration, inspection and testing equipment.  Provide sufficient feedback to QA/QC Lead on daily quality issues.  Shall be conversant with the final HO documentations.  Play an active role in the development of the safety culture on the project, making safety a natural part of all work performed.  Ensure closure of all RFI’s and related inspection/test records (ITRs) immediately after successful completion of each inspections.  Liaise and work closely with the sites contractor’ quality inspection team.  Raise and Support closure of NCRs in coordination with QA/QC Lead. 

Skills and experience: 

Minimum 10 years Quality Management experience within the oil and gas industry
Valid CSWIP /AWS/BGAS/ ISO 9712 Level II certification.
Good knowledge of International standards and all relevant local standards and laws
knowledge of ASME, API, AWS, ISO NDT-related codes.
Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
Must be proactive and possess good inter personnel skills
Excellent organizational and communication skills
Proficient in English language

Educational experience:

Preferred Engineering Degree
Professional Accreditation preferred
Successful completion of ISO 9001:2015 lead auditor training or transition course, preferred

title: Infrastructure Integrated Planner
description:
Title:

Infrastructure Integrated Planner

Simply put, at KBR, we do things that matter.

Every day, our people work together to deliver solutions that are helping solve the great challenges and opportunities of our time, including climate change, national security, energy transition and security, cybersecurity, space exploration, and more.

The Infrastructure Integrated Planner role is responsible for developing and maintaining integrated Infra plans for each Site Director area within the programme construct. It draws together key milestones, critical dates and interdependencies between Projects, Maintenance and Operational Plans.

You will work with stakeholders to identify risk, opportunities and potential mitigation and through the delivery of resourced schedules and succinct reports.

What Do We Need

Primavera (P6) knowledge

Experienced in planning across all stages of the project lifecycle.

Experienced in monthly programme updating and reporting.

Experienced in the monthly review and assessment of supplier schedules.

Good understanding of risk and opportunity management with reference to planning & programming

Experience of working in a client environment.

Location

The role is Hybrid where 3 days per week will be spent on the Client site in Helensburgh, Scotland.

Security Requirements

SC Clearance

Due to the secure nature of this project, restrictions in relation to UK residency and nationality will apply.

title: Noise & Vibration Engineer
description:
Title:

Noise & Vibration Engineer

KBR is a global provider of differentiated, professional services and technologies delivered across a wide government, defense and industrial base. Drawing from its rich 100-year history and culture of innovation and mission focus, KBR creates sustainable value by combining engineering, technical and scientific expertise with its full life cycle capabilities to help our clients meet their most pressing challenges today and into the future.

We deliver science, technology and engineering solutions to governments and companies around the world. KBR employs approximately 37,000 people worldwide with customers in more than 80 countries and operations in over 29 countries. KBR is proud to work with its customers across the globe to provide technology, value-added services, and long-term operations and maintenance services to ensure consistent delivery with predictable results. At KBR, We Deliver.

We’re hiring! We’re looking for an Early Careers level Noise and Vibration Engineer to join our team in Leatherhead, supporting our global design and engineering Projects. You’ll be working as part of a wider Technical Safety and Environmental Team across a range of industry sectors to deliver world class Projects.

Industrial acoustics addresses noise and vibration control in Process Equipment, Piping, Valves, Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning (HVAC), Public Address General Alarm (PAGA), and architecture. KBR is committed to helping our customers deliver a more sustainable future through the solutions we provide.

Roles and Responsibilities

Under direct supervision, you will support design development and engineering work in the discipline of industrial acoustics. Your work will include:

Identifying Project specific legislation, standards, codes, practices and procedures.
Developing philosophies, or basis of design.
Developing calculations or models.
Compare predicted N&V levels against the required limits.
Support Projects in the identification of noise and vibration reduction, control or mitigation measures.
Supporting Package Responsible Engineers (PRE) through procurement phase particularly during vendor liaisons.

Skills and experience

Ideally you will have experience in a relevant field or industry.
Good interpersonal skills and ability to work as part of a team.
Proficient in general IT and software packages e.g. Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel and PowerPoint.

Educational experience

Ideally you will have a degree in noise and vibration, physics or an engineering discipline e.g. mechanical engineering.
Preferably you will be a member of a relevant engineering, science, or environmental institute.

KBR Company Information

When you become part of the KBR team, your opportunities are endless. Through collaboration with our customers, we’re defining tomorrow’s challenges, then providing the solutions and services to overcome those challenges, always maintaining our commitment to total safety and reliability.

At KBR, we partner with government and industry clients to provide purposeful and comprehensive solutions with an emphasis on efficiency and safety. With a full portfolio of services, proprietary technologies and expertise, our employees are ready to handle projects and missions throughout their entire lifecycle, from planning and design to sustainability and maintenance. Whether at the bottom of the ocean or in outer space, our clients trust us to deliver the impossible on a daily basis.

Working at KBR means being rewarded for your contributions. In addition to competitive benefits and professional development, our people are empowered to use all their potential, creating meaningful change for themselves and our clients. We attract the best minds in the world because our expertise thrives on creativity, resourcefulness and collaboration. That is how we supply our clients with cutting-edge solutions and services.
 

As the needs of the world change, we’re ready to respond and guide the way forward with strategic, sustainable, and technological advancements grounded in more than a century of practical application and execution.

#LI-PS1

Lead QA/QC Engineer

Position: Lead QA/QC Engineer

About KBR 

"Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

The KBR team of teams delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. Excellent organizational and communication skills
Proficient in English and Arabic language

title: Reservoir Engineering Manager / Petroleum Engineering Manager
description:
Title:

Reservoir Engineering Manager / Petroleum Engineering Manager

Position Title: Reservoir Engineering Manager / Petroleum Engineering Manager

Department: Reservoir Management / Subsurface / Technical

Reports To:  Asset Manager / Technical Director

Location:  Basra, Iraq
Employment Type:  Full-time, Contract

Rotation:  28/28

Role Purpose

The Reservoir/Petroleum Engineering Manager leads the subsurface engineering discipline to maximize asset value through strategic reservoir management, production optimization, reserves assurance, and development planning. This role oversees multi-disciplinary teams, ensures technical excellence, and aligns engineering activities with corporate objectives for safe, reliable, and profitable hydrocarbon recovery.

Key Responsibilities

1. Reservoir Management & Field Development

Lead reservoir surveillance, performance evaluation, and reservoir modelling activities.
Direct the creation and updating of static and dynamic reservoir models.
Oversee development plans, depletion strategies, reservoir stimulation programs, and IOR/EOR initiatives.
Ensure optimization of production and recovery factors across assets.

2. Technical Leadership & Governance

Provide technical assurance on reservoir engineering work, simulations, forecasts, and reserves estimates.
Establish best practices, workflows, and standards across the reservoir engineering discipline.
Guide and coach engineers, ensuring continuous capability development.

3. Production Optimization

Oversee production forecasting, decline curve analysis, material balance, and nodal analysis.
Collaborate with production and operations teams to diagnose well performance and propose interventions.
Support short- and long-term hydrocarbon production strategies.

4. Reserves Management

Manage annual reserves certification (1P/2P/3P) and SPE-PRMS compliance.
Interface with internal and external auditors for reserves reporting.
Ensure robust documentation and auditable technical justification.

5. Project & Asset Integration

Collaborate closely with geology, geophysics, petroleum engineering, drilling, and operations teams.
Provide subsurface input for well planning, workovers, and drilling campaigns.
Evaluate project economics and support business planning and investment decisions.

6. Data & Technology

Champion use of advanced reservoir management technologies, digital tools, and AI/ML integration.
Oversee data quality assurance, interpretation, and integration into models.

7. HSE & Risk Management

Ensure all activities comply with corporate HSE and regulatory standards.
Lead subsurface risk assessments and ensure mitigation plans are in place.

Qualifications & Experience

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Petroleum Engineering, Reservoir Engineering, or related field (mandatory).
Master’s degree or PhD in Petroleum/Reservoir Engineering (preferred).

Experience

Typically 20+ years in reservoir or petroleum engineering.
Minimum 5 years in a leadership or managerial role.
Demonstrated experience with major oil & gas reservoirs (carbonate/clastic, conventional/unconventional).
Strong background in field development, simulation, and reserves evaluation.
Site experience in the middle east and any specific experience in the Iraqi southern Oil Fields would be advantageous.

Technical Skills

Expertise in reservoir simulation (e.g., Eclipse, tNavigator, CMG).
Proficiency in production optimization tools (e.g., Prosper, GAP, MBAL).
Strong reservoir surveillance and modelling capability.
Solid understanding of well testing, pressure-transient analysis, and flow assurance.

Soft Skills

Leadership and team development abilities.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management.
Strong analytical, decision-making, and strategic thinking skills.

The Opportunity
KBR is seeking a highly skilled People Advisor to contribute to the growth and success of our Australia Defence and Security Solutions (ADSS) business.

You’ll work closely with managers to provide practical advice and guidance, while contributing to people programs, policies, and processes. You’ll also gain exposure to strategic initiatives, all while being supported by an experienced People Team that will help you grow into the trusted HR professional you aspire to be.

This role is ideal for someone who has already built a solid HR foundation and is ready to take the next step - deepening their experience in partnering with leaders, advising on employee matters, and supporting people initiatives that make a real impact.

Experience in the Defence industry (desirable but not essential).
You must be eligible to obtain, an Australian Government Security Clearance.

description:
Title:

Mechanical Engineer

At KBR – We do things that matter. 

We deliver science, technology and engineering solutions to governments and companies around the world. KBR employs approximately 38,000 people worldwide with customers in more than 80 countries and operations in over 29 countries.

KBR is proud to work with its customers across the globe to provide technology, value-added services, and long-term operations and maintenance services to ensure consistent delivery with predictable results. At KBR, We Deliver.

With over 65 years working on some of Australia’s largest and most complex projects, KBR has unmatched experience supporting the nation’s critical infrastructure, energy transition and national security priorities. KBR has around 2,000 employees throughout Australia, who are focused on delivering innovative technology and engineering solutions for a safer, more secure and sustainable future.

Learn more about KBR in Australia  

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR 

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture. These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company. That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

Capability Life Cycle Manager (CLCM)

The CLCM is integrated into the System Program Office (SPO) and contracted to deliver through-life asset management of Products being supported (PBS). The CLCM performs asset, sustainment and engineering functions to optimise availability and Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) and minimise risk through life of the PBS. The CLCM works collaboratively via the SPO with Regional Maintenance Centre’s (RMC) to plan maintenance activities and installation of capability upgrades. The CLCM works collaboratively via the SPO with the Design Services Contract (DSC) to plan and execute engineering changes and services. The CLCM delivers functions against the contract scope across the Asset Class Enterprise to support Defence Maritime Capability.

The Opportunity: 

KBR is seeking a dedicated and experienced Mechanical Engineer to join our CLCM team to support the delivery of a sovereign sustainment capability to the Royal Australian Navy’s Amphibious Combat and Support Ship fleet.

As a Mechanical Engineer, you will support the Reliability and MRD Program Lead to deliver asset management services in accordance with the CLCM contract specifically relating to the Reliability and Maintenance Determination Program and Maintenance Effectiveness Reviews.

The Mechanical Engineer focusses primarily on identifying and solving problems related to the reliability of systems and equipment to increase the overall uptime and availability, and to reduce the number of failures and downtime.

You will work with and guide all stakeholders on technical matters including LSA, Maintenance Requirements Determination (MRD), and Reliability Centred Maintenance (RCM) on the products being supported.

This role is based out of Garden Island, Sydney.

Responsibilities: 

The key responsibilities of the role will include, but is not limited to:

Analysing systems and equipment failure historical data to identify patterns and trends.
Use statistical analysis to predict system reliability and risk of failure.
Conducting failure investigation and root cause analysis (FTA, FBD, RBD, 5 whys analysis, Fishbone, FMECA, FRACAS, RCM analysis etc.) to determine the underlying cause of problems and prevent recurring failures.
Conduct standard activity and maintenance task analysis to identify and minimize possible gaps in recommended maintenance.
Analyse performance metrics and benchmark performance across the platform against the RAM metrics
Document and communicate reliability analysis and testing results
Developing and implementing new maintenance strategies and routine maintenance checks to reduce risk, improve system performance
Finding new technology and processes that can improve equipment performance and reliability.
Collaborating with other departments to ensure that reliability is integrated into all aspects of the organization.
Developing and implementing training programs for employees.

As the ideal candidate you will bring: 

Essential: 

Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience coupled with relevant qualifications).
Minimum of 8 years of experience in a Defence or related technical industry such as Maritime, Rail, Manufacturing, Water, Mining or Oil and Gas.
Strong knowledge of reliability engineering and statistical analysis.
Experience with reliability-centered maintenance (RCM) tools and techniques.
Strong knowledge and thorough understanding of systems, equipment, tools and their functionality, safety, application, fault diagnosis, operating and maintenance requirement.
Excellent understanding of maintenance strategy, plan, policy and their implementation
Proficiency in software tools including MS Office and reliability software (OPUS, MADe, eLESPro etc) to support LSAR
Training in LSA or MRD or equivalent vocational training.

Desirable: 

Experience in the application of RCM2 and RCM3 and MIL-STDs for RCM.
Experience in the application of DEF(AUST) 5691 and 5692.
Experience in use of DOORS.
Experience in ship’s systems preferred.
Experience with Department of Defence design delivery.

All candidates will be required to hold and maintain an active Baseline Defence Security Clearance. Only candidates holding a Baseline Clearance or above should apply.

· A workplace culture certified as a Great Place To Work

· Flexible working

· Income protection

title: National Security Solutions (NSS) Systems Engineering Internship
description:
Title:

National Security Solutions (NSS) Systems Engineering Internship

Who We Are

KBR Government Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. Our solutions help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.

The Mission Ahead

This role is with KBR’s Government Solutions U.S. division.  At KBR Government Solutions, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. Our legacy of delivering advanced full life cycle professional and technical solutions is matched only by our commitment to operational readiness and innovation. As stewards of critical missions for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA, and other key federal entities, we excel in engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow.

Why Join KBR?

Mentorship from experienced subject matter experts
Cutting edge projects, relevant to real world challenges
Work in a collaborative and dynamic team environment
Networking opportunities with other technologists and executives
Competitive pay and great company culture

What You’ll Do

KBR is looking for highly motivated rising Juniors, Seniors and Graduate students seeking science, engineering and software development opportunities that provide challenging and meaningful work experience to be a part of our 2025 Intern class. 

KBR is recruiting full-time Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) Interns for the summer term. MBSE is the formalized application of modeling to support system requirements, design, analysis, verification and validation. At KBR, Model-Based Systems Engineers support government customers in engineering design, acquisitions, and education and training. MBSE interns at KBR will implement MBSE using the Systems Modeling Language (SysML), the most widespread language for systems modeling.

As a National Security Solutions Intern, you will:

Explore Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) approaches for defense applications
Develop curriculum to train engineers in systems theory and MBSE
Gain a wide breadth of experience in SysML modeling to support MBSE education

Selected interns for this paid opportunity will be provided with the opportunity to mentor with experienced professionals, gain experience and establish a name for themselves in this high demand career field. 

Anticipated Skill Set:

Full-time rising junior, senior, or graduate student working toward an engineering degree, ABET-accredited preferred
Must work well in both a team environment and independently
Must have excellent computer skills
Must have demonstrated a high level of academic achievement
Self-motivated; takes ownership of projects and issues, and following issues through to resolution
Strong verbal and written communication skills with attention to detail
Major field of study: Systems and Industrial Engineering, Computer Engineering, Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering

Scheduled Weekly Hours:  

Average 40 hours per week.

Requirements:

Security Clearance: Ability to obtain a U.S. Government Secret Security Clearance.

Basic Compensation:

$19.00 - $31.00 per hour (This range is for the Colorado area only).

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

title: Senior FEDSIM Slide Designer / Developer
description:
Title:

Senior FEDSIM Slide Designer / Developer

If you naturally visualize story lines and prefer to organize complex information into a dynamic format, KBR Mission Technology Solutions (MTS) is seeking Visual Solution Designer to join a team dedicated to pursuing assisted acquisitions and strategic contracts. The work combines a need for clear strategic thinking, project management skills, and a passion for compelling and persuasive graphics-oriented communication. Though the position is remote, you will be an integral part of a collaborative pursuit team focused on winning new work. 

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key Responsibilities:

The position supports the development of strategic and FEDSIM proposals as an oral presentation architect and content contributor. We are looking for an integral team player who works collaboratively with others, but who can also work independently, coordinate projects, develop and learn new skills, and maintain communication with various stakeholders across the enterprise. As a senior level position, responsibilities include mentoring more junior team members to help develop them into strong graphical business development contributors.

The primary responsibilities encompass project management and content development activities, sales material development and finalization, knowledge management, and research and analysis. You will:

Support pursuit management team from opportunity identification through award

Collaborate with Capture and Solution Architect team members to fully understand client desires and requirements

Support development of solutions targeted to deliver against client desires and requirements

Translate solution concepts into compelling graphics and slides

Develop proposal content for technical, management, and scenario responses

Collaborate with authors of other proposal sections to maintain message alignment across all proposal sections and volumes

Apply FEDSIM-specific oral proposal methodologies and scoring strategies to maximize evaluation outcomes

Collaborate in real-time with graphic artists and SMEs to develop visually impactful slides that clearly convey technical solutions and win themes.

Research and capture best practices from previous submissions, debriefs, and answers to follow-up questions

Perform all other duties as assigned  

Work Environment:

Location: Remote

Travel Requirements: Minimal 0-20%

Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications and Skills Requirements:

Technical Degree plus 12+ years that includes 8 in industry and 4 in BD

Experience developing oral proposals for FEDSIM and other large (>$200M) opportunities 

Strong project management skills including team facilitation and management of resources and schedules.

Excellent communication/presentation skills including persuasive writing skills. Superior organization and follow-through skills. Strong interpersonal skills and analytical ability.

Excellent business acumen. Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and adapt to changing priorities and assignments.

Ability to lead and work together as a team, either in a support role or as a project leader.

Ability to translate objectives into a schedule and series of activities to meet requirements.

Must be willing to learn new skills. Strong work ethic with the willingness to work overtime on short notice. 

Proficiency and familiarity with Microsoft 365 including Office, Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Capture Manager
description:
Title:

Capture Manager

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key Responsibilities:

title: Manager, Ordnance
description:
Title:

Manager, Ordnance

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

The Marine Corps Prepositioning Program (MCPP) is based in Jacksonville, Florida. We provide maintenance and logistic services to the U.S. Marine Corps (USMC) in support of this program.  For over 35 years we have planned, coordinated, and executed the maintenance and logistic services for ground combat vehicles and support equipment for USMC Expeditionary Forces.

Job Summary

Maintenance Manager oversees the installation and operation of a field maintenance shop and recovery teams, ensuring optimal performance of personnel, equipment, and facilities. This role involves managing the repair and servicing of Ordnance and Motor Transport equipment, ensuring compliance with technical specifications, safety standards, and operational goals. Through subordinate supervisors, the manager coordinates daily operations, safety initiatives, resource management, and continuous improvement efforts to achieve superior performance and safety outcomes.

Responsibilities

Operational Leadership: Supervise the installation, operation, and maintenance of the field maintenance shop and recovery teams, ensuring efficient servicing, storing, and repairing of Ordnance and Motor Transport equipment.
Compliance & Quality Assurance: Interpret technical specifications, work orders, and drawings. Ensure all work complies with KBR's safety, quality, and performance standards, as well as government regulations and industry best practices.
Financial & Resource Management: Review expenditure, financial, and operational reports. Recommend process improvements and ensure efficient use of resources, within budget limits. Approve requisitions for tools, materials, and equipment, ensuring compliance with KBR’s safety standards.
Safety Management: Foster a safety-conscious work environment. Ensure adherence to KBR’s ZERO Harm and TSTI procedures, promoting a culture of safety in a labor-union setting.
Human Resources & Performance Management: Manage resources within assigned area, set performance objectives/goals with safety targets, and oversee the day-to-day operational requirements of direct reports.
Production Process & Continuous Improvement: Establish and supervise maintenance processes, recommending changes to enhance operational efficiency. Ensure compliance with MPF ISO-9002 policies and KBR’s safety management system.
Administrative & Reporting Support: Assist in the preparation of operational and financial reports. Contribute to the formulation of policies, procedures, and ensure adherence to administrative and safety standards.
Training & Technical Guidance: Provide ongoing technical support and guidance to ensure compliance with operational procedures and best practices, making decisions where written guidelines are unavailable.

Basic Qualifications 

B.S. degree in a related discipline.
In lieu of a degree, a combination of college credits, other formalized training or education, and directly related work experience may be considered. 
Eight years of directly related work experience including four years supervisory experience in an Ordnance and or Motor transport environment. 
Completed the Ordnance or Motor transport maintenance officer course, or equivalent.
Ability to review and apply technical specifications and requirements.
Ability to analyze equipment and forecast spare part equipment. 
Ability to analyze maintenance repair or operation to determine methods of improvement.
Ability to comply with all established methods, quality standards, and time schedules applicable to this position. 
Strong written and oral communication.

Required Qualifications

Extensive experience in managing field maintenance operations, including recovery and contact maintenance teams.
Strong knowledge of technical specifications, quality standards, and safety regulations related to Ordnance and Motor Transport equipment.
Demonstrated ability to manage budgets, resources, and procurement within safety and operational guidelines.
Proven track record in fostering a safety-conscious work environment and managing human resources in a labor-union setting.
Strong leadership, communication, and decision-making skills, with the ability to motivate and manage a diverse team.
In-depth understanding of ISO-9002 policies and KBR’s safety management system.
Familiarity with government regulations, industry standards, and best practices in maintenance operations.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. title: Senior Operations Coordinator
description:
Title:

Senior Operations Coordinator

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR’s Global Asset Management (GAM) group provides comprehensive manufacturing and supply chain solutions globally, serving both commercial and government clients. With a wide range of services including Government Property Management, Production Maintenance, and Equipment Tracking, GAM is dedicated to ensuring excellence in every aspect of the supply chain and asset management process. This commitment ensures the seamless operation of our clients' enterprises across diverse locations.

Job Summary

The Senior Operations Coordinator plays a key role in supporting Engineering, Procurement, and Production Operations by applying broad functional expertise and a strong understanding of U.S. Government asset management protocols. This job is located in Clearwater, FL and is 100% onsite.

This role is responsible for maintaining government-approved business systems to ensure compliance with federal regulations (specifically FAR 45 and 52.245-1), customer requirements, and internal aerospace policies. Operating with minimal supervision, the Senior Operations Coordinator supports daily activities related to Government Property Management across the 10 recognized outcomes.

If you're ready to contribute to our team's success and thrive in a dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply today!

Roles and Responsibilities 

Lead contract management activities, including contract closeout, coordination with Disposition Leads for Plant Clearance, and assisting Program Managers with contract asset/material transfers and customer issue resolution.
Oversee new WBS setup and reporting in SAP; serve as a key SAP user by running reports and ensuring accurate data for performance tracking.
Drive compliance and risk mitigation efforts by developing and executing corrective action plans, supporting audit preparation, and maintaining integrity in contract and asset processes.
Mentor and guide program offices and junior staff, offering support on daily tasks, audits, inventories, and special projects as needed.
Participate in process improvement initiatives such as Six Sigma, RCCA, Gemba walks, and Kaizen teams to support continuous improvement and problem-solving efforts.
Interpret and execute contract requirements, Statements of Work (SOWs), and outcome metrics to ensure compliance and performance alignment.
Foster strong collaboration with custodians, Program Managers, Contracts personnel, and the Material Management team to support operational goals.
Support internal Tier accountability boards and escalation models, ensuring effective issue resolution and performance tracking across teams.
Collaborate cross-functionally with custodians, coordinators, and site stakeholders to ensure compliance with procedures and to implement process changes impacting multiple groups.
Must possess core competencies in U.S. Government FAR 52.245-1 requirements for contractors, including a solid understanding of the 10 Government Property Management Outcomes.

Basic Qualifications 

U.S. citizenship.
Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 3 years of relevant experience; a high school diploma and 3+ additional years of experience may be accepted in lieu of a degree.
Prior experience with government property management and familiarity with standard industry concepts.
Experience with PIEE (Procurement Integrated Enterprise Environment).

Preferred Qualifications

Proficiency in SAP and working knowledge of property systems such as eQUIP, AssetSmart, or equivalent.

KBR Benefits

title: Systems Admin (Network)
description:
Title:

Systems Admin (Network)

KBR’s Mission Engineering Division delivers complex technical solutions and expert support to the U.S. Department of Defense, specializing in modeling and simulation, cyber transformation, air vehicle mission integration, and lifecycle support. As a trusted partner with a proven history in mission technology, KBR collaborates closely with clients to develop innovative and effective solutions. With a strong ethical framework, KBR prioritizes data security, privacy, and responsible information management to ensure mission success.

Are you ready to take your networking expertise to the next level? KBR is seeking a Systems Admin (Network Engineer) with an active Secret clearance to join our Counter-UAS team at St. Inigoes, MD ( Webster Field Annex). This is a highly technical, customer-facing role where you’ll lead network design, implement cybersecurity standards, troubleshoot issues, and support next-gen system integration efforts. You’ll contribute directly to mission readiness while collaborating across engineering and IT teams. This is a full-time, on-site role (5 days/week), with the schedule subject to change based on contract needs.

Roles & Responsibilities

Network Design & Integration – Analyze and optimize network architectures across local, regional, and wide-area networks. Lead system design, integration, and on-site installation of advanced hardware and software systems to support mission-critical operations.
Security & Compliance – Implement Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs) for network and operating systems security. Support IATT and ATO package preparation to ensure lab environments meet DoD cybersecurity standards.
Documentation & Reporting – Create and maintain detailed documentation, including system diagrams, configuration templates, procedures, and technical reports to ensure operational transparency and compliance.
Troubleshooting & Performance – Utilize tools like Wireshark to identify, analyze, and resolve network issues. Apply engineering expertise to maintain system reliability, performance, and continuous improvement.
Collaboration & Project Execution – Work cross-functionally with internal teams and government stakeholders. Contribute to the planning and executing IT development projects while actively engaging in team meetings and infrastructure coordination.

Basic Qualifications

Citizenship & Clearance: Must be a US Citizen with an active/current DoD Secret Clearance.

Years of Experience & Education Requirements: BS/BA  from an accredited US institution and 8 years of experience. Additional experience or advanced degrees accepted /credited.

Travel: Ability to travel for work 25% to 40% (CONUS and OCONUS)

Preferred Qualifications

Master's Degree
Familiarity with Webster Field and NAS Patuxent River RDT&E network infrastructure
Cisco CCNP Certification.
Proficiency with Microsoft Visio. Experience with wireless or microwave point-to-point networking.  Experience with IPSEC VPN and L2TP. Familiarity with Linux - RHEL, SUNOS systems.
Current U.S. Passport

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40 hours/week

Compensation: $84,000-$160,000. The salary range posted is based on the national average. The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s location, knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience, contract affordability, and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation: KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of a sign-on bonus, relocation benefits, short-term incentives, long-term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

KBR Benefits​: KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development. #LI-ML2

title: Space Systems Advanced Development Chief Engineer
description:
Title:

Space Systems Advanced Development Chief Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

KBR is seeking a Space Systems Advanced Development Chief Engineer to join our team in El Segundo, CA.

You will join the MILSATCOM Systems Engineering team to help define the next generation of space communication systems supporting Air Force Military Satellite Communications. You will support Systems Engineering & Integration activities in a multidisciplinary and collaborative environment. You will interface and collaborate with SE&I team members, contractors, government civilians and members of the USAF. You may lead and support working groups responsible for leading technical discussion, resolving and identifying risks and requirements gaps, developing briefings, writing and tracking action items, and authoring meeting minutes.

The MILSATCOM Systems Engineering, Integration, and Test (MSEIT) effort provides leading edge Systems Engineering & Integration (SE&I) for the Air Force’s Space and Missiles System Center. We support the Air Force’s acquisition of state of the art Military Satellite Communications systems, providing global secure, survivable, and protected communications for our nation’s warfighters. We seek technical individuals who will thrive in a highly collaborative work environment of small teams, using the most modern tools and methodologies to tackle the challenges of integrating complex space and ground communications systems.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead SE&I Futures technical baseline and technology development for space systems command MILCOMM Program Executive Office
Maintain the military satcom solutions architecture and capabilities baseline for future systems
Support Analysis of Alternatives, trades, and acquisition of satellite and ground systems in support of tactical and strategic objectives of the Spaceforce Force Design
Interfacing with satcom users and stakeholders assessing needs, interfaces, and capabilities and apply to requirements, simulation, and development activities
Support international coalition architectures and operations development and planning
Develop new processes, tools, and algorithms in support of the architecture and technology integration processes
Conduct market and satellite and ground technology assessments and develop and launch projects to mature and transition capability onto programs and into operations
Interface with customers, users, and stakeholders at location, conferences, and workshops
Work with the nationwide network of the Futures Team SME’s
Face time with Los Angeles and Colorado Spaceforce customers in office exchange, meetings, tag-ups, and reviews
Travel Requirements: moderate to high (may be moderate through use of nationwide SME network)

Work Environment:

Location: On-site
Travel Requirements: Moderate
Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

An active TS/SCI clearance is required for this position
Bachelor of Science and twenty-five (25) years or more experience; Master of Science and twenty (20) years or more experience; 4 additional years of experience may be used in lieu of additional degrees; additional master’s degrees or PhD considered a plus and may impact compensation profile
Experience with space-based communications systems and/or military or commercial satellite systems
Experience with technical requirements development, systems engineering, systems integration, technology development, and overseeing development contracts to develop, design, assess simulation and prototype hardware and software
Must have an in-scope security background investigation (S or TS), and SCI eligible and enrolled in the Continuous Evaluation program (if applicable)
Must be willing to be nominated for access to Sensitive Compartment Information and Special Access Programs and willing to consent to a Polygraph examination

Basic Compensation:  $200,000 - $236,000 in California

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Ready to Make a Difference? If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team.

KBR Benefits  

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. title: Stakeholder Manager - Aldar FW
location:
locations
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
description:
Title:

Stakeholder Manager - Aldar FW

"Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 
The KBR team of teams delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.
KBR provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets."
Position: Stakeholder Manager
LOCATION: Abu Dhabi, UAE

THE ROLE

Reports to the Technical Director within the Programme Team. Responsible for Programme interface management with key stakeholders, in order to obtain all approvals related to design, handover, construction and issue resolution.

project description

This project will contribute to Abu Dhabi's growth and development by overseeing a diverse portfolio of projects that address key community needs. By managing the development of residential housing projects, ensuring the quality of new educational facilities and mosques, and maximizing urban space through infill development projects, we will create vibrant and sustainable communities, support the education and spiritual needs of the population, and enhance Abu Dhabi's reputation as a global city.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
Create a stakeholder map and develop, monitor and update the Stakeholder Management Plan
Develop relationships with key stakeholders to enable effective communication between their respective agency and the client Programme
Support the Technical Team and Delivery Managers in successfully driving infrastructure and building project issues through the respective agencies, with the aim to ensure project schedules are not impacted by stakeholder approvals, NOCs and permits.
Develop a thorough understanding of each stakeholder agency’s processes and challenges to enable the delivery team to tailor requirements accordingly
Feedback stakeholder issues, with proposed mitigations, to the PMC team to resolve issues and ensure appropriate timescales are included within project schedules for all approvals and permits
Attend coordination meetings with stakeholders and communicate issues to the appropriate Manager
Support the Technical Team and Delivery Managers to resolve issues between stakeholders and Design Consultants and Contractors in relation to both infrastructure and building projects
Maintain records of Stakeholder concerns, actions, owners, and due date
Prepare recommendations to improve communication and approval procedures with stakeholders. 
EXPERIENCE, SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE
BSc construction management, engineering, architecture, or equivalent
Minimum overall relevant experience 15 years.
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role
Minimum of 5 years working in Middle East
Fluency in Arabic and English languages both written and spoken
Knowledge of design and construction management on buildings and civil infrastructure projects including utilities interface and coordination management
Particular experience of dealing with Government Authorities and Utility Service Providers. Experience of Abu Dhabi Authorities is desirable
Experience and skills in developing and managing Stakeholder relationships.
COMPETENCIES
Strong Stakeholder focus.
Proactive
Strong interpersonal & communication skills
Team Management & Team player.
Planning & organising
Accepts responsibility.
HSE Awareness
skills: BSc construction management, engineering, architecture, or equivalent
Minimum overall relevant experience 15 years.
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role
Minimum of 5 years working in Middle East
Fluency in Arabic and English languages both written and spoken
Knowledge of design and construction management on buildings and civil infrastructure projects including utilities interface and coordination management
Particular experience of dealing with Government Authorities and Utility Service Providers. Experience of Abu Dhabi Authorities is desirable
Experience and skills in developing and managing Stakeholder relationships.

title: HSE Site Manager
description:
Title:

HSE Site Manager

Do you have a background of working within Resource Infrastructure projects, with familiarity of compiling and executing HSE and emergency plans to projects?

We are looking for an HSE Manager to join our site-based team in South Australia supporting a key resources project on a 12 month contract.

Summary: 

Reporting to the Project Director the HSE Site Manager will be responsible for HSE management of site activities overseeing construction works. Establishing and implementing appropriate tools and processes to establish effective safety management processes on site.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead the Health, Safety and Environment (HSE) function for all site‑based construction activities.

Develop, implement, and maintain robust HSE management systems, tools, and processes to ensure consistent and effective safety practices across the project.

Oversee and monitor day‑to‑day site operations to ensure compliance with project HSE requirements, legislation, standards, and best practice.

Provide guidance, coaching, and support to site personnel and subcontractors to promote a strong safety culture and safe work behaviours.

Conduct regular HSE inspections, audits, and risk assessments to identify hazards and drive continual improvement.

Lead incident investigations, ensuring root‑cause analysis is completed and corrective actions are implemented effectively.

Prepare and present HSE performance reports to the Project Director and project leadership team.

Coordinate HSE training, inductions, and awareness programs to ensure all personnel are competent and informed.

Liaise with internal stakeholders, contractors, and external regulatory bodies to ensure alignment on HSE expectations and compliance requirements.

Champion continuous improvement initiatives to enhance health, safety, and environmental outcomes throughout the construction lifecycle.

Skills & Experience Required:

Tertiary qualification in HSSE, minimum Diploma 

Minimum of 15 years’ experience, within an engineering or construction environment

Minimum of 5 years’ experience in HSE Management including working with senior management delivering HSSE programs business wide.

Solid industry experience operating as part of a leadership team; 

Drive, diplomacy, strong influencing skills & ability to multi-task;

Strong understanding of safety standards and regulations.

Excellent communication and leadership skills and the ability to interpret information to diverse audiences.

Ability to provide appropriate advice and coach management in difficult situations;

Candidates must be South Australia based initially required to work 10.5 hours per day, Monday – Friday initially for 3 months then reverting to roster (1 week on and 2 weeks off).

Be part of a high-performing, values-driven team.

Work on impactful projects that improve communities and support national infrastructure.

Our KBR Values - We Value Our People, We Deliver, We Are People of Integrity, We Empower, We Are a Team of Teams - embody our people centric organisation.

Our culture, and our genuine focus on our people is a major factor in our success and we want you to be part of our journey. 

Help shape tomorrow by applying today!

Don’t miss out on this opportunity to leave your impact on our society with one of Australia’s leading infrastructure businesses. Apply now and follow us on LinkedIn to stay up to date with all the latest news and job opportunities.

title: Program Test Systems Engineer
description:
Title:

Program Test Systems Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

KBR (formerly LinQuest) is the prime contractor on the MSEIT contract. By applying to this position, you are in consideration for KBR employment. However, you also have the option to be hired by one of our subcontractor teammates.

You will join a Systems Engineering team defining the next generation of space communication systems supporting Air Force Military Satellite Communications. You will support Systems Engineering & Integration activities in a multidisciplinary and collaborative environment. The Systems Engineer will interface and collaborate with SE&I team members, contractors, government civilians and members of the USSF. The System Engineer will lead and support several working groups responsible for leading technical discussion, resolve and identify risk, requirement gaps, developing briefings, writing and tracking action items, and authoring meeting minutes.

The MILSATCOM Systems Engineering, Integration, and Test (MSEIT) effort provides leading edge Systems Engineering & Integration (SE&I) for the US Space Force’s Space System Center. We support the Space Force’s acquisition of state of the art Military Satellite Communications systems, providing global secure, survivable, and protected communications for our nation’s warfighters. We seek technical individuals who will thrive in a highly collaborative work environment of small teams, using the most modern tools and methodologies to tackle the challenges of integrating complex space and ground communications systems.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop T&E strategy, Test and Evaluation Master Plan, requirement verification and test plans, test objectives, test methodology, and evaluation criteria   

Collect, review, analyze, and report T&E data

Support implementation of common Test and Evaluation database for the program

Support T&E reviews, audits, Integrated Product Teams (IPTs), Deficiency Review Boards (DRBs), Materiel Improvement Process Review Boards (MIPRBs), and Technical Interchange Meetings (TIMs)

Procure test equipment and develop test plans to test out candidate software/hardware changes and technology concepts to determine the feasibility of integration

Provide Government leads with accurate, objective, and impartial verification of the compliance status of systems, subsystems, and applications

Provide support to ensure effective capacity planning and reporting to enable the prioritization of testing tasks and focus testing resources on critical priorities

Conduct technical review boards and root cause analysis in government settings. Experience with these processes demonstrates an understanding of quality control, strategic alignment, and complex problem-solving

Implement Test tools and DevOps for testing analysis

Develop system-of-systems verification plans and trace verification plans to test events

Develop system integration plans for end-to-end system capability

Collect, analyze, and report on data collected during system-of-systems integration events

Ability to develop and improve procedures and processes and draft internal operating procedures

Work Environment:

Location: On-site

Travel Requirements: Minimal

Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

Ability to obtain DoD Secret clearance

BS degree in one of the following technical disciplines: engineering, physics, chemistry, mathematics, computer science

10+ years demonstrated experience in multi-faceted tests and test project teams, to include oversight of scheduling

7+ years test and evaluation experience with DoD/USAF test processes and documentation

10+ years’ experience in systems engineering

3+ years’ experience in space systems, which may be the space, ground, or terminal segments

Experience working with military or DoD civilian clients

Strong interpersonal skills, communication (oral and written), and presentation skills

Proficient in Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, Powerpoint)

Desired:

MS degree in one of the following technical disciplines: engineering, physics, computer science

3+ years’ experience with ground systems, such as terminals and networks

3+ years’ experience with military space systems, MILSATCOM, commercial SATCOM, or network engineering

3+ years’ experience in writing Test and Evaluation Master Plans (TEMPs) for space systems

Systems engineering certifications, such as CSEP, ESEP, OCSMP

Basic Compensation:  $114,000 - $160,000 in California

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Ready to Make a Difference? If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team.

KBR Benefits  

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.
