title: Hazardous Material Coordinator (Contingency Hire)
description:
Title:

Hazardous Material Coordinator (Contingency Hire)

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

Program Summary

KBR will help support the U.S. Navy and Marine Corps at Naval Station Mayport and the Marine Corps Support Facility at Blount Island (MCSF-BI). Our goal is to help their missions run smoothly and successfully. Let’s work together to make a positive impact and achieve results.

Naval Station Mayport is located along the St. Johns River in Duval County, Florida. It covers 3,409 acres and is the third-largest naval surface fleet area in the U.S. Since it opened in 1942, it has become a key hub with a harbor for 34 ships and a runway for most Department of Defense aircraft.

The Marine Corps Support Facility Blount Island (MCSF-BI) covers 911 acres on the eastern side of Blount Island, plus an extra 333 acres nearby. This facility is vital for keeping Marine Air-Ground Task Forces ready. MCSF-BI has a deep-water slipway and direct access to the Atlantic, allowing for quick loading and unloading of the largest Maritime Prepositioning Force (MPF) ships. This helps deploy combat vehicles and supplies.

Job Summary

KBR is seeking a Hazardous Material Coordinator to support operations at the Marine Corps Security Force (MCSF-BI) and the other MCSF-BI Annexes. The Hazardous Material (HAZMAT) Coordinator is responsible for managing, tracking, and ensuring compliance of all hazardous materials and waste operations on a U.S. military installation. This role oversees the receipt, storage, handling, issue, and disposal of hazardous materials in accordance with federal, state, local, DoD, and KBR environmental, safety, and quality standards. The Coordinator serves as the primary point of contact for all HAZMAT control and compliance activities on site, supporting a culture of Zero Harm and environmental stewardship.

Please note: This position is contingent upon award.

Roles and Responsibilities

Maintain accountability and inventory control of all hazardous materials and waste throughout their lifecycle—from procurement through disposal.
Conduct inspections and audits of hazardous materials storage areas, accumulation points, and satellite collection sites to ensure compliance with applicable regulations (EPA, OSHA, RCRA, DOT, and DoD directives).
Coordinate with Supply, Maintenance, and EHS teams to manage issue/turn-in processes and prevent over-stocking or unauthorized material use.
Develop, implement, and maintain Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS/SDS) systems and ensure accessibility to all personnel handling hazardous materials.
Manage, track, screen procurement, control storage and use, and arrange for disposal of hazardous materials (HM), hazardous waste (HW), and other regulated waste (ORW) using the HM Control and Management program
Manage and utilize the Hazardous Material Management System (HMMS) database to document all aspects of managing waste.
Support waste minimization programs and pollution prevention initiatives to reduce environmental impact and operational cost.
Conduct and document spill response activities, investigations, and corrective actions.
Coordinate with the EHS Manager to prepare and submit environmental compliance reports as required by DoD, EPA, or state agencies.
Ensure proper packaging, labeling, and shipping of hazardous waste in compliance with DOT and RCRA standards.
Occasional overtime and weekend work may be required based on operational needs.

Basic Qualifications

High school diploma or equivalent required; associate or Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Science, Safety, or related field preferred.
Minimum of 3–5 years of experience in hazardous material or waste management, preferably within a military or industrial environment.
A minimum of five (5) years of experience in managing 90-Day Central Accumulation Area Facilities of similar size, scope and complexity.
A minimum of 16-hour course in hazardous material transportation.
Demonstrated proficiency with the Hazardous Material Management System (HMMS) database for waste tracking and documentation.
Working knowledge of EPA, OSHA, RCRA, DOT, and DoD 4160.21-M requirements.
Strong understanding of spill prevention, response procedures, and environmental reporting requirements.
Excellent organizational and communication skills with the ability to interface across multiple functional areas.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and data entry/reporting tools.
Active Secret Clearance is required.   
Must be a U.S citizen for base access.
Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs and work in industrial or outdoor environments.
HAZWOPER 40-Hour Certification

Preferred Qualifications

Forklift license and spill response training preferred.
DOT Hazardous Waste Manifest training preferred.

title: Database Administrator SME
description:
Title:

Database Administrator SME

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

KBR is seeking a Database Administrator SME to join our team in Colorado Springs, CO. Active TS/SCI clearance required.

The Database Administrator (DBA) SME is accountable for database support and services for the Wideband C-SSE in Colorado Springs, CO by providing expert knowledge required to ensure database integrity and database replications while verifying database operations and maintenance is consistent across different systems. 

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Provides expert knowledge ensuring database integrity and replications and leads troubleshooting efforts for database problems/system errors.

Performs database management for multiple systems with software specific applications.

Designs, develops and implements proposed database applications to accommodate a variety of user needs.

Analyzes database requirements of the user department, applications programming and operations. 

Actively monitors the relationship between users and applications.

Maintains data files and documents procedures involved in performing Database User Management for all database actions.

Manages the creation, access, and removal of database user identifications IDs).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           

Writes, modifies, and executes shell management scripts and Standard Query Language (SQL) scripts to perform routine and special system procedures.

Utilizes system resources efficiently, minimizing the impact on other system operations during database maintenance activities

Submits recommendations for solutions that require definition of the physical structure and functional capabilities of databases and require data security and data backup/recovery specifications.

Performs software and database configuration management.

Coordinates and provides guidance to database management team.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

Education and Experience:

BA/BS degree and 8+ years of experience, or equivalent work experience in lieu of degree.

Relevant database administration certifications (SQL, Oracle, Microsoft, etc.) and Security + DAF Cyberspace Workforce Management Program.

Meet personnel security and training requirements for duties as required by DAFMAN 17- 1303, DAF Cyberspace Workforce Management Program.

Citizenship and Clearance:

US Citizen

Active Top Secret security clearance.

Technical Knowledge:

Root cause analysis and corrective action on database issues.

Design, development and sustainment of SQL Queries including stored procedures and PL/SQL code

Develop and sustain documentation including ER Diagrams, Physical/Logical database layouts, maintenance and user guides, sizing reports, and Configuration Management documentation and other specifications.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience with using specialized knowledge or skills to solve complex and unique problems.

Expertise with database utilities for databases including, but not limited to ORACLE and SQL Server.

Exhibits exceptional degree of ingenuity, creativity, and resourcefulness for problem solving and customer service; excellent written and verbal communications skills.

Understanding of cybersecurity and database administration.

Experience working with satellite communications systems highly desired.

SCHEDULED WEEKLY HOURS:

Normal hours of operation (0730–1630 hours).

40 hours, 5 days a week.

24/7/365 immediate, on-call support.

TRAVEL:

May require travel to CONUS and OCONUS locations, expect approximately 10%.

This position is contingent upon contract award.

Basic Compensation:

$133, 300 - $166,600

This range is for the CO area only

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s work location, knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience, clearance level, contract affordability and in consideration of internal parity.

 

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.  

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together

title: GFEBS Project Manager
description:
Title:

GFEBS Project Manager

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

The Base Operations Support Services program at USAG Stuttgart delivers comprehensive management, maintenance, and operational support across multiple military installations, ensuring safe, reliable, and high-quality environments for service members, civilians, and their families. With a dedicated team operating from Houston, Texas and Stuttgart, Germany, the program is recognized for its adherence to industry standards, regulatory compliance, and continuous improvement, supporting mission-critical objectives for major commands such as EUCOM and AFRICOM. The program’s achievements include timely facility maintenance, innovative service delivery, and a strong reputation for excellence within the Department of Defense community.

Job Summary

The GFEBS PM Coordinator Lead is responsible for the successful utilization and management of the General Fund Enterprise Business System (GFEBS) for preventive maintenance operations on a military installation. This role ensures accurate data entry, reporting, and coordination of maintenance activities, serving as the technical expert for GFEBS processes. The Coordinator Lead works closely with government representatives and contractor personnel to maintain compliance with contract requirements and optimize maintenance workflows. Strong analytical, organizational, and technical skills are essential for success in this position.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Serve as the lead coordinator for all GFEBS Plant Maintenance activities, ensuring accurate and timely data entry and reporting.
Manage preventive maintenance schedules, task lists, and equipment records in GFEBS.
Oversee Help Desk personnel and ensure they are trained and capable of fulfilling GFEBS roles.
Coordinate with government representatives (DPW GFEBS SME, PM Controller) for approval and updates to maintenance plans and records.
Ensure compliance with all certification, training, and documentation requirements for GFEBS operations.
Provide technical support and guidance to contractor staff on GFEBS processes and procedures.
Monitor and reconcile duplicate orders, ensuring data integrity across systems.
Prepare and submit required reports, documentation, and deliverables as specified in the contract.
Maintain confidentiality and security of all data and documentation in accordance with DoD and Army policies.

Basic Qualifications 

Must be a US Citizen
Demonstrated experience in successfully utilizing GFEBS on a military installation.
Minimum three (3) years of GFEBS experience, specifically with Property, Plant, and Equipment (PPE), business intelligence, and projects.
Completion of all required GFEBS training modules and possession of relevant certificates.
Ability to understand, speak, read, and write English at Level 3 or above (per TE05 Language Requirements).
Availability on-site between 0700–1600 hours, Monday through Friday, except holidays or administrative closures.

Preferred Qualifications

Advanced knowledge of Army Maintenance Application (ArMA) and integration with GFEBS.
Experience in leading teams or training personnel in GFEBS operations.
Certification in SAP or related enterprise asset management systems.

Salary Range (as required):

title: Technical Writing Intern
description:
Title:

Technical Writing Intern

Program Summary

KBR’s Missile, Aviation, and Ground Systems (MAGS) division delivers mission engineering solutions for critical U.S. Army programs, specializing in aviation and ground systems, integrated air and missile defense, and threat and target systems. As a trusted partner of the U.S. Department of War, MAGS provides innovative, technology-driven solutions to enhance national security. With a global presence and a strong ethical framework, KBR ensures secure, effective, and mission-ready capabilities worldwide.

Job Summary

As a Technical Writer intern with KBR’s Defense and Technology Systems (DTS) division, you will play a vital role in communicating complex technical information with clarity and precision. Imagine yourself collaborating with experts across engineering, ground vehicles, and defense agencies to develop comprehensive documentation that supports mission-critical U.S. Army programs. Your expertise will help ensure our teams are equipped with clear, accurate, and accessible materials, directly contributing to national security and operational success. Join us and become part of a dynamic team that values innovation, integrity, and a commitment to excellence on a global scale.

Roles and Responsibilities: 

Develop, write, and edit technical documents including user manuals, system documentation, standard operating procedures, and training materials.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to gather and clarify complex technical information and ensure accuracy in all documentation.
Translate technical concepts into clear, accessible language for a variety of audiences, ensuring consistency and compliance with established standards.
Review, revise, and update existing documentation to reflect changes in technology, regulations, or processes.
Maintain document version control and ensure timely delivery of high-quality materials to support program requirements and operational needs.

This internship will take place from May 19th to August 8th, 2026

Must have undergraduate level training in writing techniques
Enrolled at an accredited university in an English, Communications, or Journalism discipline
Proficiency in Microsoft Office products
Must be a U.S. Citizen

Self-starter and self-motivated
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong problem-solving skills.

title: Berthing Services Coordinator-(Contingency Hire)
description:
Title:

Berthing Services Coordinator-(Contingency Hire)

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR will help support the U.S. Navy and Marine Corps at Naval Station Mayport and the Marine Corps Support Facility at Blount Island (MCSF-BI). Our goal is to help their missions run smoothly and successfully. Let’s work together to make a positive impact and achieve results.

Naval Station Mayport is located along the St. Johns River in Duval County, Florida. It covers 3,409 acres and is the third-largest naval surface fleet area in the U.S. Since it opened in 1942, it has become a key hub with a harbor for 34 ships and a runway for most Department of Defense aircraft.

MCSF-BI covers 911 acres on the eastern side of Blount Island, plus an extra 333 acres nearby. This facility is vital for keeping Marine Air-Ground Task Forces ready. MCSF-BI has a deep-water slipway and direct access to the Atlantic, allowing for quick loading and unloading of the largest Maritime Prepositioning Force (MPF) ships. This helps deploy combat vehicles and supplies.

Job Summary

The Berthing Services Coordinator is a designated Key Personnel position responsible for managing and coordinating all contractor-provided berthing support activities for Port Operations at Naval Station Mayport. The coordinator ensures that ships are properly serviced and supported, overseeing all aspects of ship movements and hotel services in a safe, timely, and efficient manner. This role requires continuous coordination with the Government Dockmaster.

Please note: This position is contingent upon award.

Roles and Responsibilities

Act as a liaison for vessel operations, coordinate ship movement planning, and board vessels to manage their port activities.
Oversee the scheduling, docking, and undocking of all vessels in a safe and efficient manner.
Coordinate services such as water, fuel, and waste removal, as well as material handling equipment and stevedore support.
Ensure all berthing divisions and waterfront facilities are operational and ready for use.
Assist during port operations and emergencies, which can include spill response and disaster preparedness.
Input marine terminal operations data, process charges, and prepare necessary documentation. 
Manage and coordinate all contractor-provided berthing support activities.
Coordinate all services with the Government Dockmaster.
Coordinate hotel services, including but not limited to, connection/disconnection of shore power and potable water, staging/placement/stowing of fenders, brows, and brow stands.
Ensure berthing equipment (shore power cables, water hoses, brows, brow towers, fenders) are staged in advance of ship arrivals and removed and stowed when not in use or scheduled for use within 72 hours.
Coordinate services such as material handling equipment and stevedore support; crane services in support of Port Operations.
Once a ship arrives, verify berth set-up with the Government Dockmaster to ensure the ship is properly positioned
Make the entire workforce materials and equipment available for the protection of life and property in the event of severe weather (e.g., hurricanes, tornado).

Basic Qualifications

U.S citizen
Bachelor’s degree in Facilities Management, Business Administration, Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field
At least five (5) years of experience understanding of logistics, supply chain management, and maritime procedures is often necessary.
Strong ability to manage schedules, coordinate multiple activities, and maintain organization in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication skills for interacting with ship agents, crews, and other port personnel.
Must have a valid social security card, driver’s license, and birth certificate
US Passport with minimum one plus year validity remaining
Must be able to pass a pre-employment background check and drug screen.

Preferred Qualifications

OSHA Safety Certification

title: Global Head of Field, Support & Startup Services
description:
Title:

Global Head of Field, Support & Startup Services

When you become part of the KBR Technology team, your opportunities are endless. We are a leading global engineering, construction, technology, and services company on a growth path into the Energy Transition.  KBR Technology specializes in developing and licensing energy-efficient and cost-effective process technologies that provide environmental, economic and technical advantages to global energy.

KBR’s Sustainable Technology division is seeking a technically strong and business-minded Sub Product Service Line (PSL) Leader to grow and manage our Field, Technical Support, and Startup Services offering within the Asset Performance service line. This role will be responsible for delivering high-impact services to our technology licensees and customers, supporting both install base and grassroots projects. This includes field troubleshooting, commissioning and startup, turnaround, operations readiness, and general technical enquiries. The successful candidate will provide discipline-specific subject matter expertise, and drive strategic growth, and play a key role in ensuring customer success during critical phases of plant lifecycle operations. They will report to the Asset Performance Director, and be supported by the Asset Performance Managers, and Sales to build the pipeline of opportunities.

The Global Head of Field, Support & Startup Services will support our customers to resolve critical plant issues, accelerate time to peak performance, minimize disruption to production, derisk startup and operations. They will actively support with building a pipeline of opportunities and contributing to business development efforts. The role requires the ability to travel to customer sites and KBR offices as needed.      

Functional job responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

Development & Growth
Define and grow the Field, Support, and Startup Services offering to meet evolving customer needs.
Develop service packages that support commissioning, startup, and turnaround events.
Ensure readiness and responsiveness to customer technical enquiries and field troubleshooting support needs.
Collaborate with the Asset Performance Manager and Sales to identify new opportunities, establish service agreements and maximize revenue producing potential from each agreement
Technical Leadership & Delivery Excellence
Provide subject matter expertise in field services, startup, commissioning, and operational readiness.
Oversee the development of operations, training, startup deliverables
Ensure high-quality, consistent delivery of services across global customer engagements.
Lead offering development, innovation, and continuous improvement initiatives.
P&L Management
Support financial performance management for the sub-product line, including budgeting, forecasting, and profitability.
Monitor KPIs such as utilization, margins, overhead, and delivery efficiency.
Balance execution support across global offices and technical resources in collaboration with the Operations team
Customer Engagement & Strategic Support
Act as the primary management interface for field, technical support, and startup services.
Ensure customer satisfaction and long-term value realization through responsive, efficient, and reliable service.
Engage with customers to understand operational goals, and challenges with a view to introducing KBR solutions
Support strategic reviews and technical discussions with customer stakeholders.
Team Development & Collaboration
Attract, develop, and retain technical talent aligned with global service line needs.
Work closely with regional sales, engineering, and technology PSL teams to deliver integrated solutions.
Promote a culture of safety, ethics, and operational excellence.

Required Education, Experience, & Skills:

Ability to work in cross-functional and multi-cultural environments
Must have the ability to clearly convey technical concepts, business models in both verbal and written communications to clients, peers and KBR management. 
15+ years of experience in field services, commissioning/startup, operations readiness, or related technical support roles in the energy or industrial sectors.
Proven track record in business development and service line growth.
Experience managing P&L and operational performance metrics.
Strong understanding of field services, plant startup, turnaround planning, and operator training best practices.

title: Sr. Mechanical Engineer (Flight Hardware Development)
description:
Title:

Sr. Mechanical Engineer (Flight Hardware Development)

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

Around here, we define the future.

We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.
 

The Senior Mechanical Engineer will participate in the development of the hardware components of ground and flight hardware systems that will contribute to accomplishing NASA's mission. This hardware is to be used primarily to maintain the health and well-being of astronauts or conduct experiments on the International Space Station and exploration. The Senior Mechanical Engineer is expected to have high aptitude in mechanical design; concern with producing hardware of the highest quality; and have the capacity to understand and utilize the major concepts of mechanical engineering as well as having a general understanding of the integration of Mechanical engineering principles that will enable the successful interface with engineers performing work in these disciplines.

The Senior Mechanical Engineer is expected to:
1) Have extensive knowledge of mechanical engineering principles and practices and be able to apply that knowledge to make independent decisions on a broad range of space-related engineering problems
2) Independently evaluate, select, and apply standard and advanced engineering techniques, procedures and criteria and use judgement to make decisions to provide engineering solutions to problems. The Senior Mechanical will receive technical guidance on unusual or complex problems and supervisory approval on proposed plans for projects.
3) Serve in technical leadership roles
4) Have work reviewed to ensure sound profession judgment has been employed and participate in the review of others work to ensure the quality of that work
5) Perform mechanical engineering work including, but not limited to, requirements generation and definition, hardware conceptual design and test, hardware design and test, hardware detailed design and test, hardware, assembly/fabrication, hardware acceptance and qualification test support, hardware operations support for assigned projects in the Design Engineering and Fabrication Section.
6) Receive instructions on specific assignment objectives, complex features, and possible solutions and work with limited to minimal supervision.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
• Responsible for compliance with Safety, Health, and Environmental plan; must be committed to a high standard of safety and be willing and able to comply with all safety laws and the Company's safety policies/rules. Must be willing to report safety violations and potential safety violations to appropriate supervisory or management personnel.
• Responsible for compliance with the Quality Assurance plan, policies and procedures
• Must maintain regular and acceptable attendance level as determined by the Company
• Responsible for completing all assigned training
• Know and adhere to company policies, procedures, and work rules, demonstrate a strong work ethic and demonstrate involvement and commitment to the continuous improvement process
• Commitments are met, and all are done to the highest quality standards.
• Follow established procedures and generate finished work products under time and budgetary constraints and ensures product yields the expected outcome and meets established quality levels.
• Ability to work within a team environment
• Ability to understand and execute process and procedures
• Well-developed skills in both written and verbal communication
• Mentoring of younger design engineers
• Provide design review oversight and guidance to engineers for projects assigned.
• Perform assigned tasks in requirements/specifications generation and definition, hardware conceptual research, design and test, hardware preliminary design and test, hardware detailed design and test, hardware assembly/fabrication, hardware acceptance and qualification test support, and hardware operations support of assigned projects.
• Plan, schedule, conduct or coordinate detailed phases of the engineering work in a part of a major project or in a total project of moderate scope
• Perform work that involves conventional engineering practices but may include a variety of complex features and difficult coordination requirements
• Application of engineering principles and practice of related specialties
• Ability to communicate with all levels of contract management, peers and customers
• Support ISO/AS9100/CMMI activities and audits
• Ability to determine/track/report project tasking and to status technical, budget, schedule and risks
• Other duties as assigned  

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE
REQUIRED:
• A BS degree in Mechanical Engineering and a minimum of 10 years related experience, with average experience of 15+ years with at least 12 years in flight hardware development
• Previous working experience with NASA, NASA contractor or DOD
• Demonstrated success in working within complex projects in a dynamic environment
• Experience in developing hardware/products for extremely integrated projects
• Mentoring younger engineers
• Experience in troubleshooting hardware issues
• Capable of identifying risks and issues, reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options for mitigation and implement solutions
• Comprehensive knowledge of disciplines within engineering and how to apply appropriate expertise within human spaceflight programs
• Experience with NASA systems.
• Excellent written and oral communication skill including presenting information to customers
• Leadership experience of technical personnel performing complex engineering activities
DESIRED:
• Experience in troubleshooting mechanical issues
• Working Knowledge of electrical
• Experience in machine shop estimation and production planning

SKILLS/TRAINING
REQUIRED:
• Able to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing (MS Office tools)
• Able to work in a team environment
• Able to develop and clearly communicate information to technical forums
• Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills. Ability to lead and motivate personnel to high standards of performance and increase efficiency.
• Excellent oral and written communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively with project managers, project leads, peers, customers, and with contract colleagues is essential.
• Mature, professional judgment in establishing design artifacts, objectives, milestones and priorities.
• Experience with configuration and data management processes
• Reliable and dependable work habits and the dedication to get the job done.

DESIRED:
• Familiarity with NASA or DoD Work Instructions; Experience with NASA systems

title: Project Planner
description:
Title:

Project Planner

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely by supporting the science that informs decision makers and protects Earth.

Project Planner

KBR has an immediate need for a dynamic Project Planner in support of the United States Geological Survey (USGS) Earth Resources Observation & Science (EROS) Center (http://eros.usgs.gov/) near Sioux Falls, SD (http://www.siouxfalls.org). 

Position Summary

The Project Planner is a key member of the Task Planning and Controls Office (TPCO), which is responsible for the planning and execution of all ​task order-based projects under the Technical Support Services Contract (TSSC). The Project Planner collaborates with task managers to build resource‑loaded schedules, manage resource allocation for forecasting and cost reporting, and ensure accurate data, deliverable tracking, and variance analysis for leadership decisions. The Project Planner also contributes to continuous process improvement initiatives and fosters collaboration across teams.

Key Responsibilities

Scheduling & Planning

Develop and maintain work breakdown structures (WBSs), integrated schedules, project milestones, and deliverables
Perform schedule analysis, forecasting, and critical path reporting
Use Primavera P6, MS Project, and agile tools (JIRA, Confluence) for planning and execution
Provide regular status updates to task managers and stakeholders
Support scope definition and baseline management
Apply resource‑loaded scheduling to forecast labor, materials, and cost performance

Cost & Financial Reporting

Support cost performance reporting using Deltek Cobra
Prepare and deliver monthly financial reports and variance analysis
Assist task managers with task plan preparation and modifications
Track monthly deliverable status and project performance
Track travel and non-labor costs
Respond to project controls inquiries from customers and stakeholders
Support Earned Value Management (EVM) processes and metrics

Process Improvement

Contribute to the development and refinement of TPCO processes and procedures
Support change control and compliance with agency standards and regulations

Required Qualifications

Associate's degree in Project Management, Engineering, Finance, or related field
Minimum 1 year of experience in project management-related role
Working knowledge of Primavera P6, Microsoft Project, or equivalent software scheduling tool
Excellent communication and organizational skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Windows environments

Preferred Qualifications

PMP or equivalent certification
Understanding of project management principles and financial reporting
Familiarity with agile methodology and tools (Kanban, JIRA)

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS

Three years of continuous residency in the US for issuance of a Government Security credential
The candidate must be able to obtain and maintain a national agency check and background investigation after hiring to obtain a badge for government facility access and user account

Experience and/or Education in lieu of these qualifications will be reviewed for applicability to meet these requirements.

title: Facilities Maintenance Manager
description:
Title:

Facilities Maintenance Manager

Job Title: Facilities Maintenance Manager
Company: KBR-Iraq
Project: Majnoon
Location: Basra, Iraq
Employment Type: Full-time, Contract

Rotation: 28/28

Required: Expats

About Company

"Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

The KBR team delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets."

Job Purpose


The Facilities Maintenance Manager is responsible for the planning, leadership, and execution of preventive and corrective maintenance across all facilities supporting the KBR-Majnoon Project in Basra. This role ensures reliable, safe, and cost-effective operation of buildings, utilities, and technical systems (mechanical, electrical, plumbing, and structural), manages maintenance teams and contractors, oversees asset management and compliance, and collaborates with project leadership to support uninterrupted site activities.

Job Responsibilities

Develop and implement the facilities maintenance strategy, including preventive maintenance programs, predictive maintenance where applicable, and lifecycle planning for all plant and site infrastructure.
Lead, mentor, and manage maintenance teams (technicians, electricians, custodial staff, and contractors); assign work, monitor performance, and ensure a safe and compliant work environment.
Manage maintenance budgets, spare parts inventory, procurement, and vendor contracts; optimize cost efficiency while maintaining high service quality.
Oversee building systems (HVAC, lighting, electrical distribution, water supply, wastewater, fire protection, security systems, elevators/escalators, and other site utilities) for reliability and compliance with local regulations and company standards.
Plan and supervise facility upgrades, refurbishment projects, and expansions; coordinate with project management, logistics, and security.
Ensure adherence to Health, Safety, Environment and Quality (HSE/QA) standards; conduct risk assessments, incident investigations, and implement corrective actions.
Develop and maintain Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for maintenance activities, inspections, and emergency procedures; drive continuous improvement initiatives.
Monitor and report on key performance indicators (uptime, mean time between failures, maintenance cost per square meter, energy consumption, and safety metrics); prepare regular management reports.
Manage utility consumption and energy efficiency programs; identify opportunities for savings and sustainability improvements.
Ensure compliance with local labor laws, visa/work permit requirements, and company policies; coordinate with authorities as needed.
Maintain accurate records for asset inventories, maintenance histories, warranties, permits, and compliance documentation.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Facilities Management, Electrical/Mechanical Engineering, Civil/Building Services, or a closely related discipline).
Minimum 15 years of experience in facilities maintenance, preferably within large-scale industrial, construction, or multinational environments.
Proven experience managing maintenance operations for complex facilities, including mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems; strong vendor management and contract administration skills.
Demonstrated ability to manage budgets, assets, and maintenance programs in challenging or remote locations.

Technical Skills

Facilities Maintenance Planning and Preventive/Mpredictive Maintenance
Building Services (HVAC, Electrical, Plumbing, Fire Protection, Water/Wastewater)
Asset Management and Lifecycle Planning
Vendor Management and Contract Administration
Budgeting, Cost Control, and Spare Parts Management
Safety, Health, and Environmental Compliance
Maintenance Scheduling Software and Data Analytics
Energy Management and Efficiency Initiatives
Emergency Response and Incident Management

Location and Baseline Context

Onsite role based in Basra, Iraq. The Facilities Maintenance Manager should operate effectively in a dynamic, multi-national industrial setting with adherence to KBR-Majnoon project safety and security standards.

title: Housekeeper
location:
locations
Houston, Texas
Washington DC Metro Area
description:
Title:

Housekeeper

Housekeeper

This role will be located at an OCONUS location​ and 100% onsite

Who We Are

KBR Mission Technology Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. We help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.

The Mission Ahead

This role is within KBR/NSS Intel division.  At KBR Government Solutions, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. Our legacy of delivering advanced full life cycle professional and technical solutions is matched only by our commitment to operational readiness and innovation. As stewards of critical missions for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA, and other key federal entities, we excel in engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow.

Who YOU Are

You’re a dependable and hardworking Housekeeper with a strong commitment to maintaining clean, safe, and well-organized environments. Skilled in performing routine cleaning tasks, managing supplies, and addressing maintenance needs, you take pride in ensuring spaces are welcoming and functional. Your attention to detail, efficiency, and adherence to safety protocols make you a trusted professional in your field.

At KBR, you bring dedication, reliability, and a positive attitude to every task. Known for your ability to work independently and as part of a team, you play an essential role in creating environments that support operational success. Your commitment to excellence aligns with KBR’s mission of delivering innovative and reliable solutions for critical operations.

What You WILL DO 

In the role of Housekeeper, your duties will include:

Maintains adequate materials, supplies and equipment to work locations, replenishing inventory as needed. 

May perform a wide range of clean-up and housekeeping activities as needed.

Primary duties include washing linen, disposing of waste properly and cleaning of rooms.

Observes, follows, and enforces all safety rules and procedures, including wearing required personal safety equipment. 

Performs other duties and activities as directed by facility management or others. 

This is a contingent position based upon contract award and will be located OCONUS

REQUIREMENTS:

SECRET Security Clearance required

1+ years experience as a housekeeper or in a similar role.

Ability to clearly and effectively communicate with staff and guests.

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

title: Image Scientist - Journeyman
description:
Title:

Image Scientist - Journeyman

KBR is seeking a Image Scientist to support government customers in the Washington Metropolitan Area. The Image Scientist (Journeyman) provides expertise in imagery science, imagery analysis, and photogrammetry that enables the detailed technical analysis of GEOINT product quality. The journeyman imagery scientists will provide oversight and continuity of knowledge to the team, as well as support the broad range of assessments and assessment tasks both independent and with senior guidance. This individual will also support algorithm development and validation related to imagery science tasks.  

 

Responsibilities: 

 

Provide imagery scientist support through accomplishment of technical reviews, consultations, oversight of proposed and executed GEOINT product quality assessments and studies, and strategic level product quality direction.  

Provide image processing algorithm validation and verification in support of GEOINT product quality assessments or ad hoc customer requests.  

Provide imagery science services and analysis in support of GEOINT product quality assessments for the full range of traditional and non-traditional imaging systems, products, and data formats; sensor fidelity assessment, pixel registration assessment, Tonal Transfer Curve assessments, Relative Edge Response assessment, MTF and Signal to Noise Ratio assessment, and other product quality parameters.  

Support algorithm development in support of imagery science tasks and assessment of various product quality parameters.  

Provide photogrammetric services and engineering in support of the full range of traditional and non-traditional imaging systems and products; assessment of product geolocation accuracy using verified geolocation of a known features, verifying mensuration accuracy through measurement of known objects, calculating ground sample distance, and other photogrammetric analyses as directed.  

Provide imagery analyst support through technical review, consultation, and oversight of proposed and executed product quality assessments and studies, and strategic level product quality direction.  

Provide imagery analyst services in support of GEOINT product quality assessment planning, execution, and results analysis; imagery review, artifact analysis, NIIRS evaluations (absolute NIIRS, delta NIIRS, and ENS NIIRS evaluations), display performance assessments, etc. 

Required Education, Experience, & Skills: 

A minimum of 3 years of experience and a Bachelor of Science degree in image science, remote sensing, earth science, physical science, engineering, or similar engineering/science field.  

Strong Experience with SAR, IR, Spectral, LIDAR, ArcGIS, RSI ENVI, and photogrammetry. 

Experience in applied image processing and scientific analysis of imagery (SAR, IR, Spectral, Lidar, photogrammetry), knowledge of image formation, and associated discipline phenomenology. 

Experience in scientifically processing imagery (SAR, IR, Spectral, Lidar) from Civil and Commercial imaging systems, proficiency with techniques, algorithms, and scientific analysis of associated discipline data processing using RSI ENVI. 

Experience with GOTS applications such as FSTK and AGITK. 

Ability to work in a very dynamic and demanding work environment. 

Must be a self-starter, able to operate with little guidance. 

Must be a self-starter, able to operate with little guidance. 

Security Clearance Requirements: Active TS/SCI (with Poly preferred)

title: Carpenter
location:

Washington DC Metro Area
description:
Title:

Carpenter

Carpenter

This role will be located at an OCONUS location​ and 100% onsite

Who We Are

KBR Mission Technology Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. We help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.

The Mission Ahead

This role is within KBR/NSS Intel division.  At KBR Government Solutions, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. Our legacy of delivering advanced full life cycle professional and technical solutions is matched only by our commitment to operational readiness and innovation. As stewards of critical missions for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA, and other key federal entities, we excel in engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow.

Who You Are

KBR is in search of a Carpenter that is skilled and dedicated with a passion for precision and craftsmanship, committed to supporting mission-critical operations. Your expertise lies in building and maintaining high-quality structures that meet the rigorous standards of our customers. You understand the importance of safety, reliability, and efficiency and take pride in your ability to adapt to complex project requirements with skill and resourcefulness.

As a Carpenter with KBR, you thrive in fast-paced environments and work effectively as part of a team. You bring a strong work ethic, attention to detail, and a focus on delivering results that enhance operational readiness. Your commitment to excellence and problem-solving skills contributes to KBR’s mission of building a safer, more secure, and sustainable world.

What You’ll Do

In the role of CARPENTER, your duties will include:

Perform routine and preventative maintenance of building woodwork and associated equipment.

Design, build, install, and repair structures and fixtures made from wood and other materials, including furniture, stairways, door frames, partitions, and rafters.

Read and interpret blueprints, drawings, and sketches to fully grasp requirements and provide accurate work estimates.

Cut, shape, and smooth lumber and other material (e.g., fiberglass and drywall) according to measurements.

Inspect building frameworks (e.g., walls, roofs) to identify the need for repairs or replacements and ensure structural integrity.

Liaise with other maintenance teams to coordinate renovations or major repair tasks.

Adhere to safety protocols and wear appropriate personal protective equipment during all construction activities.

Maintain accurate records of materials inventory and task completion to ensure accountability and project tracking.

Other duties as required

This is a contingent position based upon contract award and will be located OCONUS 

Requirements:

TS/SCI w/ Poly Clearance or Secret Cleared with eligibility to upgrade 

High school diploma or equivalent (GED)

TVC/Journeyman Card, Journeyman Carpenter Certificate or Completion of a recognized apprenticeship or vocational program.

(10) years of experience, two (2) of which are in a lead or supervisory role.

Possess practical knowledge of repairs installation of floor and ceiling tile, walls (plaster, block, drywall), masonry work, locksmithing, cabinet making, framing, form work and general knowledge of the painting trade.

Have experience with operating small power tools and machinery as required.

Have experience reading blueprints and perform material take-offs from prints.

A willingness to work rotational shift if necessary, including days, evenings, and nights as well as overtime, weekends and holidays as required.

Preferred Additional Skills: 

Possesses an Active and current TS/SCI w/ Poly Clearance

Effective Leadership and Communication skills to professionally work with the customer and subordinates.

Knowledge of PM programs.

title: Manufacturing Manager
description:
Title:

Manufacturing Manager

Program Summary

KBR’s Missile, Aviation, and Ground Systems (MAGS) division delivers mission engineering solutions for critical U.S. Army programs, specializing in aviation and ground systems, integrated air and missile defense, and threat and target systems. As a trusted partner of the U.S. Department of War, MAGS provides innovative, technology-driven solutions to enhance national security. With a global presence and a strong ethical framework, KBR ensures secure, effective, and mission-ready capabilities worldwide.

Job Summary

The Manufacturing Manager serves as the overall leader for contract execution, overseeing personnel management, technical operations, and total task order (TO) performance. This role is responsible for ensuring high-quality, efficient delivery across all aspects of the contract, including business processes and technical outcomes as well as optimal use of assigned resources and subcontractors.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Provide overarching leadership and guidance to all contractor personnel
Assign tasks, supervise ongoing technical work, and optimize resource and subcontractor utilization.
Coordinate and collaborate on all tasks, activities, requirements, and issues related to Customer support; maintain proactive, transparent communication to effectively manage Customer expectations.
Serve as the primary point of contact for formal Customer discussions, fostering high satisfaction and ongoing improvement.
Monitor program cost, performance, quality, schedule, and risk; adapt plans based on Customer feedback.
Develop and maintain project schedules and documentation that reflect implementation of key requirements.
Apply established program management procedures to track cost, schedule, inventory, and performance.
Analyze variances and implement corrective actions to maintain program targets.
Interpret contract requirements from the designated management tool and assign qualified, cleared personnel.
Identify and mitigate potential downstream issues that may impact program objectives.
Ensure continuity of operations during personnel transitions; approve staffing alignments and resource allocations.
Oversee budgeting, cost control, financial reporting, and overall operational expenditures.
Coordinate work priorities and continuously monitor processes, procedures, and program implementation.
Drive improvements in cost-effectiveness and operational efficiency.
Oversee quality control, contract compliance, and inspection of maintenance and service operations.
Review and validate accuracy of management and contract reports prior to submission.
Cultivate strategic relationships with external agencies and stakeholders, promoting interagency collaboration and resource sharing that expands mission capabilities and cost-effectiveness.

Required Qualifications: 

Bachelor’s degree in engineering (Aerospace, Mechanical, Electrical, Electronics, or Industrial) with at least eight years of experience in the field
Minimum of five years’ experience managing and coordinating a DoD acquisition of similar scope and complexity within the last five years.
Minimum of five years’ experience in managing strategic outreach efforts to external Government agencies, programs, and resources that can enhance the program.
Must be a U.S. Citizen with an active Secret clearance
Willingness to travel domestically (CONUS) and internationally (OCONUS) as needed.

Preferred Qualifications: 

Proven skills in project team facilitation, resource management, and scheduling.
Strong written communication and presentation abilities, including persuasive writing.
High adaptability and eagerness to learn new skills.
Excellent organization, follow-through, and multitasking capabilities.
Strong interpersonal and analytical skills.
Demonstrated business acumen and leadership.
Ability to lead projects and contribute effectively in both leadership and support roles.
Competence in translating objectives into actionable plans and schedules.
Possess an active Project Management Institute (PMI) Project Management Professional certification or PMI Program Management Professional (PgMP®) certification

title: Senior Acquisition Analyst
description:
Title:

Senior Acquisition Analyst 

KBR’s Mission Engineering Division delivers complex technical solutions and expert support to the U.S. Department of War, specializing in modeling and simulation, cyber transformation, air vehicle mission integration, and lifecycle support. As a trusted partner with a proven history in mission technology, KBR collaborates closely with clients to develop innovative and effective solutions. With a strong ethical framework, KBR prioritizes data security, privacy, and responsible information management to ensure mission success.  

We are seeking a Senior Acquisition Analyst with an expert understanding of Department of War (DoW) acquisition and program management procedures and policies and a basic understanding of Counter-Small Unmanned Aircraft Systems (C-sUAS) technologies to support the DoN’s Office of the Chief of Naval Operations (OPNAV) in Arlington, VA (Pentagon).

  

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Analyst will support the OPNAV N4I C-UAS Team, and may directly interact and support OPNAV Installations and Logistics (N4) Director, Deputy Director and other N4 staff members by applying acquisition subject matter expertise to the OPNAV planning, programming, budgeting, and execution of C-sUAS/CuXS developmental projects. Analyst will also apply program management subject matter expertise to conduct regular program management reviews of active developmental projects and to conduct reviews of new project proposals and to staff those proposals through the process for approval. The analyst will coordinate directly with stakeholders in the Office of the Secretary of Defense, the Joint Staff, the Services, and other DoD and U.S. Government organizations.
Working closely with OPNAV N4 military and civilian leads and executing their guidance.    Maintaining situational awareness of current and developing UAS threats and C-sUAS solutions and understanding and following DoD standard operating procedures (SOPs) and policies.  Maintaining situational awareness of and following applicable DoD acquisition and program management procedures and policies.  
Coordinating and leading regular program management reviews of active (currently funded) research, development, test, and evaluation (RDT&E) projects to develop C-sUAS solutions.  Coordinating and leading corrective actions for underperforming projects.  
Coordinating and leading annual reviews of proposals for RDT&E projects to develop C-sUAS materiel solutions.  Identifying acquisition courses of action (COAs) for new RDT&E proposals and staffing them through the process for approval.   Coordinating with the DON Resource Management team and the supporting acquisition organization for accurate and timely reporting of project budget execution for the current fiscal year (FY) and planning for future FYs.  
Providing project management coordination and leadership for DON-led projects.  Coordinating operational planning teams and working groups with staff and external stakeholders as needed for special subjects/issues.  
Coordinating staffing actions and taskers in accordance with OPNAV SOPs and policies.  Preparing written products (emails, presentations, info papers, reports, and executive summaries) based on military and civilian lead guidance in accordance with OPNAV procedures and policies.  Support the Project Objective Memorandum (POM) and budget formulation process as directed by the resource sponsor.Prepare, process, and respond to tasking received via Enterprise Task Management Software Solution (ETMS2) as well as generate tasking assignments to subordinate commands as required.
Displaying oral and written communication skills and proficiency in Microsoft Office products (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Teams, and Word).  Possess a working understanding of the relationships and responsibilities of the DON, to include the offices of the Secretary of the Navy and Chief of Naval Operations. Answering requests for information from a variety of key stakeholders, including Congress, OSD, and the Services.    

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:  

Must be a US Citizen.
Active Secret level security clearance with the ability to obtain a Top Secret clearance.  
4 years of related work experience.  
Bachelor’s Degree in a STEM or business field, or equivalent experience.   

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

8+ years of related work experience
Active Top Secret security clearance
Master’s Degree is an applicable field

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40 hours/week

title: Operations Manager
description:
Title:

Operations Manager

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR. 

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers.  But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely. 

The Department of Defense (DoD) developed the Military and Family Life Counseling (MFLC) program as an initiative of the Office of the Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for Military Community and Family Policy (MC&FP), facilitating private and confidential Non-Medical Counseling services.

The MFLC Program was established to expand access to confidential, face-to-face counseling and reduce the barriers and stigma often associated with seeking counseling support.

Currently, the MFLC Program provides non-medical counseling, consultation, and outreach services to more than 200 military installations or nearby civilian communities located in most all the 50 states, the District of Columbia, United States (U.S.) territories and commonwealths, and over 25 foreign countries including areas considered hazardous duty/danger zones.

POSITION IS CONTINGENT UPON CONTRACT AWARD.

Position may be remote.

KBR is seeking an Operations Manager (OM).  The OM shall be a part of the management team including overseeing the human resources duties and managing the daily operations of the contract. The OM responsibilities shall include ensuring that Government worldwide assignment requests, currently provided via TDLs, are fulfilled in a timely manner and execution of all work assignment logistics and travel, to meet assignments, are completed and coordinated with the applicable stakeholders’ POCs per worksite. The OM shall also ensure efficient and effective operational procedures and processes to enable successful contract execution, as well as quality of services delivery to eligible participants.

Qualifications: 

a. At least five years of experience managing program operations for an international,

globally dynamic, geographically dispersed, rapidly changing, and diverse program environment.

b. At least five years of experience with human resource management and worksite/assignment tracking, financial management, and stakeholder communications.

Desired Qualifications: 

BS / BA Engineering, Sciences, or a related field

a. At least two years’ experience managing SLAs under an incentive-based contract.

b. At least two years’ experience supporting military organizations.

c. A bachelor’s degree, at a minimum, from an accredited university or college in business administration, project management, and/or similar academic profession

title: Stakeholder Integration Officer (Utilities)
description:
Title:

Stakeholder Integration Officer (Utilities)

Simply put, at KBR, we do things that matter.

Every day, our people work together to deliver solutions that are helping solve the great challenges and opportunities of our time, including climate change, national security, energy transition and security, cybersecurity, space exploration, and more.

About the role

The Utilities Integration role is based on our client site and is responsible for leading stakeholder engagement and management for utility services (power, water, and communications).

The role ensures effective integration among client stakeholders by systematically identifying and analysing stakeholders, planning and conducting interactions to engage and communicate with them, and considering their levels of influence and specific interests. This position will ensure stakeholder involvement throughout the entire project lifecycle.

Role Expectations

You will lead Utilities focused stakeholder analysis, using appropriate tools in conjunction with other project utility leads, and provide advice on the most appropriate communication channel for each stakeholder group in area of responsibility.

Develop the profile by working with the project to understand and map the changing needs of the project against utility stakeholder influence and involvement. Support the development of the stakeholder profile throughout the project, providing or populating standard templates where necessary and recording outcomes from analysis.

Act as the utility stakeholder lead between Projects to enable integration ensuring regulatory, compliance and base process requirements are met. Ensure proposed surveys, temporary diversions, disconnections and new service connections for each phase of the programme includes Client lead engagement at all stages and are effectively communicated in ample time at relevant forums and approval boards.

Ensure potential risks are captured and recorded with development of appropriate mitigation actions.

Who Do We Need

A working knowledge of utilities or utility stakeholder management within a project delivery environment would be highly beneficial for this role.

Familiarity with relevant industry standards and best practices.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Able to work effectively in interdisciplinary teams.

An individual with experience of project management level stakeholder management and engagement, ideally in a government project delivery environment is highly desirable.

Location

The role is Hybrid where 3 days per week will be spent on the Client site in Helensburgh.

Security Requirements

SC Clearance

Due to the secure nature of this project, restrictions in relation to UK residency and nationality will apply.

title: Civil Engineer
description:
Title:

Civil Engineer

Simply put, at KBR, we do things that matter.

Every day, our people work together to deliver solutions that are helping solve the great challenges and opportunities of our time, including climate change, national security, energy transition and security, cybersecurity, space exploration, and more.

The KBR team of teams delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.

The Civil Engineer will be working as part of a multi-disciplinary engineering team within the Approving Authority; the primary purpose of the role is to directly support current operations and future programmes.

What Do We Need

Experience in the design assessment of reinforced concrete and steelwork structures to withstand dynamic loads including earthquake motions, blast, wind, rain and snow loading.

Experience working on reinforced concrete and steelwork marine structures and jetties.

Experience of producing robust technical justification to allow for relevant civil/structural design modifications to be authorised within a high hazard industry.

Apply appropriate theoretical and practical methods to design, develop, manufacture, construct, commission, operate, maintain, decommission and re-cycle engineering processes, systems, services and products in a nuclear/high risk environment.

Qualifications

location:
locations

Washington DC Metro Area
description:
Title:

Custodial Cleaner

Custodial Cleaner

This role will be located at an OCONUS location​ and 100% onsite

Who We Are

KBR Mission Technology Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. We help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.

The Mission Ahead

This role is within KBR/NSS Intel division.  At KBR Government Solutions, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. Our legacy of delivering advanced full life cycle professional and technical solutions is matched only by our commitment to operational readiness and innovation. As stewards of critical missions for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA, and other key federal entities, we excel in engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow.

Who YOU Are

We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Custodial Cleaner to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for maintaining cleanliness and order in residential and commercial spaces. This role requires a proactive approach to ensure that all areas are clean, safe, and well-maintained, contributing to a positive atmosphere.

What You'll Do

In the role of Custodial Cleaner, your duties will include:

Responsibilities

Perform routine cleaning tasks in commercial settings, ensuring all areas are maintained to high standards.

Perform thorough cleaning of residential homes and commercial properties, including dusting, vacuuming, mopping, sanitizing surfaces, and emptying trash bins

Conduct floor care activities including sweeping, mopping, and vacuuming.

Conduct carpet cleaning and laundering of linens as needed. Ensure all areas are cleaned according to company standards, paying attention to detail in every task.

Maintain a high level of customer service by communicating effectively with clients and addressing any specific cleaning requests or concerns.

Follow safety protocols while using cleaning supplies and equipment and have knowledge of safe disposal of chemical liquids and other hazardous components.

Assist in organizing cleaning schedules and managing time effectively to complete tasks within designated timeframes.

Report any maintenance issues or safety hazards observed during cleaning tasks.

Assist with facilities maintenance by reporting any repair or maintenance needs to management.

Maintain cleanliness in restrooms and common areas, ensuring supplies are stocked.

Support industrial cleaning efforts by following safety protocols and using appropriate cleaning equipment.

Collaborate with team members to ensure efficient workflow and high-quality service delivery.

This is a contingent position based upon contract award and will be located OCONUS

REQUIREMENTS:

Must possess an Active Secret Security Clearance with the ability to obtain a TS/SCI w/ Poly level clearance.

High school diploma or GED equivalent

(1)+ years' of experience in custodial work or equivalent positions

Be able to clearly and effectively communicate with staff and guests

Ability to operate cleaning machines such as buffers, scrubbers, vacuums, etc.

description:
Title:

Field Service Automation Engineer  (Contingency Hire)

Belong, Connect, Grow with KBR! 

Program Summary

The KBR Field Service Automation team installs and maintains automated systems used in industrial or manufacturing settings. They ensure material handling automated equipment, controllers, and software operate efficiently to optimize production processes. Their work often involves troubleshooting on-site, programming PLCs (Programmable Logic Controllers), and integrating new technologies. Additionally, they collaborate with engineering teams and clients to tailor automation solutions to the specific operational needs of our clients.

Job Summary

A Field Service Automation Engineer installs, maintains, and repairs automated equipment at customer sites. They troubleshoot hardware and software issues to ensure systems operate efficiently and with minimal downtime. The role involves frequent travel, hands-on technical work, and direct customer interaction. Regular inspections and system updates are also part of the job to maintain optimal performance.   Job is on site and not remote.

We are seeking flexible, project-ready professionals to join our talent pool for  on-call assignments.  Selected candidates will be engaged on a project-by-project basis. This opportunity is ideal for individuals looking to stay connected, contribute as needed, and be considered for contract or long-term roles as client needs arise.  Assignment times may vary from a few days to several weeks. 

Roles and Responsibilities 

Generate electrical schematics, P&IDs, and sequence of operations.

Conduct SOPs, risk assessments, validation reports, FAT/SAT documentation.

Root cause analysis for equipment and controls failures.

Program, test, and troubleshoot PLCs, HMIs, SCADA systems, and robotics.

Conduct system integration, calibration, and validation of automation equipment.

Monitor the software platform and analyze the data to facilitate efficiency and readiness.

Use dashboards or analytics platforms for downtime/OEE tracking.

Lead control system projects from concept of task to commissioning.

Analyze system data and diagnostics to improve reliability, efficiency, and productivity.

Ensure compliance with safety standards, industry regulations, and internal quality procedures.

Basic Qualifications 

Bachelor’s or Master's degree in electrical engineering, Mechatronics, or related field

Willingness to travel for commissioning and support.

PLC programming (Siemens, Allen-Bradley/Rockwell, Beckhoff, Omron) -- five years field experience.

HMI/SCADA configuration (Wonderware, Ignition, WinCC, FactoryTalk View) -- three years or more experience.

Motion control systems (servo motors, VFDs, stepper systems).

PID tuning and loop control.

Proficiency in industrial Ethernet (EtherNet/IP, Profinet, Modbus TCP/IP).

Fieldbus protocols (CANopen, DeviceNet, Profibus, AS-i).

Network design and diagnostics (VLANs, switches, routers).

Integration with robotic systems (Fanuc, KUKA, ABB, Yaskawa).

Automated storage and retrieval systems (AS/RS).

Conveyor systems, sorters, pick-to-light/put-to-light systems.

Experience with goods-to-person (GTP) and shuttle systems.

Electrical panel design and wiring (AutoCAD Electrical, EPLAN).

Familiarity with NFPA 70/NEC, UL, CE standards.

Safety systems (Safety PLCs, light curtains, emergency stops, interlocks).

Experience with MES/WMS/WCS integration.

SQL and data logging for performance monitoring.

Preferred Qualifications

Degree or work experience Mechatronics, or related field work

5–8+ years in automated warehouse material handling systems.

Experience in e-commerce or high-throughput logistics environments (e.g., Amazon, Ocado, DHL)

Familiarity with cloud-based automation monitoring or BBMS platforms.

description:
Title:

Automated Material Handling Equipment Tech I (Contingency Hire)

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR is seeking a skilled Automated Material Handling Equipment (AMHE) Mechanic to support operations in dynamic industrial environments such as warehouses, distribution centers, and manufacturing facilities. This role is essential to ensuring the reliability and efficiency of automated systems that move, store, and manage materials. The AMHE Mechanic will contribute to the seamless operation of mission-critical logistics and production systems, supporting KBR’s commitment to operational excellence and innovation.

Job Summary

The AMHE Mechanic is responsible for maintaining, troubleshooting, and repairing a wide range of automated equipment including conveyors, robotic systems, and automated guided vehicles (AGVs). This position requires a strong mechanical and electrical aptitude, as well as the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams. The ideal candidate will have experience with preventive maintenance, system diagnostics, and compliance with safety standards in an industrial setting.

We are seeking flexible, project-ready professionals to join our talent pool for on-call assignments.  Selected candidates will be engaged on a project-by-project basis. This opportunity is ideal for individuals looking to stay connected, contribute as needed, and be considered for contract or long-term roles as client needs arise.  Assignment times may vary from a few days to several weeks. 

Roles and Responsibilities 

Perform preventive maintenance on automated systems such as conveyors, AS/RS, sortation systems, robotic arms, and AGVs
Diagnose and repair mechanical, electrical, and software-related issues
Replace worn parts, lubricate components, and ensure optimal system performance
Monitor system operations to detect irregularities or breakdowns
Use diagnostic tools and software to identify and resolve faults
Assist in the installation and commissioning of new equipment or upgrades
Calibrate systems to meet manufacturer specifications
Ensure compliance with safety regulations and company standards
Maintain accurate records of inspections, repairs, and part replacements
Participate in safety audits and respond to system-related hazards
Collaborate with engineers, operations staff, and IT teams
Provide feedback on equipment reliability and recommend improvements

Basic Qualifications 

HS Diploma or equivalent
1+ years of experience in mechanical or electrical maintenance
Familiarity with automated systems and industrial machinery
Ability to read technical manuals and schematics
Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Basic understanding of PLCs, sensors, and actuators
Willingness to work in a fast-paced, industrial environment

Preferred Qualifications

Associate degree or technical certification in industrial maintenance, mechatronics, or related field
Experience with robotic palletizers, carousels, and pick-and-place robots
Knowledge of automated storage and retrieval systems (AS/RS)
Hands-on experience with AGVs and robotic systems
Proficiency in using diagnostic software and tools
OSHA safety training or equivalent certification

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.
