title: Operations Readiness Advisor
description:
Title:

Operations Readiness Advisor

Operations Readiness Advisor
ETEN40 - Technical Professional Advisor

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

The Operations Readiness Advisor (ORA) is a key position in the operational readiness and start up organization. This role will be required to manage several major, and Mods projects readiness and make sure the operational readiness activities are well-identified, managed, and progressed in order to make sure safe and smooth start up takes place within the target dates as per each project timeline. 

This role is responsible for managing various interfaces with multiple teams within projects, operations, and other supporting functions within the organization. 

This is a site-based role which will require frequent travels to work sites. Travel from one worksite to the other is also part of the role. 

Operations Readiness Advisor (ORA) to provide technical support and operating guidance for equipment and systems prior to and after handover to Operations from Projects. This includes accountability for operations support contracts, assurance on completion of risk management studies and action closure, handover of engineering information (data and documents).
The operations Readiness Coordinator (ORC) reports directly to the ORA position.
The role will work closely with stakeholders to deliver Operational Readiness Plan ORP, Commissioning, and safe Start-up of the facility and timely resolution of any issues which might arise. 

Responsibilities:

Leadership
Always demonstrate strong safety leadership and exemplary safety behaviours, ensuring that safety expectations are communicated and reinforced.
Carry out self-verification activities, participate in incident investigations if required.
Coaching and development of their direct reports to support the nationalisation agenda.
Lead the development of Operational Readiness Plans ORP and ensure inputs from stakeholders incorporated.
Ensure Lessons Learned from previous projects are included in ORP.
Lead pre-start-up workshops with relevant stakeholders.

Risk / Operating Discipline
Lead interface with stakeholders to ensure support is in place for the new facility in a timely fashion, and stakeholders understand project timeline & requirements.
Review HZOP Report and ensure the implementation of all HAZOP actions / Recommendations
Manage handover of engineering information (Data & documents) required for operations support in accordance with requirements for information.
Develop operational risk register for start-up covering different aspects of risks (start-up delay, HSE risks, Process safety risks, enduring risks carried over to operational phase, future vulnerabilities, etc.) 
Set up and lead risk review sessions with relevant parties, keep document updated, and ensure mitigation plans in place.
Ensure enduring risks to operational phase and vulnerabilities are well-documented and handed over to start up team.
Lead the development of COW strategy based on project execution plan & facilities operating model.
Ensure changes to plant and equipment is subject to the appropriate level of TQ / EQ and Management of Change before putting into service.
Support the commissioning phase including attending the Walkdowns, reviewing the commissioning tests procedures & the performance test.
Review, Develop, and validate all documentations related to the projects (O&M Manual, initial STU Procedures, SOP, P&IDs, etc).
Be visible on site to test and verify that CTPs are being maintained, and capture lessons learned.
Support compliance with GOC criteria and handover process.
Support the preparation of Start-up and ensure successful and safe Start Up of the new facilities.
Ensure engineering queries EQ, technical queries TQ, and Operational risk assessment ORA are raised where required with quality and accurate information and raised in a timely manner to meet business objectives.
Responsible for ensuring PSSR (Pre-Start-up Safety Review) developed, meeting set up, and lead meetings with stakeholders until full closure of items and full sign off.
Responsible for developing, maintaining ORSU (Operations Readiness & Start up) action tracker, working with relevant parties to ensure close out.
Set up and Lead action tracker meeting with relevant parties to ensure progress or escalate if higher support required from Leadership team.  
Responsible for ensuring that rigorous Operating Discipline standards are communicated to O&M contractors as part the O&M scope.
Review/ Update the training plan & follow up on vendor training and the job training requirement
Reporting of all HSE related incidents through the established reporting tools to ensure accurate records of incidents and further investigations can be carried out where required.

People

Lead by example and is accountable for their teams being fully compliant with code of conduct and Values and Behaviors expectations.
Responsible for ensuring direct reports have a robust development plan and are being actively managed against objectives.
Coach and support their team on development, actively share experience and dedicate time each week to coaching and mentoring the local national population both within BOC and Local National Agency.
Ensure that direct report work patterns and commitments are fulfilled per HR contractual obligations.
Motivate the team, celebrate their successes and ensure their views and problems are listened to and suggestions are considered.
Identify and intervene if a team member does not meet performance expectations, have a low tolerance for poor behaviours.
Any non-conformance with this section will be escalated through line management.

Production Delivery, Optimisation & Excellent Performance 
Work with project document controller to make Sure project DDM is updated with relevant ORSU team for documents review.
Lead workshops with stakeholders to identify operating model for the new facilities and develop plans accordingly.
Lead the development, own, and drive progress on ORP (Operational Readiness Plan) with all stakeholders including supporting functions. Ensure actual Vs Planed progress are aligned.
Develop O&M contract strategies and work with PSCM until contract award.
Work with BOC to provide required resources to fill-in organization for new facilities.   
Responsible for providing operational input to the optimisation & start-up teams for managing well allocation before initial start-up.
Maintain the ops readiness tools & systems, i.e. updating the Lessons Learnt and best practices database as required.
Contribute to the development or enhancement of the Operational Readiness standards, processes, tools & systems, incorporating any lessons learnt and best practices. 
Utilise any of own specialist skills in the implementation of the above (e.g. Operability, Control & Total Reliability).
Ensure the Project Development Plan and Project Execution Plan adequately addresses operational issues and requirements.
Drive clear prioritisation of ORP so actions are focused in the right areas.
Provide input to the production forecasting process based on current operating assumptions and projects timeline.
Work with projects & EPC contractors to ensure operations, Maintenance, and reliability of equipment & systems progresses inline with project Operational Efficiency target.
Ensure Lessons learned are timely recorded with details and evidence in preparation for project close out wider Lessons learned session led by ORSU interface team.
Ensure lessons learned applicable to inflight projects are communicated timely so that corrective action can be taken.  
Provides input into the integrated schedule with regards to plant preparation schedule and site constraints.
Provide project team support during detailed engineering, construction, and commissioning phases.
Meets data reporting requirements as outlined by ORTL (e.g., routine ORSU performance reviews, updating team channel with documents).
Responsible to stop the job is unsafe.
Recommends priority work in support of operational readiness plan.
Agrees tri party walkdown and assign resources to participate.
Sign SH1 for subsystems after reviewing all relevant documents.
Recommends ORC (Ops Readiness Coordinators) competency progression.
Recommends operations support contract awards.
Decides selection of Operations Readiness Support team.
Recommends operations risks being transferred into ops risk register.
Recommends impact to operations emerging from MoC process.
Agree projects MoC’s that have operational impact.
Agrees technical approval of operations & Maintenance procedures.
Agrees technical assurance of quality of handover pack content (preservation records for equipment).
Agrees Technical support during Start up and early operations.
Agrees operational discipline engineering input into design of the facility and vendor package selection.
Agrees discipline specific input into maintenance & Integrity build.
Provide inputs into project Production Forecasting & OPEX forecast.

Experience and Qualifications

Minimum 10 years’ experience in hydrocarbon operations.
Previous experience with major projects delivery is preferrable.
5 years’ experience of supervisory roles.
Strong knowledge of project Commissioning, and Hanover & Completion process & procedures.
Experience in auditing & verification.
Engineering degree or equivalent experience
Relevant HSE knowledge.
Interpersonal communication skills are critically important to the ORA position and should be demonstrably excellent.
Strong knowledge of control of work systems.
Capable of working autonomously and organising time and resource to achieve work deliverables to defined standards.
Personal behaviours and work ethic that leads by example.
Evidence of continued professional development (training, course certificates or references).
Significant experience in the management of risk through Task Risk Assessment, SORA and Management of change risk assessment.  Able to identify risk and contribute to projects and operations readiness with key inputs to HAZOP and LOPA analyses.
Demonstrated ability to develop and drive continuous improvement of processes.

Work Location/Pattern

Rotation: 28/28.

Site: Predominantly on different sites.

Office: As and when required in line with team meetings.

Certified Professional Engineer

Title:

Deputy Director Operations, 4PL+

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

The 4PL+ portfolio is comprised of multiple projects supporting government and commercial customers in Aerospace and Manufacturing industries. The 4PL+ group delivers quality support, metrology services, warehousing and logistics, asset management, and industrial maintenance at over 30 locations worldwide. 

Job Summary

The Deputy Director of Operations, 4PL+ will be a hybrid role. The Deputy Director of Operations, 4PL+ will be responsible for supporting the entire portfolio and the Sr. Director in ensuring customer delivery, quality, cost controls, safety, people management, and overall contract execution. The Deputy Director will also be responsible for supporting the strategic goals of the business unit, aligning with customer requirements, and overseeing multiple projects. Key responsibilities include ensuring customer satisfaction, driving business growth, supporting and leading projects, and ensuring successful management of the portfolio.

Roles and Responsibilities

Work with customer focal points to drive daily tactical activities.

Develop strong customer relationship with client and ensure customer satisfaction across all programs.

Develop and execute corrective action plans when necessary.

Apply best practices for operational excellence across all contract requirements and initiatives.

Support all business development initiatives to include organic growth and new ventures.

Ensure all programs meet contract requirements and deliverables.

Organize and lead Quarterly Business Reviews, Monthly Performance Reviews, and Voice of Customer discussions with our clients.

Implement technology improvements such as automation and artificial intelligence (AI) where applicable.

Coordinate and develop process improvement initiatives and portfolio projects.

Must be willing to travel around 25% of the time.

Specific contract requirements regarding education and experience will prevail.

Secret clearance or ability to obtain a Secret clearance within six months.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Excellent presentation skills

Advance Degree in Business Administration, Engineering, or Technical Field.

PMP certification

Experience working with Senior Leadership.

Experience working with Technical Content.

title: Associate Security Specialist
description:
Title:

Associate Security Specialist

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

KBR is seeking an Associate Specialist to join the National Security Solutions (NSS) Chantilly team. Our Security professionals work with and communicate with a wide range of people including vendors, customers, executives, and staff.  The Associate Specialist must have the ability to communicate with internal and external contacts, both orally and in writing, to seek or convey information and coordinate arrangements.

The Associate Specialist is a salaried position that reports to the Senior Security Manager.  Regular M-F standard business hours with some flexibility apply but also with some requirement from time-to-time to surge on the front or back end of a standard business day based on customer or company requirements.

Key Responsibilities:

Supporting all Virginia DoD Collateral, Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) and DoD SAP security programs to include physical, personnel, program, document control, classification management, education/awareness, automated information systems certification & accreditation processes and security management policies and procedures.
Supporting and assisting in the maintenance of Chantilly personnel clearance/access databases, and document control databases.
Interfacing with Corporate Security, IT, Operations and Program Operations staff

Work Environment:

Location: On-site
Travel Requirements: Minimal 0-20%
Working Hours: Standard

Required Qualifications:

Security clearance requirement: Must be able to obtain TS/SCI security clearance.
Typically requires a college or university degree.
Typically requires 5+ years of relevant experience.
Must be able to obtain and maintain requisite security clearances and/or accesses.
Requires knowledge and experience in own discipline; still acquiring higher-level knowledge and skills.
Analyzes possible solutions using standard procedures.
Requires expanded conceptual knowledge in own discipline and broadens capabilities.
Understands key industry drivers; uses this understanding to accomplish own work.

Desired Qualifications:

Current active security clearance.
Knowledge of security management policies and procedures (32 CFR Part 117/NISPOM/SUPP/M1/ICDs/DCIDs/DoD SAP) as well as DoD and Intelligence Community customers' clearance processing procedures and document control regulation.
Familiarity with EQIP, DISS/NBIS and/or other Industry software applications
Familiarity with personnel, physical and AIS requirements among the Intelligence Community and DoD
Familiarity with personnel security requirements for DoD and Intelligence Community

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. title: IT Enterprise Architect - Onsite Technical Leadership
description:
Title:

IT Enterprise Architect - Onsite Technical Leadership

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. We all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely by supporting the science that informs decision makers and protects Earth.

IT Enterprise Architect – Onsite Technical Leadership
Location: Onsite (Primary) – Sioux Falls, South Dakota
Employment Type: Full Time

Join Us and Lead the Future of Our IT Infrastructure

We’re looking for a seasoned IT Enterprise Architect to take the helm of our enterprise infrastructure strategy. This is a high impact, onsite leadership role where you’ll guide our technology direction, mentor talented System Administrators, and work hand in hand with our Enterprise Solutions Architect to ensure our systems are secure, scalable, and ready for the future.

You’ll be the bridge between vision and execution — setting the roadmap, making key architectural decisions, and stepping in hands on when the situation calls for it. Our environment blends Kubernetes clusters, Linux-based systems, Docker containers, and a NetApp storage server with a growing cloud presence, giving you the opportunity to work across cutting edge hybrid architectures.

What You’ll Do
Lead the design and evolution of our enterprise architecture, balancing on-premises and cloud strategies.
Collaborate closely with the Enterprise Solutions Architect to align infrastructure and application roadmaps.
Mentor and guide System Administrators, ensuring operational excellence and adherence to best practices.
Establish governance, security, and performance standards across the IT landscape.
Drive major infrastructure projects from concept to completion, ensuring they meet business objectives.
Engage with stakeholders to translate business needs into scalable, secure, and efficient solutions.
What We’re Looking For
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
Minimum of 12 years of progressive experience in enterprise architecture and infrastructure leadership.
Deep knowledge of hybrid IT environments, including Kubernetes, Linux, Docker, and enterprise storage systems (NetApp preferred).
Familiarity with AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud platforms.
Exceptional leadership, communication, and decision-making skills.
Preferred Certifications:
Cloud: AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Azure Solutions Architect Expert, Google Cloud Professional Cloud Architect.
Infrastructure: Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA), Red Hat Certified Engineer (RHCE), NetApp Certified Data Administrator (NCDA).
Collaboration & Impact

In this role, you’ll be a key influencer in shaping our technological future. Working side by side with the Enterprise Solutions Architect, you’ll ensure infrastructure decisions drive operational efficiency, security, and innovation — enabling our teams to deliver high value solutions faster and with greater resilience.

Why Join Us
Lead with Influence: Shape the future of our IT infrastructure while collaborating with senior technology leaders.
Cutting-edge Environment: Work with modern hybrid architectures, Kubernetes, Linux, Docker, and enterprise-grade storage solutions.
Strategic & Hands-on Balance: Enjoy the autonomy to lead at a high level while staying close to the technology when it matters most.
Impact That Matters: Your decisions will directly enhance operational efficiency, security, and innovation across the organization.
Professional Growth: Access to advanced training, certifications, and opportunities to expand your leadership profile.
Collaborative Culture: Join a team that values open communication, mutual respect, and shared success.

Ready to lead, innovate, and make a lasting impact?
Apply today and help us build the future of our IT infrastructure.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS

Three years of continuous residency in the U.S. for issuance of a Government Security credential
The candidate must be able to obtain and maintain a national agency check and background investigation after hire to obtain a badge for government facility access and user account

KBR partners with several other companies to fulfill its requirements as a government contractor. The selected subcontracting companies align their benefits as closely as possible to those above.

KBR Benefits​

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development.​

description:
Title:

Vending Machine Technician

Who We Are
KBR Mission Technology Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. Our solutions help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.


The Mission Ahead
At KBR Mission Tech, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. Our legacy of delivering advanced full life cycle professional and technical solutions is matched only by our commitment to operational readiness and innovation. As stewards of critical missions for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA, and other key federal entities, we excel in engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow.


Who You Are
You are a hands-on problem solver who takes pride in fixing and maintaining equipment. You pay attention to detail and are committed to delivering high-quality service every time. Working independently comes naturally to you, and you’re comfortable managing your own schedule. Physically capable of lifting and moving vending machines and parts, you also have the technical skills to handle basic electrical and mechanical troubleshooting. Clear communication and professionalism are important to you, and you strive to provide excellent customer service. Above all, you are reliable, punctual, and safety-conscious in everything you do.


What You'll Do
In the role of Vending Machine Technician, your duties will include:

Install, service, and repair vending machines at customer locations.

Diagnose mechanical and electrical issues and perform necessary repairs.

Conduct routine maintenance, including cleaning, calibration, and part replacement.

Ensure machines are stocked and operational according to company standards.

Maintain accurate service records and report issues promptly.

Provide excellent customer service during on-site visits.

Adhere to safety protocols and company policies at all times. Other duties as required.

Requirements:

Must be a US or Australian Citizen

Must possess a US TS/SCI or AUS PV Clearance.

High school diploma or equivalent; technical certification preferred.

Previous experience in vending machine repair or similar mechanical/electrical role.

Knowledge of refrigeration systems and payment processing technology.

Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.

Ability to lift and move heavy equipment (up to 50 lbs).

Valid driver’s license and clean driving record.

Basic computer skills for record-keeping and reporting.

This role will be located in Alice Springs. This position is expected to be onsite 100%.

This position is contingent upon contract award.

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

This role will be located at an OCONUS location​ and 100% onsite

KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.

This role is within KBR/NSS Intel division.  At KBR Government Solutions, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. At KBR, you bring dedication, problem-solving skills, and a proactive approach to every task. What You'll Do

Advise staff and contractor personnel on authorized travel routes and approved modes of travel based on USG travel rules, regulations, policies and entitlements.

Coordinating vehicles and scheduling pick-up and drop-off times.

Operating USG vehicles to include large carpool vans and buses.

Meeting and assisting USG officers upon arrival.

 Assisting in processing necessary documentation such as passport visas and other clearances.

Communicating travel plans with travelers.

Performing related administration functions.

This is a contingent position based upon contract award and will be located OCONUS

Must possess a TS/SCI w/ Poly level clearance

Must have a minimum of three (3) years experience providing travel coordination.

Our legacy of delivering advanced full life cycle professional and technical solutions is matched only by our commitment to operational readiness and innovation. As stewards of critical missions for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA, and other key federal entities, we excel in engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow.

Who YOU Are

You’re a skilled Generator Technician with a strong background in the installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of generator systems. Your expertise ensures that critical power solutions are reliable and ready to support mission success for our customers. You excel at diagnosing issues, performing repairs, and conducting preventative maintenance, ensuring that generators operate at peak performance in any environment.

At KBR, you bring a detail-oriented approach and a commitment to safety to every project. Known for your problem-solving skills and technical proficiency, you work effectively both independently and as part of a team, collaborating with other professionals to ensure that power systems are always operational and compliant with industry standards. Your proactive mindset and dedication to continuous improvement contribute to KBR’s mission of delivering innovative solutions that enhance operational readiness and security.

What You WILL DO

In the role of Generator Technician, your duties will include:

Troubleshooting: Capable of troubleshooting engines, fuel systems, controls, and generators using prints, diagrams, and specifications.

Maintenance and Repairs: Capable of maintaining and operating megawatt rated high amperage and high voltage generators.

Monitoring: Knowledge of working with and monitoring contracted maintenance services.

Oversight: Provide guidance and oversight for any person under your supervision.

Schedule: Willingness to work on-call, rotational shifts, and nights, weekends, and holidays as required.

Safety Compliance: Implement and uphold safety protocols during all operations, ensuring a safe work environment for yourself and others.

Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to coordinate activities and ensure seamless operations during power outages or emergencies.

Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on industry trends, technologies, and best practices to enhance generator performance and operational efficiency.

Emergency Response: Respond promptly to generator failures and emergencies, providing on-site support to restore power quickly and efficiently.

This is a contingent position based upon contract award and will be located OCONUS

REQUIREMENTS:

Must have a US SECRET clearance, and be eligible for upgrade to TS/SCI with Poly level Clearance.

High school diploma, Vocational or Trade school Graduate or equivalent apprenticeship.

Eight (8)+ years of professional Generator experience, three (3) of which are in a lead or supervisory role.

Experience troubleshooting engines, fuel systems, controls, and generators using prints, diagrams and specifications.

Experience maintaining and operating megawatt rated high amperage and high voltage generators.

Knowledge of working with and monitoring contracted maintenance services.

Willingness to work on-call, rotational shifts, and nights, weekends, and holidays as required.

KBR Mission Technology Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. title: Associate Systems Integrator
description:
Title:

Associate Systems Integrator

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

KBR (formerly LinQuest) is the prime contractor on the MSEIT contract. By applying to this position, you are in consideration for KBR employment. However, you also have the option to be hired by one of our subcontractor teammates.

KBR is seeking a motivated Associate Systems Integrator to support the MSEIT contract at Space Systems Command (SSC). This position provides critical day-to-day coordination and program management support to the systems engineering and integration (SE&I) and Agile delivery teams.

The successful candidate will help organize multi-contractor activities, support software and tool procurement, manage status tracking and communication workflows, and ensure integration awareness across program teams. This role is ideal for someone seeking to grow into systems integration or program management leadership within a high-visibility Department of Defense (DoD) software and systems engineering program.

The MILSATCOM Systems Engineering, Integration, and Test (MSEIT) effort provides leading edge Systems Engineering & Integration (SE&I) for the US Space Force’s Space Systems Center (SSC). We support the Space Force’s acquisition of state of the art satellite communications systems, providing global secure, survivable, and protected communications for our nation’s warfighters. We seek technical individuals who will thrive in a highly collaborative work environment of small teams, using the most modern tools and methodologies to tackle the challenges of integrating complex space and ground communications systems.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key Responsibilities:

Program Coordination: Support planning, facilitation, and documentation of recurring working groups, technical reviews, and stakeholder meetings. Manage meeting logistics, agendas, and follow-up actions to ensure closure and accountability.

Integration Support: Assist the SE&I and program leadership teams in coordinating technical and programmatic activities across development, cyber, DevOps, and operations disciplines.

Procurement Coordination: Support tracking and coordination of software-related procurement actions, including license renewals, subscription management, and purchase requests.

License & Asset Tracking: Maintain visibility into software licensing, seat utilization, and expiration schedules to ensure uninterrupted tool availability across teams.

Status & Reporting: Collect, organize, and synthesize program status inputs; develop summary charts, dashboards, and other visual materials for internal and external reporting.

Cross-Team Collaboration: Coordinate among software, systems, and mission stakeholders to maintain alignment and awareness of dependencies.

Stakeholder Engagement: Interface with users, mission partners, OA representatives, and other government and contractor stakeholders to facilitate communication and coordination.

Tool & Workflow Adaptability: Operate effectively within heterogeneous collaboration ecosystems—MS Teams, Slack, Mattermost, Jira, Confluence, and others—bridging communication across diverse technical and organizational environments.

Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline coordination processes, improve document traceability, and enhance overall program communication efficiency.

Work Environment:

Location: On-site
Travel Requirements: Minimal
Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

An active DoD Secret clearance or the ability to obtain one required for this position
Technical Bachelor’s Degree
3–5 years of experience in program coordination, systems integration, or project support within a technical or defense environment.
Strong organizational, documentation, and analytical skills with attention to detail.
Familiarity with Agile practices and terminology (Scrum, PI planning, backlog management).
Proficiency with collaboration tools such as Jira, Confluence, MS Teams, Slack, Mattermost, and SharePoint.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with experience preparing presentation materials for leadership audiences.

Desired:

Prior experience supporting DoD acquisition, SE&I, or Space Systems Command (SSC) programs.
Knowledge of SATCOM systems, networks, or mission operations. Exposure to SAFe® or other scaled Agile frameworks.
Familiarity with DevOps, cloud-native, or Kubernetes-based environments.
Experience supporting configuration management or asset tracking activities.
Project Management Professional (PMP), SAFe Agilist, or other relevant certification (or willingness to pursue).
TS/SCI eligibility preferred

Basic Compensation:  $102,000-$127,000 in California

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Ready to Make a Difference? If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team.

KBR Benefits  

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. title: Material Coordinator
description:
Title:

Material Coordinator

KBR’s Mission Engineering Division delivers complex technical solutions and expert support to the U.S. Department of Defense, specializing in modeling and simulation, cyber transformation, air vehicle mission integration, and lifecycle support. As a trusted partner with a proven history in mission technology, KBR collaborates closely with clients to develop innovative and effective solutions. With a strong ethical framework, KBR prioritizes data security, privacy, and responsible information management to ensure mission success.

KBR is seeking a Material Coordinator to support our installation, sustainment, engineering, logistics, test and evaluation, cyber security, networking, and integration support to the Navy’s C-UAS Ashore Program in St. Inigoes, MD. The ideal candidate is technically proficient, organized, and detail-oriented, with strong interpersonal skills.  The position requires the candidate to work both independently and collaboratively with co-workers and customers. 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

The selected candidate will be assisting multiple projects which will require procurement, warehousing, transportation and supply oriented support. The selected candidate must be a self-motivated individual with experience in purchase planning, supplier research and selection, value analysis, a wide array of supply practices, and extensive data entry skills.
The selected individual will be working with government customers, KBR employees, and other contractors.
Responsibilities will include the coordination of material movements and the proper care of government and KBR material.
Duties for this position will include physical exertion such as lifting, stooping, standing, bending, squatting, reaching, and climbing ladders.
Additional duties as assigned.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

Education: High School Diploma
Citizenship & Clearance: US Citizenship and a Secret clearance.
Experience: (1) one year of supply tech or materials coordinator experience. Candidate must be capable of moderate to heavy lifting (50 lbs.)

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Prior experience with Navy or DOD CUAS programs. 
A good working knowledge of the governing supply systems, programs, policies, nomenclature, work methods, manuals, or other established guidelines.
Analytical ability to define or recognize the dimension of the problems involved, collect the necessary data to establish the facts, and take or recommend action based upon application or interpretation of established guidelines.
Exemplary skills within all Microsoft Office products.

This is an SCA Position. Pay rate:  $29.27/HR
Location: St. Inigoes, MD. This position requires candidates to work on-site.

title: Procurement Supervisor - Temporary
description:
Title:

Procurement Supervisor - Temporary

Position Title: Procurement Supervisor 

(Temporary Operational Procurement Supervisor) BP Secondee

Work Location: Baku, BP Xazar Centre

OVERVIEW

The Category Delivery Advisor delivers a specific category into a region / asset and is based in that region / asset.  They ensure category activities, across the region / asset are aligned to the categories and procurements strategic objectives, as well as the regions / assets strategic business priorities.  They work with the global category team to deliver their regions / assets priorities, balancing business needs with category plans ensuring they are in synergy.  They are the primary point of contact for suppliers to that category in their region and partner, collaborate, develop and support management of relationships with them, ensuring local needs are met. They also work with their peers across procurement to understand and share best practice and bring it to their region / asset, making their category more efficient and effective.  They have a deep understanding of and partner with the business to gather demand and challenge the business, where necessary, in order to deliver step changes in 3rd party spend by applying innovative solutions and change management. They have good commercial acumen to help in delivering secure optimal, compliant, and competitive, risk-managed category outcomes.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Category delivery in region / asset: Delivers a category in to a region / asset.

Delivers category performance to the region / asset that meet or exceeds relevant metrics, including those for safety and compliance
Delivers regional needs whilst also aligning to category plans - Consolidates demand plans for the business, working with their wider category team to ensure category plans are aligned. Understands the local commercial landscape and market factors therefore creating value-driven strategies. 
Undertakes supplier performance management or interventions, escalating to the relevant business stakeholders, as needed, to ensure timely resolution and prevent leakage.  PRM process improvement.
Advocates for opportunities to partner, collaborate, develop, and strengthen relationships with our contractors and suppliers.
Unlocks value in line with category management policy. 

Team integration: Helps to create and embraces a culture of collaboration, excellence, and continuous improvement in their team, the business and FB&T. Develops their technical skills and represents the interests of their region / site / asset in their category, across procurement and the broader organization.

Collaborates across procurement (including FB&T procurement), with the business and, where appropriate, with suppliers to create a ‘one team’ mentality
Builds region / asset knowledge across their category team to ensure delivery of their objectives. 
Develops their technical capabilities and accelerator skills
Embraces psychological safety, and bp values, as a foundation for collaborative learning, ideation and innovation
Compliant with bp's Code of Conduct (CoC), policies and procedures to ensure compliance, role models bp’s ‘Who We Are’ expectations. 

Supplier & Stakeholder Management: Uses storytelling to communicate impactfully with stakeholders and external partners, respectfully challenging to achieve the right outcomes, resolving conflict and focusing on priorities.

Influences through complexity and ambiguity, managing virtual relationships with stakeholders in multi-discipline, multi-cultural environments.  Builds good stakeholder relationships, bringing market insights and championing supplier value whilst taking time to understand business needs. Becomes a trusted advisor and critical partner to stakeholders.  Builds relationships with the procurement teams globally, understanding stakeholder feedback and proactively working to build procurements reputation and ROI. 
Maintains close connectivity with FB&T ensuring appropriate prioritization and resourcing. 

Transformation and Change Management: Delivers modernization & transformation activities, leading optimization of regional category delivery, and creating incremental value, aligned to the broader category, procurement and business transformation agendas.

Leverages digital solutions to drive innovation, enhancing efficiency, effectiveness and value creation. 
Partners with internal discipline teams to drive category excellence. 
Use influencing, storytelling and communication to encourage adoption. 
Delivers modernization & transformation activities, leading optimization of regional procurement category delivery aligned to the broader procurement and business transformation agendas

description:
Title:

Specialist, Project Controls

At KBR – We do things that matter. 

We deliver science, technology and engineering solutions to governments and companies around the world. KBR employs approximately 38,000 people worldwide with customers in more than 80 countries and operations in over 29 countries.

KBR is proud to work with its customers across the globe to provide technology, value-added services, and long-term operations and maintenance services to ensure consistent delivery with predictable results. At KBR, We Deliver.

Think.KBR.com

KBR in Australia 

With over 65 years working on some of Australia’s largest and most complex projects, KBR has unmatched experience supporting the nation’s critical infrastructure, energy transition and national security priorities. KBR has around 2,000 employees throughout Australia, who are focused on delivering innovative technology and engineering solutions for a safer, more secure and sustainable future.

Learn more about KBR in Australia  

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR 

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture. These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company. That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

The Opportunity
The Project Controller plays a crucial role in ensuring the successful planning, execution, and monitoring of large and complex projects within the assigned operating unit. They are responsible for the establishment and maintenance of project control systems, including complex cost, schedule, and risk management. This position requires a professional who is highly analytical and organised, with a keen eye for detail and the ability to communicate effectively with cross-functional teams.

This is a permanent, full-time opportunity and can be based in Brisbane or Sydney (Garden Island).

The successful candidate must hold a current AGSVA Security clearance on commencement.
 

Responsibilities
The key responsibilities of the role will include, but is not limited to:
 

Cost Control:

Develop and maintain project budgets.

Track project expenditures and identify variances.

Prepare cost reports and forecasts.

Recommend corrective actions to keep projects on budget.
 

Project Financials:

Manage Workforce Plans including updates based on actuals and forecasting resource requirements.

Timesheet Administration including reviewing for accuracy and input into SAP.

Support Accounts Payable and Receivable process

Prepare and submit Monthly Accruals

Manage client Monthly Financial Reporting including preparing estimates, foresting, and providing input into Monthly Project Status Reports

Management of Project WBS elements including reporting on revenue and cost variations

Assist in Bid Estimation and Pricing Schedule process for Contract changes
 

Document Control:

Ensure all project documents are organised and accessible.

Maintain version control and manage document distribution.

Support project audits.
 

Reporting and Analysis:

Prepare regular project status reports for management.

Analyse project performance data and provide insights.

Assist in the preparation of project change orders and claims.

Collaboration:

Collaborate with project managers and other stakeholders to gather data and ensure project control accuracy.

Communicate project control issues and recommendations effectively.
 

Continuous Improvement:

Stay up-to-date with best practices in project controls.

Identify opportunities for process improvement within the project controls function.
 

Qualifications, Skills and Experience

Bachelor's degree or certification in a related field (desirable)

Minimum 5 years project accounting / finance business partner experience

Proven Control Account Management experience monitoring and controlling actual control account performance against budgets & forecasts and providing ongoing support to Control Account Managers (not saying we do this now, but this would be best practice);

Proven experience with EAC's and revenue recognition in line with percent complete;

Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite

Well-developed communication and time management skills.

Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.

Ability to work independently and in a team environment.

Microsoft Dynamics, Power Bi and Defence industry experience will be highly regarded

AGSVA security clearance (minimum Baseline)

If you’re ready to shape tomorrow, let’s get started. Apply Now! 

Please note. Shortlisting will take place as applications are received, therefore the advertisement may close early if a suitable candidate is identified.

As a Major Service Provider of the Australian Defence Force, an AGSVA security clearance will be required and compliance to International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). As such, our hiring decisions are based on the key requirements of each role and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and experiences. 
 
Notice to Third Parties/Recruitment Agencies: KBR Australia does not accept unsolicited resumes or any liability associated with fees or costs from recruitment agencies, search firms or third parties who have not been engaged directly on this job opportunity. Candidates interested in applying are welcome to submit their application online.

title: Integrated Master Scheduler
description:
Title:

Integrated Master Scheduler

Program Summary

Kord, a wholly owned subsidiary of KBR, is a leader in advanced defense solutions with a strong focus on directed energy and High Energy Laser (HEL) technologies. Our HEL programs support the U.S. Department of Defense in developing, integrating, and fielding cutting-edge laser weapon systems that enhance national security and provide decisive battlefield advantages. These programs demand precise planning, coordination, and execution to meet aggressive schedules and technical milestones.

Job Summary

The Integrated Master Scheduler serves as the primary authority for developing, maintaining, and analyzing Integrated Master Schedules (IMS) across multiple HEL programs. This role ensures that all contractual, technical, and program requirements are met as they pertain to the schedule, while maintaining alignment with resource constraints and delivery objectives. The scheduler partners closely with program management, engineering, finance, and supply chain teams to deliver accurate forecasting, identify risks, and provide schedule-driven insights that enable informed decision-making and timely corrective actions.

Roles and Responsibilities

· Develop and maintain Integrated Master Schedules (IMS) using Statement of Work (SOW) and Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) elements for initial program baselines and proposals.

· Modify and update program schedules during re-baselining efforts and ensure compliance with contractual requirements.

· Operate within the established program business cadence by leading monthly schedule status reviews, communicating schedule performance to Finance, and preparing Contract Data Requirements List (CDRL) deliverables.

· Maintain resource-loaded program schedules through regular analysis of schedule status, critical path and variance metrics, network logic validation, and baseline maintenance.

· Utilize Gantt charts, driving path analysis, milestone tracking, Earned Value Management, and other project management techniques to monitor progress, identify performance variances, and enable timely intervention on critical areas.

· Ensure IMS compliance with Defense Contract Management Agency (DCMA) 14-point assessment guidelines and KBR standards.

· Support ad hoc customer requests for scenario modeling and impact assessments of schedule changes.

· Responsible for configuration management of the program schedule and associated subcontractor schedules.

· Coordinate with program leadership to align schedules with contractual deliverables, milestones, and technical objectives.

· Integrate subcontractor and supplier schedules into the overall program IMS.

· Support program Earned Value Management (EVM) requirements and deliverables by ensuring schedule data integrity and alignment with cost baselines.

· Provide regular schedule status reports, metrics, and briefings to program leadership and government customers.

· Drive IMS engagement during internal and external status sessions, including Integrated Baseline Reviews (IBRs).

· Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure accurate resource loading and forecasting.

Basic Qualifications

· Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Project Management, or related field.

· 5+ years of experience in program scheduling within defense or aerospace industries.

· Proficiency with scheduling tools such as Microsoft Project and/or Primavera (P6).

· Strong knowledge of Integrated Master Scheduling (IMS) practices and Earned Value Management (EVM).

· Experience with DCMA 14-point schedule analysis.

· Excellent communication and presentation skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.

· U.S. Citizenship required; ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret clearance.

Preferred Qualifications

· Master’s degree in Project Management, Engineering, or related discipline.

· 8+ years of experience in defense program scheduling, preferably with directed energy or advanced weapon systems.

· Prior experience supporting Army or DoD high energy laser programs.

· Familiarity with Agile program management practices.

· Advanced proficiency in Primavera P6 and Microsoft Project Server/Enterprise tools.

· Active DoD Secret or Top Secret clearance.

· Working knowledge of EVMS Standard (EIA 748-D) and Integrated Program Management Report (IPMR)

· Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to manage complex, multi-program schedules.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: IT Technical Support
description:
Title:

IT Technical Support

Position Title: IT Technical Support
Job Code: SITS20
Location: Baku

Position Summary:

The IT Technical Support Specialist provides first- and second-level technical assistance to company employees and end-users. The role ensures timely response and resolution to technical issues related to systems, software, hardware, and network infrastructure, maintaining operational continuity and high user satisfaction.

Brief Statement of Duties:
Provides telephone, remote, and on-site technical support to employees on assigned systems, applications, and products. Answers questions about installation, configuration, operation, customization, and usage of IT systems and software.
Applies diagnostic techniques to identify issues, determine root causes, and implement corrective actions for common failures.
Escalates complex problems to senior IT staff or supervisors when required, providing full documentation of troubleshooting steps.
Collect and analyse user feedback to identify problem trends and areas for process improvement or risk mitigation.
Coordinate with server, network, desktop and application teams to restore system functionality and ensure service reliability.
Maintain accurate records of hardware and software inventory, license usage, and hardware configurations in accordance with IT asset management procedures.
Support system updates, deployments, and standardization of desktop environments under guidance from the IT Management Team.
Conducts professional user training sessions on Microsoft Office 365, SharePoint, and other general digital tools essential for daily business operations. Prepares instructional materials and provides ongoing support to enhance user proficiency and productivity.
Perform other duties as assigned by IT Management.
Required Skills:
University degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
2–4 years of relevant experience in IT Service delivery.
Thorough knowledge of Microsoft Windows 11, Active Directory, Group Policy, Microsoft 365 (E3/E5), and network topology.
Familiarity with IT service management (ITSM) or Help Desk ticketing systems, with the ability to resolve incidents in accordance with defined service-level metrics.
Experience with SharePoint, Power BI, and engineering application/tool deployment processes.
Strong troubleshooting skills with the ability to apply diagnostic techniques to identify problems, investigate causes, and recommend effective solutions.
Competencies
Self-motivated, accountable, and customer focused.
Strong problem-solving and organizational abilities.
Excellent communication skills and good command of written and spoken English.
Ability to follow established processes and maintain performance under pressure.

title: Principal Sustainability Advisor
location:
locations
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
description:
Title:

Principal Sustainability Advisor

Designing a Smarter, Greener Future 

At KBR, we’re passionate about creating infrastructure that’s smarter, safer, and truly sustainable. Our team brings together bold thinkers and technical experts to deliver environmental solutions that make a real difference—for our clients, our communities, and the planet. 

With over $2 billion in Green Star and ISCA-certified projects, we lead the way in sustainability strategy and innovation. From concept to construction and beyond, we help clients tackle critical challenges—integrating environmental considerations into every phase of delivery. 

Whether it’s improving energy efficiency, modeling emissions, assessing climate risks, or delivering whole-of-life analyses, we provide the insight and expertise to help projects meet and exceed sustainability targets. 

The Opportunity 

We have an exciting opportunity for a Principal Sustainability Advisor to join our National Sustainability team. In this senior role, you’ll lead sustainability input, advice, and expertise across major infrastructure projects—including water, rail, and road—as well as global Net Zero initiatives and defence projects. 

You’ll work closely with project teams to embed sustainability strategies from design through construction, delivering frameworks, management plans, and innovative solutions that leave a lasting legacy. 

What You’ll Do 

Lead sustainability strategies and provide technical advice on complex, large-scale projects. 

Drive adoption of sustainability initiatives during design and construction phases. 

Collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams to deliver positive environmental and community outcomes. 

Manage project planning, cost estimates, tender submissions, technical documentation, and client reporting. 

Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, authorities, and internal stakeholders. 

Mentor and guide junior consultants while advising senior management. 

Contribute to business development through proposals, budgets, and stakeholder engagement. 

Who You Are 

You’re a seasoned sustainability professional with a proven track record in infrastructure projects. You thrive on collaboration, leadership, and innovation, and you’re motivated by the success of your team. You bring integrity, accountability, and strong communication skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders and deliver results. 

What You Bring 

Bachelor’s degree in sustainability, environmental engineering, or similar. 

Extensive experience in sustainability consulting within the infrastructure sector. 

Familiarity with Green Star or ISC rating tools (highly regarded). 

Strong stakeholder management and business development experience. 

Ability to manage complex projects, budgets, and deadlines. 

What We Do 

KBR’s Infrastructure Services team delivers projects that shape a smarter, more sustainable future for Australia. From transport and water to defence and buildings, we partner with clients nationwide to provide innovative solutions across every stage of the project lifecycle. 

With over 1,200 skilled professionals, we combine global expertise with local insight. Our teams are digitally connected, agile, and committed to social and environmental sustainability—driving innovation that benefits communities and the planet. 

Together, we deliver infrastructure for a better tomorrow. 

At KBR, We Value You 

While you’re busy delivering world-class engineering solutions, we make sure you have the flexibility and support to thrive. Enjoy family-friendly work arrangements, options for hybrid working, and a culture that prioritizes trust and collaboration. 

You’ll have access to ongoing professional development and the chance to work alongside some of the industry’s most respected experts. With the resources of a global organization and the close-knit feel of a local team, you’ll never be just a number. 

Help shape tomorrow by applying today! 

Don’t miss out on this opportunity to leave your impact on our society with one of Australia’s leading infrastructure businesses. Apply now and follow us on LinkedIn to stay up to date with all the latest news and job opportunities. 

Our people are the heart of everything we do. We are dedicated to creating work environments where every member of our team feels safe, supported, respected, trusted, and valued—and where everyone has opportunities to belong, connect, and grow.

location:
locations

description:
Title:

Water Treatment Specialist

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

This is a contingent position based upon contract award.

Who We Are
KBR Government Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. Our solutions help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.


The Mission Ahead
This role is with KBR’s Government Solutions U.S. division.  At KBR Government Solutions, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. Our legacy of delivering advanced full life cycle professional and technical solutions is matched only by our commitment to operational readiness and innovation. As stewards of critical missions for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA, and other key federal entities, we excel in engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow.


Who You Are
You’re a skilled and detail-oriented Water Treatment Specialist with a strong background in monitoring, maintaining, and ensuring the proper treatment of water systems. With expertise in water purification, chemical treatment processes, and system troubleshooting, you excel at ensuring that water systems meet quality and safety standards. Your ability to manage treatment operations, analyze water samples, and maintain equipment makes you a vital part of ensuring clean and safe water for both operational and environmental needs.

At KBR, you bring a blend of technical expertise, problem-solving abilities, and a commitment to operational excellence. Known for your thorough understanding of water treatment processes and safety protocols, you play a critical role in supporting the overall water treatment systems. Your dedication to environmental responsibility, safety, and compliance aligns with KBR’s mission to provide reliable and innovative solutions to mission-critical operations.


What You'll Do
In the role of Water Treatment Specialist, your duties will include:

Ensures that plant operations follow operating guidelines, and that treated water is safe and acceptable entering the distribution system

Assumes responsibility for complete operation and maintenance of treatment plant

Monitors, operates, repairs, and maintains plant processes and associated equipment system components

Conducts daily rounds and inspections for treatment systems, water wells, main pump stations, water storage tanks, and swimming pools

Collects, inspects, tests, and evaluates representative water samples to meet regulations range

Maintains chemical feed pumps to adjust proper dosage rate of chemicals

Checks chemical dosage tank level and refill tank

Performs routine preventive maintenance on plant equipment to include calibrations, basic mechanical and electrical work, and lubricating and replacing parts

Maintains all required records such as daily operating logs, AF forms, daily inspection process forms, and chemical and repair parts inventory and compiles and analyzes data and reports daily

Manages the operating budget and materials/supplies procurement for the wastewater plant.

Requirements:

Must be a US or Australian citizen

Must have the ability to obtain and maintain an active US Secret clearance or AUS PV Clearance.

An Associate Degree in a related field, such as environmental science or chemistry.

A high school diploma and on-the-job training in job duties of wastewater treatment may be considered.

A minimum of 5 years’ experience in water treatment

Must possess excellent communication skills.

Desired Qualifications:

Experience treating HVAC Chillers

This role will be located in Alice Springs, at a 4,400-acre facility with approximately 687,000 square feet of mission and support space.  This position is expected to be onsite 100%.

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Who You Are
You’re a skilled and knowledgeable Building Automation Systems (BAS) Technician with expertise in installing, maintaining, and troubleshooting building automation and control systems. With a strong understanding of HVAC systems, energy management, and system integration, you excel at optimizing building performance and ensuring seamless operation of critical infrastructure. Your technical proficiency and commitment to safety make you a trusted professional in the field.

At KBR, you bring a proactive approach to problem-solving, attention to detail, and a dedication to operational excellence. Known for your ability to work both independently and collaboratively, you ensure systems operate efficiently and meet client requirements. Your focus on innovation and reliability aligns with KBR’s mission of supporting critical operations with precision and care.


What You'll Do
In the role of BAS Technician, your duties will include:

Provide Leadership: Guide the HVAC crew by providing input and leadership, ensuring the creation of organizational structure and processes required to fully execute services.

Execute Mechanical Services: Oversee the execution of HVAC mechanical services, ensuring that all work is performed with high quality and within cost constraints.

Direct Activities: Manage and direct the activities of HVAC mechanics who install, service, and repair environmental-control systems in various commercial establishments.

Utilize Technical Knowledge: Apply knowledge of refrigeration theory, pipefitting, and structural layout to enhance service quality and efficiency.

Evaluate Service Execution: Assess HVAC service execution for compliance with contracts, design data, schedules, cost budgets, and quality standards. Provide updates and advice on status, issues, impacts, risks, and cost-influencing factors to the project team.

Maintain Plans: Keep updated short-range look-ahead plans, discuss any deviations with the Superintendent, and ensure alignment with project goals.

Monitor Budgets: Review and monitor the cost and man-hour budget for the installation process, ensuring alignment with financial constraints and project specifications.

Develop Equipment Plans: Develop a detailed equipment and tool requirement plan, reviewing and adjusting it in consultation with the Superintendent to meet project needs.

Communicate Effectively: Ensure clear and effective communication with the project team and other stakeholders to facilitate smooth operations and address issues promptly.

Our solutions help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.

This role is with KBR’s Government Solutions U.S. division.  At KBR Government Solutions, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. Who You Are
You’re a skilled and safety-conscious Boiler Operator with expertise in managing and maintaining boilers and related systems to ensure optimal performance. With a solid understanding of heating systems, pressure systems, and safety regulations, you excel at performing routine inspections, troubleshooting issues, and ensuring compliance with industry standards. Your attention to detail, technical knowledge, and commitment to safety make you a reliable professional in maintaining efficient and safe operations.

At KBR, you bring dedication, problem-solving skills, and a proactive approach to every task. Known for your ability to work independently and manage high-pressure systems, you contribute to smooth operations and mission success. What You'll Do

Monitor and operate boiler systems to ensure efficiency and compliance with safety regulations.

Perform routine maintenance tasks and repairs.

Respond to emergency situations and take prompt action to resolve issues.

Maintain accurate records of equipment performance and maintenance activities.

Start and shut down boilers.

Conduct safety and maintenance inspections.

Track the water levels and gauges.

Requirements:

Must be a US or Australian citizen

Must Possess an active US TS/SCI w/ Counterintelligence Polygraph or AUS PV Clearance.

A minimum of 4 years as a Boiler operator or in a similar role.

High school diploma or equivalent (some positions may require additional certifications or vocational training).

Completion of an apprenticeship program or formal training in boiler operation, mechanical systems, or a related field is preferred.

Valid Boiler Operator license or certification.

Knowledge of steam and hot water boilers, combustion systems, and associated components (pumps, valves, gauges, etc.).

Ability to read blueprints, schematics, and technical manuals.

Proficiency in operating control systems and monitoring boiler performance.

Strong communication and problem-solving skills

Critical thinking and collaboration skills

This role will be located in Alice Springs. This position is expected to be onsite 100%.

description:
Title:

Electrician, Journeyman

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Who You Are
You’re a skilled Journeyman Electrician with a commitment to quality and safety, ready to tackle critical electrical projects that support mission success our customers. Your expertise in installing, maintaining, and troubleshooting electrical systems ensures that operations run smoothly, reliably, and efficiently. Known for your precision, technical knowledge, and dedication to meeting rigorous standards, you’re able to adapt to the unique requirements of complex environments.

At KBR, you’ll be part of a team that values your craftsmanship and commitment to excellence. You take pride in upholding safety protocols, diagnosing issues quickly, and delivering solutions that support critical operational readiness. Your problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and collaborative approach directly contribute to KBR’s mission of creating a safer, more secure, and sustainable world.

This is a contingent position based upon contract award


What You'll Do
In the role of Electrician, Journeyman, your duties will include:

Installs, maintains, and repairs electrical controls, wiring, and lighting systems.

Reads technical diagrams and blueprints.

Performs general electrical maintenance. and inspect transformers, circuit breakers, and other electrical components.

Implements and maintains quality control measures to ensure that all installations and repairs meet or exceed the set standards.

Ensures clear and consistent communication within the team and with other project stakeholders to keep everyone informed and aligned on project goals and updates.

Other duties as required.

Requirements:

Must be a US or Australian citizen

Must have a US TS/SCI Clearance w/ Poly, or an Australian PV clearance

Must have a Journeyman Electrical License (or AUS Equivalent)

Must have a minimum of five years of electrical engineering experience

Qualifications:

5 Years of Experience as an Electrician, Journeyman

Journeyman License

Thermographer

This role will be located in Alice Springs, at a 4,400-acre facility with approximately 687,000 square feet of mission and support space.  This position is expected to be onsite 100%.

locations
