description:
Title:

Electrician, Supervisor

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Who You Are
You’re a highly skilled Electrician Supervisor with a proven track record of leading teams in delivering high-quality, safe, and reliable electrical solutions. With deep expertise in electrical systems and a commitment to operational excellence, you ensure that every project meets the stringent standards required for mission success with our customers. You excel at planning, coordinating, and overseeing complex electrical work, ensuring that teams operate efficiently and safely in dynamic environments.

At KBR, you bring both technical expertise and leadership skills, guiding your team to perform at their best while upholding critical safety and compliance standards. Known for your strong communication and collaborative approach, you’re adept at troubleshooting issues, mentoring team members, and driving projects to completion on time and within scope. Your proactive approach and attention to detail align perfectly with KBR’s mission of enhancing operational readiness and creating a safer, more sustainable future.

This is a contingent position based upon contract award

What You'll Do
In the role of Electrician, Supervisor, your duties will include:

Provide Supervision and Direction: Lead and supervise construction craft personnel in the electrical discipline, ensuring effective execution of tasks.

Coordinate with Other Crafts: Coordinate the activities of electricians with other crafts to ensure proper integration and completion of projects.

Maintain Project Standards: Uphold safety, productivity, quality, and cost standards in accordance with project specifications and objectives.

Plan Labor Requirements: Plan and coordinate craft labor requirements, scheduling and assigning tasks to meet project timelines and objectives.

Forecast and Plan Resources: Assist in forecasting and planning for tools, equipment, and materials needed for electrical tasks and projects.

Enforce Safety Protocols: Ensure that all work is performed in accordance with strict safety protocols, conducting regular safety briefings and inspections.

Monitor Work Quality: Oversee the quality of electrical work, ensuring it meets or exceeds project standards and compliance with all relevant regulations.

Troubleshoot and Resolve Issues: Identify and resolve technical and logistical problems encountered by the electrical team during construction activities.

Provide Technical Guidance: Offer expert advice and technical guidance to the team, ensuring they are trained on the latest electrical standards and practices.

Report Progress and Challenges: Regularly report to project management on progress, challenges, and the status of the electrical work to ensure transparency and prompt resolution of issues.

Other duties as required.

Requirements:

Must be a US or Australian citizen

Must have a US TS/SCI Clearance w/ Poly, or an Australian PV clearance

Must have a Journeyman or Master Electrical License (or AUS Equivalent)

Must have a minimum of seven years of electrical engineering experience

Must have a minimum of three years of supervisory experience, Completion of courses or certifications in leadership or management is highly recommended.

Safety Certification: Training and certification in electrical safety, OSHA standards, and other relevant safety protocols.

Ability to maximize technical, performance, and operational efficiencies and minimize lifecycle costs.

Ability to maximize services and capabilities, provisioned as a service.

Ability to work in fast paced environment with excellent oral and written communication skills.

Desired Qualifications:

 Thermographer

This role will be located in Alice Springs, at a 4,400-acre facility with approximately 687,000 square feet of mission and support space.  This position is expected to be onsite 100%.

title: Cost Engineer
description:
Title:

Cost Engineer

Job Title:                            Cost Engineer
Company:                           KBR-Iraq
Project:                                IFMS
Location:                             Basra, Iraq
Rotation:                             28/28

Required:                            Expats

About Company

"Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

The KBR team delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets."

Roles and Responsibilities:

The Cost Engineer will report to the Project Control Manager. 

Specific responsibilities include:

•    Full understanding of the commercial aspect of the project contract and the application to the cost management

•    Understand contract specific cost procedures and carry out all work in accordance with these,

•    Study and understand all relevant project documents relating to the cost management of allocated project(s)

•    Work with all relevant projects and discipline personnel to ensure that cost control procedures are followed,

•    Set Up project/projects within Cost System to agreed format,

•    Establishing project control budgets based on the client approved Project Control Estimate,

•    Reviewing cost commitment and expenditure information (for all cost elements), for input to the computerized cost control and reporting system on a weekly basis and ensuring that all information received is accurate and correctly input,

•    Producing regular cost reports and advising management of any forecast cost overruns as soon as possible to allow corrective actions to be taken in a timely manner. Highlighting areas of concern and suggesting areas of improvement,

•    Maintaining comprehensive accessible registers of financial approvals, variations and change orders,

•    Review project man-hours and the allocation of man-hours in conjunction with Planning on a regular basis

•    Liaising with the Project Management, Finance, Contracts and Procurement departments with regards to establishing monthly evaluation of work done, goods received and services rendered for invoice preparation and verification

•    Ensure that all cost related work is in compliance with the contract,

•    Maintain rates within Computerized Cost System, ensuring they are up to date and all rate uplifts are implemented. Advise Project Management of additional costs involved and assist in obtaining additional approval from client,

•    Check that all estimates meet contract requirements and all relevant cost information is fed back to the estimates,

•    When Project specific Cost Procedures are in place ensure they have been implemented in full,

•    Maintain a good working knowledge of relevant corporate cost software,

•    Ensure that adequate control of commitment is in place,

•    Supervise and encourage junior and assistant personnel, including checking their work,

•    Participate in schedule risk analysis as required,

•    Ensure that the Corporate and Project Specific Change Control procedures are being adhered to

Education, Skills & Experience:

Education

•    Bachelor’s Degree in an engineering discipline

Experience and Skill set

•    Minimum 8 years experience in Oil and Gas Industry in Cost Engineering roles.

•    Minimum 5 years experience in Oil and Gas related project delivery related projects

•    Minimum 5 years experience in Oil and Gas Project Delivery as a Umbrella Contract Senior Cost Engineer

•    Ability to work and manage in a multi-cultural environment with good understanding of cost estimation parameters to be considered in Middle East.

•    Skill to actively engage with different project disciplines

•    Ability to work and manage in a multi-cultural environment

title: Planning Engineer
description:
Title:

Planning Engineer

Job Title                               Planning Engineer

Reports to                           Project Control Manager

Skillpool                              Project Services

Company:                           KBR-Iraq
Project:                                IFMS
Location:                             Basra, Iraq
Rotation:                             28/28

Required:                            Expats

About Company

"Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

The KBR team delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets."

Roles and Responsibilities:

The Planning Engineer will report to the Project Control Manager. 

Specific responsibilities include:

Developing and maintaining Project Execution Schedules including Level 1/2/3 schedules using tools like Primavera P6. Ensure alignment on project assumptions with cost engineering, cost estimation, risk management and project management.
Implement Schedule requirements of Company into the planning and cascade these to the contractors accordingly.
Coordinate with engineering, procurement, and construction teams to gather inputs for the master schedule.
Monitor progress and update schedules regularly to reflect actual performance.
Identifying trends or potential slippages and report on these to the Project Engineers or the Project Services Lead.
Producing regular reports on progress against schedule. Reporting schedule performance index (SPI)
Deliver and maintain consistent and realistic plans and control structures for the project. Understand the list of plans required to execute the assigned project sub-elements and their interface to other sub-elements. Develop the activities, durations as per productivity norms, logic, resources and progress for the assigned project sub-elements, leading to the creation of the baseline schedule and its subsequent maintenance.
Develop, implement and comply with the planning and progress monitoring procedures.
Conduct the schedule monthly progress update, forecast, critical path and trend analyses for assigned elements, including any impact from interface areas. Implement and maintain the status reports. Provide regular and comprehensive schedule status reports to project engineers.
Liaise with and challenge Project Engineering personnel to ensure proper understanding of the key schedule sensitivities and drivers.
Develop contract key dates, milestones and Project Hub plan dates that align with the overall project schedule.
Participate in evaluating bid schedules and reviewing and assessing contractor plans to support contract award recommendations.
Develop contract sections for planning and progress monitoring and reporting. Review, verify, assess contractors reported progress and ensure that this is reflected in the project schedule.
Contribute to the translation of the project’s risk profile into the probabilistic risk model and understand the output, including the key risk drivers for the possible range of schedule completion dates. Track the criticality of the main paths to completion and float consumption.
Provide input data for and participate in benchmarking activities.
Contribute to close-out data to enable knowledge retention (lessons learned, project data compilation) at completion of work

Education, Skills & Experience:

Education

Bachelor’s Degree in an engineering discipline

Experience and Skill set

Minimum 8 years experience in Oil and Gas Industry in Planning Engineer roles.
Minimum 5 years experience in Oil and Gas related project delivery related projects
Ability to work and manage in a multi-cultural environment with good understanding of cost estimation parameters to be considered in Middle East.
Skill to actively engage with different project disciplines
Ability to work and manage in a multi-cultural environment

description:
Title:

Finance Lead

Job Title                      Finance Lead

Reports to                   Finance Manager

Skillpool                     Finance

Company:                    KBR-Iraq
Project:                       IFMS
Location:                     Basra, Iraq
Rotation:                     28/28

Required:                    Expats

About Company

"Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

The KBR team delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets."

Roles and Responsibilities:

Develop and manage annual budgets, forecasts, and financial models.
Monitor financial performance against budgets and provide variance analysis.
Prepare cash flow projections and ensure liquidity management.
Oversee general ledger, accounts payable/receivable, and payroll processes.
Ensure compliance with IFRS/GAAP and local regulatory requirements.
Coordinate internal and external audits and implement recommendations.
Prepare accurate and timely financial statements, management reports, and dashboards.
Present financial performance and insights to senior management and stakeholders.
Identify opportunities for cost reduction and efficiency improvements.
Implement financial controls to safeguard company assets.
Assess and manage financial risks, including currency, credit, and operational risks.
Develop strategies for risk mitigation and contingency planning.
Lead and mentor the finance team, ensuring high performance and professional development.
Foster collaboration with other departments (procurement, operations, project controls).
Provide financial input for business cases, investment decisions, and strategic initiatives.
Support mergers, acquisitions, and other corporate transactions as needed.

Education, Skills & Experience:

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or Economics (Master’s or CPA/CFA preferred).

Experience and Skill set

Minimum 15 years of experience in finance, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
Strong knowledge of financial regulations, accounting standards, and ERP systems.
Excellent analytical, communication, and leadership skills.
Proficiency in financial modeling, budgeting, and forecasting.
Advanced knowledge of Excel and financial software (SAP, Oracle, etc.).
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.

title: Maintenance Planning Engineer
description:
Title:

Maintenance Planning Engineer

Job Title                               Maintenance Planning Engineer

Reports to                           Project Control Manager

Skillpool                              Project Services

Company:                           KBR-Iraq
Project:                                IFMS
Location:                             Basra, Iraq
Rotation:                             28/28

Required:                            Expats

About Company

"Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

The KBR team delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets."

Roles and Responsibilities:

The Maintenance Planning Engineer will report to the Project Control Manager.

Specific responsibilities include:

Develop and maintain maintenance schedules using tools like Primavera P6. Prepare and update preventive, predictive, and corrective maintenance schedules for all equipment and facilities, ensuring alignment with operational requirements and reliability targets.
Implement Company maintenance planning procedures and standards, cascading requirements to contractors and internal teams as necessary.
Monitor and track maintenance activities, identify delays or potential risks, and report trends to the Maintenance Manager. Recommend corrective actions to avoid downtime.
Prepare progress and compliance reports on maintenance progress, compliance with schedules, and key performance indicators (KPIs).
Ensure availability of manpower, tools, and spare parts for scheduled maintenance activities. Coordinate with procurement and inventory teams for timely material supply.
Develop and maintain realistic and achievable maintenance plans, including activity durations, resource allocation, and sequencing. Maintain baseline plans and update them based on actual progress.
Implement established maintenance planning and progress monitoring procedures, ensuring accurate documentation and reporting.
Perform monthly updates of maintenance schedules, forecast upcoming activities, and analyze critical paths to avoid operational disruptions.
Assess the impact of approved changes or deviations from maintenance targets and incorporate them into updated plans.
Liaise with operations and engineering teams to ensure proper understanding of maintenance priorities, schedule sensitivities, and resource constraints.
Review and evaluate contractor maintenance plans, monitor their progress, and ensure compliance with contractual obligations.
Identify potential risks affecting maintenance schedules and contribute to risk mitigation strategies.
Provide input for benchmarking and reliability improvement initiatives. Capture lessons learned and contribute to maintenance strategy enhancements.
Ensure all maintenance planning activities comply with safety standards, regulatory requirements, and company policies.

Education

Bachelor’s Degree in an engineering discipline

Experience and Skill set

Minimum 8 years experience in Oil and Gas Industry in Maintenance Planning Engineer roles.
Minimum 5 years experience in Oil and Gas related project delivery related projects
Ability to work and manage in a multi-cultural environment with good understanding of cost estimation parameters to be considered in Middle East.
Skill to actively engage with different project disciplines
Ability to work and manage in a multi-cultural environment

title: Risk Specialist
description:
Title:

Risk Specialist

Risk Management Specialist – Major Project Controls

Location: Adelaide, SA

Contract: 6 months initially, with strong potential for extension

About KBR:

At KBR, we deliver solutions that shape the future of infrastructure and improve communities. Our people are at the heart of everything we do, and we pride ourselves on fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence.

The Opportunity:

We are seeking a Risk Management Specialist to join our team supporting major infrastructure projects. This role is critical in embedding best-practice risk management across all project phases, ensuring alignment with ISO 31000 and KBR’s governance standards.

You will facilitate risk workshops, maintain risk and opportunity registers, and lead quantitative risk assessments (QRA) for cost and schedule. This is an opportunity to contribute to high-profile projects and help shape a strong risk-aware culture across the delivery ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities:

Establish and maintain project risk and opportunity registers aligned with ISO 31000 and internal frameworks.

Facilitate structured risk workshops at key project stages.

Partner with project managers and controls teams to integrate risk processes with cost and schedule reporting.

Lead and coordinate QRAs and embed outputs into project forecasts.

Provide assurance on risk documentation quality and compliance.

Support continuous improvement and lessons learned initiatives.

Skills & Experience Required:

Tertiary qualification in engineering, project management, risk management, or related field.

Minimum 8 years’ experience in risk and/or opportunity management within large-scale infrastructure programs.

Strong analytical skills, including risk quantification and use of risk modelling tools.

Excellent communication and facilitation skills for executive audiences.

Experience in water or wastewater infrastructure programs (desirable).

Our Values:

We Value Our People – We respect, trust, and empower our people to reach their full potential.

Flexible work arrangements and genuine work-life balance

Career development programs and ongoing support

Employee wellbeing initiatives that support your overall health and happiness

A collaborative, innovative culture where your ideas and contributions truly matter

The above are just some of the benefits on offer at KBR.

title: SPECIALIST CATHODIC PROTECTION ENGINEER (PMC Role)
location:
locations
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
description:
Title:

SPECIALIST CATHODIC PROTECTION ENGINEER (PMC Role)

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

The KBR team of teams delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals. KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

Role: SPECIALIST CATHODIC PROTECTION ENGINEER (PMC Role) 

Minimum Academic Requirements
Minimum 4 years Bachelor’s Engineering degree in Corrosion Science, Chemical, Electrical Engineering, or another relevant engineering discipline.
At least 15 years of experience in Cathodic Protection System in the Oil & Gas Industry.
10 years should have been spent in a senior engineering capacity as Technical Authority for Project Works related to Cathodic Protection System for Well Casing, Pipelines, Plant Piping Storage Tanks, Process Vessel and Concrete reinforced Structures.
AMPP NACE Level III Certification or an equivalent professional credential.
Fully conversant with AMPP & ISO Standards for Cathodic Protection System
About the Job

The selected candidate will closely work and liaise with the Project Team, and Integrity Project team taking responsibility for all technical aspects related to the Cathodic Protection (CP) System during the Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) execution phase. The role includes reviewing, supervision, testing, and approval of all elements of the CP System adhering to Project Specification and meeting applicable industry standards such as AMPP, ISO, and DNV. This encompasses the CP system design, installation activities, material datasheets, remote monitoring and control system commissioning, and handover procedures and activities. The selected candidate shall be required to work in both office and site-based execution of CP systems at all critical junctures during the Project in closed coordination and alignment with the COMPANY Integrity Project team – CP Specialist, Integrity Specialist.

Key Accountabilities
Ensure that CP systems are properly designed, installed, tested and commissioned in line with project requirements and integrity standards. 
Work closely with COMPANY Project Execution Team, and Contractor/ CP Subcontractor to align CP activities with overall project schedule and milestones. 
Interface with Integrity Project – CP Specialist to ensure CP design supports long-term asset integrity and corrosion control strategies as per approved code of practices and guidelines. 
Collaborate with Interface Management Team to resolve conflicts between CP systems and other disciplines (electrical, civil, mechanical) 
Review and approve all project deliverables submitted by the CP vendor, including design documents, material datasheets, Factory Acceptance Tests (FAT), construction documentation, testing protocols, commissioning procedures, and startup operating guidelines.
Participating in the Pre-Design Site surveys jointly with EPC/ CP Contractor to align the Site Installation Schemes.
Represent the Company to ensure that all requirements are met according to the approved Inspection and Test Plan (ITP), including witnessing Factory Acceptance Testing (FAT) and Site Acceptance Testing (SAT) for critical CP equipment.
Provide technical solutions for design changes, site issues, or unexpected corrosion challenges.
Review and approve Software and hardware application for Remote Monitoring & Control System for integrated CP System.
Review and validate Contractor Request for Inspection (RFI), IFC drawing and CONTRACTOR’s QA/QC documentation and test reports.
Provide technical solutions and responses to site-based technical queries and authorize necessary design deviations from project specifications due to site challenges or construction constraints in alignment with Integrity Project team.
Ensure all CP activities comply with COMPANY standards and regulatory requirements.
Prepare progress reports, technical evaluations, and recommendations for management
Supervise site work during crucial phases of CP system installation activities.
Maintain a full-time supervisory presence onsite during pre-commissioning testing, commissioning, and handover processes.
Review and Approve CP System commissioning, and Start Up reports
Ensure proper handover with as-built documentation and O&M manuals.

description:
Title:

Director, Mission Integration

At KBR – We do things that matter.

We deliver science, technology and engineering solutions to governments and companies around the world. KBR employs approximately 38,000 people worldwide with customers in more than 80 countries and operations in over 29 countries.

KBR is proud to work with its customers across the globe to provide technology, value-added services, and long-term operations and maintenance services to ensure consistent delivery with predictable results. At KBR, We Deliver.

Think.KBR.com

KBR in Australia

With over 65 years working on some of Australia’s largest and most complex projects, KBR has unmatched experience supporting the nation’s critical infrastructure, energy transition and national security priorities. KBR has around 2,000 employees throughout Australia, who are focused on delivering innovative technology and engineering solutions for a safer, more secure and sustainable future.

Learn more about KBR in Australia

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture. These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company. That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

The Opportunity:

As the Director of Mission Integration, you will oversee the Mission Integration Operating Unit and its multiple projects and workstreams to ensure their successful delivery and alignment with KBR’s strategic goals. You will be responsible for achieving quality outcomes for clients, while maintaining strong engagement to understand and address their needs. You will provide leadership across people, programs, and growth activities, ensuring governance and compliance. Working with the People team, you will support staff development, retention, and engagement, championing KBR’s values and culture. You will also manage resources and budgets effectively to deliver business and client outcomes, and to grow the Operating Unit now and into the future.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead the growth strategy for Mission Integration including campaigns, captures and other growth activities.
Ensure successful delivery of all projects and programs of work within Mission Integration, whilst meeting both client and KBR requirements.
Continuously improve project and program performance and quality.
Provide effective governance and compliance of projects and programs of work in a collaborative manner.
Build and maintain relationships with clients and key stakeholders internally and externally.
Lead customer engagement across the team.
Champion a collaborative and results-oriented culture focused on development, retention and continuous improvement of employees, systems and processes.
Develop and implement workforce planning to achieve strategic objectives in conjunction with the People team.
Support commercial, contractual and business development/capture activities as needed.
Participate in the development of budgets and financial targets and manage assigned budget targets.
Demonstrate commitment to HSE and promote awareness whilst ensuring compliance with targets and policies.

Required Qualifications, Experience & Skills:

Required:

Extensive previous & successful experience in program management and operational delivery within the Defence and government market.
Proven ability to lead large teams and get the best out of staff.
Proven ability to effectively manage relationships with key senior stakeholders both internally and externally in a Defence/Defence Industry environment.
Extensive & relevant network across Defence and Federal government with market/industry knowledge and expertise.
Results oriented and proven ability to drive sustained business growth through successful delivery to high standards.
Demonstrated experience in governance and compliance of programs of work and effectively managing and overseeing multiple schedules, budgets and teams to achieve success.
Tertiary qualifications in business, engineering, management, technology, or other relevant fields.
Ability to obtain and maintain an Australian Government security clearance.

Desirable:

Qualifications in project/program management.
Reputation as a thought leader, demonstrated by published articles, conference presentations etc.
Experience in managing geographically disparate teams and fostering a culture of inclusion, collaboration and excellence.

Benefits of KBR

A workplace culture certified as a Great Place To Work
Flexible working conditions
Competitive salary (including annual reviews)
Paid Parental leave
Paid Reservist leave
Income protection
Corporate rewards
Salary packaging/Novated leasing
Discounted employee stock purchase plans
Flu shots, skin checks and private health insurance discounts
Career development: Online learning, mentorship and career pathways

Please note. Shortlisting will take place as applications are received, therefore the advertisement may close early if a suitable candidate is identified.

For shortlisted candidates, you may be invited to complete a short psychometric assessment as part of the recruitment process. These assessments help us gain a fair and objective understanding of your strengths and working style.

Notice to Third Parties/Recruitment Agencies: KBR Australia does not accept unsolicited resumes or any liability associated with fees or costs from recruitment agencies, search firms or third parties who have not been engaged directly on this job opportunity. Candidates interested in applying are welcome to submit their application online.

Title:

Proposal Writer

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! - At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture. Program Summary

KBR combines mission expertise with advanced digital technologies to solve the world’s toughest challenges on a global scale. KBR is a trusted national security partner for a wide array of customers across space, land, air and sea. KBR delivers innovative solutions across digital engineering and integration, rapid prototyping, mission operations, data analytics, artificial intelligence and secure logistics. At KBR, We deliver.™

Job Summary

We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Proposal Writer to join our dynamic Business Development team and contribute to our mission of growth and excellence. As a Proposal Writer at KBR, you will play a pivotal role in crafting compelling narratives that showcase our company's capabilities, expertise, and successes. Our small, robust team is a dynamic and tightly-knit group of professionals dedicated to achieving excellence in our work. We take pride in our ability to make a significant impact within our organization, and we're looking for individuals who are eager to contribute and grow with us.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Strategic Content Creation: Write, edit, and produce persuasive content for proposals, corporate databases, sales documents, and other business development-related projects.

Information Sourcing: Identify and gather relevant information sources to enrich proposal content, including conducting interviews and research as needed.

Knowledge Management: Support initiatives to organize and upload content within corporate databases and archives.

Collaborative Teamwork: Work closely with stakeholders including Subject Matter Experts to capture concepts, maintain messaging consistency, and ensure alignment with our corporate strategy.

Quality Assurance: Proofread and edit your own work and the work of others, ensuring it aligns with in-house and client styles.

Project Coordination: Coordinate multiple simultaneous proposals, create outlines and storyboards to guide content development, and manage proposal plans.

Illustration Collaboration: Collaborate with graphic designers to develop visuals that enhance narrative content.

Basic Qualifications 

Bachelor's degree in English, Journalism, Business, Communications, or a related field.

4+ years of proven experience in proposal development, business development, or a related field.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Detail-oriented, with excellent organizational and time management skills to thrive in a deadline-driven environment.

Strong interpersonal skills, ability to build rapport, and work effectively in a team.

Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and proposal management tools.

Preferred Qualifications

Exceptional persuasive writing skills with the ability to tell a clear and compelling story.

Familiarity with SharePoint and Adobe Creative Suite is a plus.

Relevant work experience is preferred.

Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and occasional overtime requirements (including over weekends and holidays, potentially on short notice).

Previous KBR or industry experience desired.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Mechanical Engineer
location:
locations
Alice Springs, Northern Territory, Australia
description:
Title:

Mechanical Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Who You Are
You’re a skilled Mechanical Engineer with a passion for designing and optimizing mechanical systems that play a critical role in supporting missions for our customers. Your expertise in mechanics, thermodynamics, and materials science allows you to develop innovative solutions that enhance performance, reliability, and safety. You thrive in challenging environments, using your analytical skills to tackle complex problems and deliver efficient, effective designs.

At KBR, you bring a collaborative spirit and a commitment to excellence to every project. Known for your attention to detail and problem-solving capabilities, you work closely with multidisciplinary teams to ensure that mechanical systems meet stringent specifications and operational requirements. Your proactive approach to design, testing, and troubleshooting contributes to KBR’s mission of operational readiness and creating a safer, more secure, and sustainable future.

This is a contingent position based upon contract award


What You'll Do
In the role of Engineer, Mechanical, your duties will include:

Studies, designs, specs, and services mechanical systems.

Functions as a technical specialist who makes decisions and recommendations that are recognized as authoritative and have a far-reaching impact on extensive engineering and related activities.

Negotiates critical and controversial issues with top-level engineers and officers of other organizations and companies.

Performs advisory and consulting work for the organization as a recognized authority for broad program areas or in an intensely specialized area.

Other duties as required.

Requirements:

Must be a US or Australian citizen

Must have a US TS/SCI Clearance w/ Poly, or an Australian PV clearance

Must have a minimum of a BA/BS in Engineering from an accredited institution

Must have a minimum of seven years of mechanical engineering experience

Must have a PE-Mechanical license

This role will be located in Alice Springs, at a 4,400-acre facility with approximately 687,000 square feet of mission and support space.  This position is expected to be onsite 100%.

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

locations

description:
Title:

Generator Specialist

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Who You Are
You’re a skilled Generator Specialist with a strong background in the installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of generator systems. Your expertise ensures that critical power solutions are reliable and ready to support mission success for our customers. You excel at diagnosing issues, performing repairs, and conducting preventative maintenance, ensuring that generators operate at peak performance in any environment.

At KBR, you bring a detail-oriented approach and a commitment to safety to every project. Known for your problem-solving skills and technical proficiency, you work effectively both independently and as part of a team, collaborating with other professionals to ensure that power systems are always operational and compliant with industry standards. Your proactive mindset and dedication to continuous improvement contribute to KBR’s mission of delivering innovative solutions that enhance operational readiness and security.

This is a contingent position based upon contract award

What You'll Do
In the role of Generator Specialist, your duties will include:

Installation and Commissioning: Oversee the installation and commissioning of generator systems, ensuring compliance with industry standards and safety regulations.

Maintenance and Repairs: Conduct routine maintenance, troubleshooting, and repairs of generator systems to ensure optimal performance and reliability.

Diagnostic Testing: Perform diagnostic tests to identify issues in generator systems, utilizing specialized tools and equipment for accurate assessments.

Documentation and Reporting: Maintain detailed records of maintenance activities, repairs, and inspections, and prepare reports for management review.

Safety Compliance: Implement and uphold safety protocols during all operations, ensuring a safe work environment for yourself and others.

Training and Support: Provide technical guidance and training to team members and other personnel on the proper use and maintenance of generator systems.

Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to coordinate activities and ensure seamless operations during power outages or emergencies.

Inventory Management: Monitor and manage inventory levels of spare parts and equipment, ensuring availability for timely maintenance and repairs.

Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on industry trends, technologies, and best practices to enhance generator performance and operational efficiency.

Emergency Response: Respond promptly to generator failures and emergencies, providing on-site support to restore power quickly and efficiently.

Requirements:

Must be a US or Australian citizen

Must have a US Secret clearance, or an Australian NV-1 clearance

Must have a minimum of five years of experience as a generator specialist

Must be a Certified Generator Mechanic (Note: CAT is strongly preferred)

Must be a Certified OEM Generator Operator (Note: Preferably CAT certified)

Must be capable of troubleshooting small and large generators (i.e., Cummins, FG Wilson, Agrrekko, Caterpillar)

Attention to Detail: Precision and attention to detail to ensure high-quality service delivery and compliance with safety standards.

Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing conditions, technologies, and requirements.

Decision-Making Ability: Strong decision-making skills to resolve issues quickly and effectively under pressure.

Desired Qualifications:

OEM Power Plant Operator Certification

CAT Certification

This role will be located in Alice Springs, at a 4,400-acre facility with approximately 687,000 square feet of mission and support space.  This position is expected to be onsite 100%.

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Title:

Fire Protection O&M Technician

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Who You Are
You’re a dedicated Fire Protection Operations and Maintenance (O&M) Specialist with a strong commitment to ensuring the safety and reliability of fire protection systems. With your extensive knowledge of fire codes, standards, and best practices, you play a vital role in maintaining and enhancing the effectiveness of fire safety measures for our customers. You excel at conducting inspections, performing maintenance, and implementing proactive measures to ensure that all systems function optimally and comply with regulatory requirements.

At KBR, you bring a detail-oriented approach and a passion for safety to every task. Known for your problem-solving skills and technical expertise, you work collaboratively with teams to assess risks, troubleshoot issues, and implement effective solutions. Your proactive mindset and strong communication skills ensure that all stakeholders are informed and engaged in maintaining a culture of safety and preparedness.

This is a contingent position based upon contract award


What You'll Do
In the role of Fire Protection O&M Technician, your duties will include:

Install, repair, and inspect smoke and fire suppression systems.

Inspect, test and repair fire alarm wiring, fire alarm panels and peripheral equipment.

Identify hazards, defects, and the need for adjustment or repair.

Inspect, repair or replace smoke/heat detectors and sprinkler heads.

Repair and test wet/dry systems; test fire alarm system devices using appropriate diagnostic programs and test equipment.

Ensure that work is in accordance with relevant codes.

Read, interpret, and apply system design plans and building construction drawings and documents.

Perform true test smoke detector sensitivity procedure.

Perform routine maintenance on equipment and determine when and what kind of maintenance is required.

Performs all other duties as assigned.

Requirements:

Must be a US or Australian citizen

Must have a minimum of five years of experience working with fire protection equipment and systems

Must possess NICET II or NICET III

Must possess and maintain qualifications in accordance with US DoD Unified Facilities Criteria (UFC), or Australian equivalent acceptable to the USG

Desired Qualifications:

BA/BS from an accredited institution

Ability to obtain a TS/SCI w/Poly or Australian PV clearance

This role will be located in Alice Springs, at a 4,400-acre facility with approximately 687,000 square feet of mission and support space.  This position is expected to be onsite 100%.

title: ICS: AFHE Maintenance Technician
description:
Title:

ICS: AFHE Maintenance Technician

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR Government Solutions pioneers comprehensive professional and technical services, enhancing operational preparedness and fostering innovation across diverse domains. We specialize in empowering mission success across terrestrial, aerial, maritime, celestial, and virtual frontiers, serving esteemed clients such as the Department of Defense, intelligence community, NASA, and other government agencies. Our proficiency spans engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity, ensuring robust support for critical endeavors.

Our dedicated team propels global productivity, efficiency, and intrigue, offering an unparalleled opportunity to drive transformative change within the realm of DoD Fuel Management Systems. Join us on this journey toward greater impact and endless possibilities.

Job Summary

Are you passionate about delivering exceptional work with unwavering integrity? Step into the role of AFHE Maintenance Technician and become an indispensable part of our team.In this pivotal position, you will be at the forefront of maintaining, modifying, and installing Automated Fueling System Equipment (AFHE) across various sites and projects worldwide. Your dedication will directly contribute to the seamless operations crucial for Global Readiness & Sustainment of the United States Military.

We're not just meeting standards; we're exceeding them. As an AFHE Maintenance Technician, you'll join forces with like-minded professionals dedicated to excellence. Your meticulous attention to detail, coupled with your commitment to exceeding expectations, will drive our success forward.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Efficient Time and Resource Management: Strategically direct and manage the allocation of time and provided resources to meet demanding schedules, ensuring adherence to both KBR and stakeholder standards for quality and value.
Documentation Management: Diligently maintain and track maintenance documents and deliverables, ensuring timely submission to management for review and approval.
Customer Site Coordination: Organize, schedule, and execute high-quality work at customer sites, maintaining a standard of excellence in service delivery.
Stakeholder Engagement: Foster and sustain positive relationships with stakeholders, effectively engaging and collaborating with site personnel to achieve project objectives.
Install Industrial Control Systems: PLC panels (Programmable Logic Controllers), VFDs (Variable Frequency Drives), Control wiring (24VDC, 120VAC, analog, digital signals & modems, sensors, limit switches, encoders, HMI screens (Human-Machine Interfaces)
Troubleshoot Automation Equipment: PLC logic issues, faulty relays, sensors, or I/O modules, motor control problems, network or communication faults (Ethernet/IP, Modbus, Profinet).
Program or Modify Control Systems: Create or edit PLC ladder logic, function block, structured text, configure VFD parameters, update HMI graphics and process controls.
Additional Responsibilities: Undertake any other duties as assigned, demonstrating flexibility and adaptability in supporting organizational needs.
Must be able to lift ±40 lbs
Must be able to climb stairs to access heights of 20’ or greater
Must be able to perform physical duties such as kneeling, bending, and working in varied conditions to complete installations effectively.
Travel: This position has a 20% travel requirement.

Basic Qualifications 

Must be a US Citizen.
Must be able to pass a NACLC security background check.
Strong electrical knowledge (often more advanced than standard electricians)
Proficiency in troubleshooting  3 phase and single phase AC circuits, low voltage DC control circuits and various communication protocols including Modbus RTU and TCP/IP.
Ability to troubleshoot and maintain industrial network infrastructure including Ethernet and fiber optic networks
Experience with PLC programming (Allen-Bradley, Siemens, Mitsubishi, Omron).
Ability to read, interpret, and verify control schematics, wiring diagrams, design drawings, P&IDs, ladder logic
Proficient with the use of hand tools and diagnostic equipment i.e. multimeters, process calibrators, and instrumentation calibration (pressure, flow, temp, level).
Strong understanding of analog and digital technology.
Understanding of NEC code and NFPA 70e & mechanical aptitudes (pneumatics, hydraulics)
Computer and Microsoft Windows proficiency.

Preferred Qualifications

Preference for current possession of a government CAC.
Active or previous security clearance preferred.
Experience with Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) systems is a plus

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. description:
Title:

AI Engineer – Agentic AI Solutions for Automated Decision Making

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. We all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely by supporting the science that informs decision makers and protects Earth.

About the Role

We are seeking a highly experienced AI Engineer to join our team in developing an agentic AI solution designed to streamline and automate decision making against data lakes. This is a unique opportunity to work on a mission-critical system that leverages Generative AI (GenAI) and Large Language Models (LLMs) to deliver real-world impact in a regulated environment.

You will collaborate closely with architects, product managers, and engineers to design, build, and optimize AI-driven workflows that meet stringent compliance and performance requirements.

Responsibilities
Agentic AI Development: Architect and implement agent-based AI systems to manage complex, multi-step permitting workflows.
Prompt Engineering & Orchestration: Design, test, and refine prompts and system instructions for LLMs to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Integration & Automation: Build backend services and APIs to integrate AI components with federal systems and cloud infrastructure.
Model Evaluation & Compliance: Develop evaluation frameworks to monitor LLM performance, ensuring outputs meet regulatory standards.
Scalable Architecture: Design solutions that are secure, cost-effective, and optimized for AWS cloud environments.
Continuous Improvement: Iterate based on metrics, user feedback, and compliance audits to enhance system performance.
Qualifications
10+ years of experience in software engineering or solution architecture.
5+ years of hands-on experience with Python in production environments.
***Must be a U.S. Citizen***
Strong expertise in AWS cloud architecture and cost optimization strategies.
Familiarity with LLMs, Generative AI, and agentic AI frameworks – with emphasis on Claude and Bedrock.
Experience with prompt engineering, RAG pipelines, and vector databases.
Familiarity with Geospatial data integration with ESRI products.
Knowledge of federal compliance requirements and secure system design.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a distributed, remote team.
Preferred Skills
Experience with workflow automation and orchestration tools such as salesforce.
Background in NLP, knowledge graphs, and structured output validation.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and evaluation tooling for AI systems.
Why Join Us?
Work on cutting-edge AI solutions with real-world impact.
Collaborate with a highly skilled, mission-driven team.
Enjoy a remote-first culture with flexibility and autonomy.
Competitive compensation and benefits.

Special Requirements

Three years of continuous U.S. residency for government security credential.
Ability to obtain and maintain a national agency check and background investigation for government facility access.
Experience and/or education in lieu of these qualifications may be considered.
***Must be a U.S. Citizen***

Benefits

Competitive benefits: 401K with match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending, disability, paid time off, flexible schedule.
Career advancement through professional training and development.
Benefits may be aligned with partner companies for government contracting.
More details: https://careers.kbr.com/us/en/kbr-benefits?

title: Senior or Principal Analysis Engineer (Pipeline Installation)
description:
Role Overview

We are looking for a Senior or Principal Analysis Engineer (Pipeline Installation) to join our Pipeline Group (PG) team at our Sutton, London office on a full-time, permanent basis.

 

The analysis engineering team within Pipeline Group are responsible for delivering fit for purpose rigid pipeline installation analysis to projects and/or tenders, with specific focus on safe and cost effective installation operations.

 

Our engineers are recognised for their expertise and at principal level management skills.  They can oversee a team of installation analysis project engineers, dealing with rigid pipeline installation analysis in project, FEED or tender.   They are responsible to the Analysis Team Lead for the efficient day-to-day management of the installation analysis team and provide regular operational reports on general project engineering activities, technical subject matters and resource management.

 

What will you be doing?

 

Perform in autonomy installation analysis of rigid pipeline in S-lay, J-lay and/or Reel-lay and be accountable for you, and in some cases depending on level a teams, scope of work.
Mentor and support junior engineers on their scopes of work
Responsible for ensuring that standard of engineering services provided complies with relevant company engineering standards with a clear focus on commerciality of engineering solutions.
Ensure installation analysis solution is fit for purpose while meeting client specifications.
Provide engineering support during operations with occasional periods offshore or on yard.
Promote safety culture and initiatives to the installation engineering team throughout the onshore and offshore delivery phases.
Participate actively to the Pipeline Group department know-how consolidation
Propose innovative solutions allowing cost & risks reduction.
What experience would we like you to have?

Please note, if you don’t tick all the boxes below but feel you have some of the relevant skills and experience, we’re looking for, please do consider applying. We would encourage you to apply with a CV that highlights your transferable skills and experience.

 

Degree qualified in a relevant engineering or similar subject
Demonstrable relevant experience (preferably in the Oil & Gas market but other relevant experience will be considered).
Proficient with Orcaflex and familiarity with systems such as Python, VBA and Abaqus
Good communication skills with ability to speak with all levels within the business.  Comfortable working individually and as part of a team.
Excellent report writing skills with the ability to self-check and produce accurate work, as well as the ability prioritise and organise work accordingly to meet deadlines set by management.
This role may involve short spells of overseas travel so candidates may need to show a willingness and flexibility to meet these requirements.

title: Pre-Commissioning Operations Manager
description:
Long Description

Subsea7 has a new opportunity for an Operations Manager to join our team, supporting Pre-Commissioning and Remote Intervention. Whilst knowledge in both areas is preferred, the main focus of this role will be on the Pre-Commissioning side. This is a permanent role which will ideally be based in our Paris office but is also open to applications to support from our Lisbon office.

 

We’re seeking a seasoned professional to lead operational excellence in pre-commissioning and remote intervention activities. In this pivotal role, you’ll provide expert guidance across projects and tenders, ensuring scope readiness and seamless collaboration between engineering, project operations, and offshore teams. You’ll also support the Equipment Assurance team by resolving operational queries and help shape robust assurance processes across the Africa, Middle East, Mediterranean, and Türkiye (AME) region. Your insights will be key in reviewing equipment and operational plans, driving quality and efficiency across our operations.

What will you be doing?

Technical Support and Query Resolution:

Support the Equipment Assurance team by answering or clarifying operational queries related to pre-commissioning and Remote Intervention subjects.

 

Subject matter expert:

Regular audit from Company within ROV team (IMCA) to validate Subsea7 within all company.
Contribute with operational lessons learnt and share these with

 

Equipment Assurance Process:

Performs Equipment Assurance desktop exercise for pre-commissioning and Remote Intervention equipment.
If necessary, prepare inspection plans & tooling tests in coordination with the Group Offshore Resources team & engineering.
Ensure all necessary tests (pre-mobilization and performance tests, SIT, mock-up, ROV access) and validations are conducted prior to operations, addressing any identified issues.
Review specific operational task plans and identify any gaps between engineering expectation and field operability.

 

Stakeholder Engagement and Communication:

Engage with key stakeholders, both in the office and on-site, to facilitate and coordinate equipment assurance process.
Overall single focal point for project-related pre-commissioning & Remote Intervention operational matters within Project & tender teams.
Deliver clear, actionable updates and recommendations to management on assurance progress and outcomes.

 

Personnel Training and Development:

Coordinate training providers and stakeholders to address any skill gaps for operational execution.
Review Pre-commissioning & Remote Intervention team man-plan with engineering & project team ahead of operations to ensure proper level of support.
Promote a culture of safety, quality, and operational excellence among all team members.

 

Support to tendering:

Actively participate in tenders’ strategy related to marine, crew and equipment assurance. Assist project Operations Manager identifying, developing actions plans and pricing any specific needs regarding future jobs.
What experience would we like you to have?

Please note, if you don’t tick all the boxes below but feel you have some of the relevant skills and experience we’re looking for, please do consider applying. We would encourage you to apply with a CV that highlights your transferable skills and experience.

 

Bachelor’s degree in marine engineering, Naval Architecture, Mechanical Engineering, or related discipline.
Demonstrated experience in offshore operations following Pre-commissioning operations with Remote Intervention knowledge being an additional benefit.
Direct experience with vessels equipment audits, permanent equipment systems, and other heavy offshore machinery.
Prior exposure to project management or assurance roles.
IMCA Auditor certificate
Offshore Survival Training (e.g., BOSIET/FOET).
Chief Engineer Certificate or similar qualification.
Knowledge of industry standards such as IMCA, OCIMF, and ISO frameworks.
Familiarity with Safety Management Systems (SMS) and quality assurance practices.
Proficiency in inspection tools and software relevant to offshore assurance.
Proficient working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite and other reporting tools.
Understanding of condition monitoring techniques and asset management systems.

title: Senior Project Engineer
description:
We are looking for an experienced and motivated Senior Project Engineer to join our team at our office in Houston, Tx on a full-time basis.
 
What will you be doing?
·    Support the development of project-specific procedures for the implementation of work to be carried out by onshore & offshore personnel in accordance with Subsea 7 minimum standards. This may include some liaison directly with clients and subcontractors. 
·    Identify suitable equipment to perform operational tasks offshore, checking all aspects of the equipment to ensure it is operated safely and efficiently with suitable certification provided to meet statutory regulations. Also liaise with vessel departments and third party contractors to ensure all equipment is fit for purpose and fully compatible with offshore worksite. 
·    Interfaces with associated subsea related disciplines and understands the interfaces within the project environment
·    Operate within standardised engineering policies, processes and systems in the Business Management System BMS
·    Involved with meetings/correspondence with Clients, subcontractors, 3rd parties, etc. in a technical capacity.
 
What experience would we like you to have?
Please note, if you don’t tick all the boxes below but feel you have some of the relevant skills and experience, we’re looking for, please do consider applying. We would encourage you to apply with a CV that highlights your transferable skills and experience.
·    Professional qualifications – Engineering Degree (Demonstrable experience in a similar role will also be considered)
·    Relevant engineering experience (5+ years) in the Subsea Umbilical Riser Flowline (SURF) within the Marine and/or Oil and Gas industry
·    Identifies industry codes, standards and design guidelines.
·    Ability to support package engineering and management
·    Presents self in a professional manner appropriate to the role
 
 
What do we offer?
·    Career development – with access to a range of learning and development opportunities, as well as being part of a culture that encourages growth and development
·    Flexible working – lots of our people work flexibly in different ways. Whether it’s hybrid, part-time or flexitime working. We can’t promise to give you exactly what you want, but let’s have a discussion to see how we can make it work.
·    Enhanced maternity/paternity leave/adoption leave 
·    A fantastic benefits package – which includes a generous holiday allowance, pension scheme, discounted health and wellbeing packages, electric car salary sacrifice scheme and more.
 
Who are we?
We are Subsea7, a global leader in the delivery of offshore projects and services for the energy industry. We make offshore energy transition possible through the continuous evolution of lower-carbon oil and gas and by enabling the growth of renewables and emerging energy.
At Subsea7, we are looking for people who think differently. We want people who can bring new ideas and who are willing to take on challenges that will enable us to make a positive impact on a global stage.
In turn we will lift you up and encourage you to go further.  Onshore or offshore, embark on a journey of opportunities, continuous learning and development.
Start your journey with us today.
 
An environment where you can thrive
We recognise that having a diverse team makes us a better, smarter team. Diversity is something we value and regard it as key to our success.
We encourage new ways of thinking and celebrate our wide range of skills that help us continually challenge the status quo and inspire innovation. An inclusive and diverse environment fosters creativity, improves decision-making and introduces new ways of thinking.
Our people are at the heart of what we do at Subsea7 and we are committed to creating an environment where everyone can thrive. Fair employment practices, fair treatment for all individuals and equal opportunity on the basis of merit are the foundation of how we work and develop together.
What happens next?
If you would like to apply for this role, simply click the Apply button found on this page.  
You may be prompted to set up a profile with us. It’s quick and easy to do.  Or, if you have already created a profile with us, simply log in and submit your application.
Here are 3 top tips to help you submit a successful application:
·    Make sure your CV is up-to-date and highlights the transferable skills and experience you can bring to this role.
·    We would encourage you to include a cover letter as part of your application. It’s your chance to tell us why you would be a brilliant addition to our team.
·    Take your time with your application and check there are no errors before final submission

title: Vessel Engineer Lead
description:
What will you be doing?

Responsável por liderar um time de engenharia de instalação, atuando tanto no âmbito técnico quanto no funcional. No aspecto técnico, será encarregado de coordenar a elaboração de procedimentos de instalação e de atuar como ponto focal da engenharia para suporte às embarcações durante as operações.Caberá a este profissional planejar e executar as entregas das documentações técnicas, assegurando que estejam em conformidade com as demandas dos clientes e com os prazos contratuais estabelecidos.

No âmbito funcional, terá a responsabilidade de realizar a gestão de carreira do time, incluindo atividades de desenvolvimento, treinamentos e acompanhamento de performance. Deverá garantir o cumprimento dos procedimentos internos da Subsea7, manter boas interfaces com clientes internos e demais departamentos, além de demonstrar compromisso diário com HSEQ e com os valores da empresa. Trata-se de um cargo de liderança, com atribuições que incluem revisar e aprimorar continuamente os processos de trabalho do departamento, buscando eficiência e inovação.

 

Responsabilidades e Desafios Principais

Coordenar e executar as atividades definidas dentro dos processos, assegurando qualidade, segurança e cumprimento dos prazos estipulados pelo gestor da área.

Revisar e aprovar procedimentos de instalação de linhas flexíveis, umbilicais e equipamentos submarinos para embarcações do tipo PLSV.

Ser referência técnica para cálculos de engenharia, incluindo carga de tração, passos de lançamento, tensionadores e análises de ancoragem, com foco em instalação de dutos flexíveis e umbilicais.

Elaborar estudos de viabilidade técnica, definindo cronogramas e estimativas de custos.

Participar ativamente das discussões operacionais da embarcação, atuando como ponto focal técnico da engenharia e garantindo o cumprimento dos procedimentos e padrões estabelecidos pela Subsea7 e pela indústria.

Realizar contatos com clientes, compreendendo suas necessidades, identificando e solucionando problemas de projeto e implementando soluções adequadas.

Apoiar o desenvolvimento de melhorias de processo, inovações e ferramentas de automação, buscando novas e mais eficientes formas de realizar o trabalho.

Conduzir o time de engenharia do PLSV para o desenvolvimento de procedimentos de instalação de forma segura, correta e dentro dos prazos estabelecidos.

Identificar constantemente oportunidades de melhorias de performance e segurança nas operações das embarcações, auxiliando na implementação das soluções.

Atuar de maneira próxima às embarcações, realizando visitas e embarques esporádicos, capturando melhorias, feedbacks e identificando lacunas nos procedimentos de instalação e no desenvolvimento da equipe.

Promover o desenvolvimento do time, identificando necessidades de treinamento, propondo melhorias e praticando feedbacks contínuos.

 

What experience would we like you to have?
Requisitos Obrigatórios

Formação superior completa em Engenharia.

Experiência comprovada em contratos de longo prazo de embarcações do tipo PLSV.

Inglês avançado.

Disponibilidade para realizar embarques.

Domínio avançado do pacote Office.

Conhecimento em VBA ou outras ferramentas de automação de processos.

Conhecimento em MS Project e AutoCAD (ou similar).

Experiência prévia em coordenação de pessoas.

Vivência no segmento de Óleo e Gás.

title: Principal Engineer
description:
Long Description

The Principal Engineer will act as the Product Organisation’s representative for the Brazil region and will serve as the primary point of contact for all ICM product related activities, with particular focus on Mechanically Lined Pipe products.

This role requires applying technical expertise to support the region in the advancement and promotion of Subsea7’s Internal Corrosion Management products for client projects, new product development and continuous improvement initiatives.

The Principal Engineer will also manage communications and actions associated with clients and therefore must demonstrate strong collaboration and communication skills, engaging effectively with stakeholders at all organisational levels.

The role requires solid understanding of pipe manufacturing processes, pipeline fabrication and installation methods combined with significant theoretical and practical expertise in Corrosion Resistant Alloy materials and associated pipeline solutions.

Key responsibilities include providing technical and commercial product support for early engagement activities and project strategies, building and maintaining relationships with internal stakeholders, clients and suppliers, ensuring accurate technical communication, supporting product strategy definition, identifying and eliminating product cost of loss, providing support to Supply Chain Management, leading product development programmes and participating in Communities of Experts. The role will also gather and maintain regional market intelligence, regulatory updates and technological advancements relevant to ICM products.

Key Responsibilities

The Principal Engineer will -

Product Technical and Commercial Support: Provide technical product information (including product design and operational envelopes) and commercially appropriate product recommendations and guidance to key stakeholders in support of early engagement activities and project win strategies.
Stakeholder Collaboration and Communications: Build and maintain relationships with key internal and external (clients and suppliers) stakeholders.  

Provide clear and accurate product communications (verbally, written or via presentations), both technical and commercial, to internal audiences including senior management. 

Ensure accuracy and alignment of product information across key internal stakeholders and externally with clients and suppliers.

Provide Input to Product Strategy: Work with the Product Director and Product Engineering Manager to ensure product roadmaps and team activities remain accurate and relevant to the region.  In addition, the Principal Engineer will help maintain product trend analysis, SWOT analysis and competition analysis.
Eliminate Product Cost of Loss: Utilising information streams such as project feedback, Lessons Learned, product risk matrices, Corrective and Preventative Actions (CAPA), Supplier Performance Incidents (SPIs), identify and execute opportunities for product improvements and to eliminate product associated cost of loss for future projects.
Supply Chain Support: Provide technical support to Supply Chain Management regarding suppliers of ICM pipeline products, including market assessments, leading qualification activities and facilitating discussions around product schedule, quality, cost, etc.
Lead Product Development Programmes: Ensure new products are developed, and introduced to the market, in line with Company processes and product strategy.  In addition, lead product portfolio expansion projects such as new material selection and qualification.
Community of Experts (CoE) Participation: Participate and contribute in relevant CoE meetings. Provide product input and perspective for the purpose of the development of technical standards and specifications.
Product Related Market Intelligence: Gather regional product associated market information to support product team strategies. Maintain awareness of regional regulatory and client specification changes and product associated technological advancements.
Skills and Experience

Masters Degree qualified in relevant subject (ideally Materials - Metallurgy based).

Thorough understanding of pipe manufacturing processes, fabrication and installation methods.
Significant theoretical and practical understanding of CRA materials and associated pipeline solutions (in particular Mechanically Lined Pipe).
Effective communication and interpersonal skills at all levels of the business.  Ability to create and deliver reports and presentations.
Effective analytical skills, applies creative problem solving, will suggest and develop new methods and ways of working.
A collaborative worker who builds effective relationships across a highly diverse global business.
Self-motivated, takes ownership of responsibilities and works with minimum supervision, while also contributing to the wider team activities.
Pro-active planning and organising skills, able to identify and effectively prioritise workload and successfully meet multiple, competing deadlines.
Flexible to adapt to changing priorities within a fast-paced 24/7 global business.
Progressive thinking, pro-actively seeks to develop own learning and development.
Committed to continuous improvement and identification of efficient work methods and processes.
IT proficient across MS Office.
Fluent in English and Portuguese.

We value diversity and see differences as opportunities rather than barriers, ensuring full development conditions for our professionals and also for society.

All of our positions are open to people with disabilities and/or those who have been rehabilitated.
