title: Digital Solutions Engineer (Orcaflex/Abaqus)
description:
Role Introduction

Subsea7 has an exciting opportunity for a Digital Solutions Engineer (Orcaflex/Abaqus) to join our Pipeline Group (PG) team in Sutton. This team specializes in delivering fit-for-purpose rigid pipeline installation engineering for projects and tenders, focusing on safe and cost-effective offshore installation operations.

 

As a Digital Solutions Engineer (Orcaflex/Abaqus), you will have a significant role in our digital transformation journey. Working closely with the Installation Engineering Digitalisation Champion, you will help advance initiatives that bring PG into the digital era. Your responsibilities will include developing automation and digital tools, standardising processes, and exploring data applications—all aimed at improving efficiency and enhancing ways of working within the PG Installation Engineering teams.

 

This position is open to candidates with industry experience, and we also welcome applications from individuals with a recently acquired PhD with a relevant background.

What will you be doing?

The Digital Solutions Engineer (Orcaflex/Abaqus) will play a key role in implementing digital innovation within our Pipeline Group (PG) Installation Engineering team. Your responsibilities will include:

 

Mapping Processes: Collaborate with PG team leads and principal engineers to develop clear, efficient process maps.
Building Automation Tools: Design and implement tools to automate and standardise engineering processes and activities.
Supporting Development: Oversee and monitor tool development by internal teams and external partners.
Data Exploration: Analyse data collected through digitalisation tools and identify opportunities for practical applications.
Championing Digitalisation: Assist the Installation Engineering Digitalisation Champion with planning, reporting, and promoting digital initiatives across the PG team.
Stakeholder Management: Maintain effective interfaces with key stakeholders to ensure alignment and progress.
Industry Awareness: Stay up to date with industry trends and identify new digital opportunities for PG Installation Engineering.
What experience would we like you to have?

We welcome applications from candidates who may not meet every requirement listed below but have relevant skills and experience. If you’re motivated by digitalisation and innovation, we encourage you to apply and highlight your transferable skills.

 

A degree in a relevant engineering discipline or similar field. Candidates holding a PhD in a relevant area will also be considered
Proficient in Orcaflex or Abaqus, and experience with programming tools such as Python or VBA.
Knowledge and experience in offshore installation engineering.
A keen interest in programming and digitalisation, with a commitment to improving ways of working.
Good communication skills with ability to speak with all levels within the business.  Comfortable working individually and as part of a team.
Proficient report writing skills with the ability to self-check and produce accurate work, as well as the ability prioritise and organise work accordingly to meet deadlines set by management.
Willingness and flexibility to undertake short periods of overseas travel when required.

title: Trainee Engineer - Rigid Pipelines
description:
About us

Leader mondial dans la réalisation de projets et services offshore pour le secteur de l’énergie, Subsea7 rend la transition énergétique en mer possible en participant au développement des énergies à faible émission en carbone, des énergies renouvelables et des énergies émergentes.

 

Nous créons de la valeur durable en fournissant les solutions de transition énergétique offshore dont le monde a besoin, pour aujourd'hui et pour demain.

 

Répartis sur les cinq continents, Subsea7 offre à ses 15 000 collaboratrices et collaborateurs des opportunités de carrière passionnantes qui leur permettent d’exprimer pleinement leurs talents et de participer à une aventure humaine hors du commun.

What will you be doing?

Vous serez intégré(e) à l'équipe Rigid Pipelines au sein du département Design & Analyses Engineering de Subsea7 GPC (Global Projects Centre). Ce département est responsable de l'ingénierie des pipelines sous-marins et des systèmes de raccordement pour les projets de construction offshore.

Dans les systèmes de pipelines sous-marins, et plus particulièrement au niveau de l'extrémité du pipeline (PLET), il est essentiel d'évaluer la distance entre la bride d'ancrage et le fond marin, surtout lorsque le PLET est situé à une profondeur importante. Cette analyse permet de s'assurer que la conduite n'est pas soumise à des contraintes excessives.

 

Pour garantir une conception sûre en termes de résistance et de fatigue, une enveloppe admissible est définie. Cette enveloppe délimite les angles et les élévations acceptables pour la bride d'ancrage, assurant ainsi que les charges et les dommages dus à la fatigue restent dans les limites admissibles.

Chaque point de cette enveloppe correspond à une analyse par éléments finis (EF) où l'intégrité du pipeline ou les dommages dus à la fatigue atteignent le seuil admissible.

Actuellement, ce processus est manuel et repose sur une méthode empirique pour identifier les limites critiques. Le modèle EF utilisé partage les mêmes hypothèses et données d'entrée que le modèle global utilisé pour l'analyse de la rugosité de fond.

 

Ce stage vise à étudier comment simplifier le modèle EF actuel sans compromettre sa précision ainsi qu’à automatiser la génération de l'enveloppe admissible, éliminant ainsi les itérations manuelles et améliorant l'efficacité de la conception.

 

Vos principales responsabilités seront les suivantes :

 

Examiner et analyser le modèle EF actuel utilisé pour la génération de l'enveloppe.
Identifier les possibilités de simplification du modèle tout en conservant des résultats fiables.
Concevoir et mettre en œuvre un processus automatisé pour générer l'enveloppe admissible.
Développer des scripts ou des outils pour exécuter des simulations et compiler les résultats de manière autonome.
Valider l'approche automatisée en la comparant aux méthodes manuelles existantes.
Documenter la méthodologie et formuler des recommandations pour son intégration dans les flux de travail d'ingénierie.
What experience would we like you to have?
Étudiant(e) en dernière année d'école d'ingénieurs ou en master spécialisé en génie mécanique, génie offshore ou modélisation numérique
Maîtrise de l'analyse par éléments finis (par exemple, Abaqus, Ansys ou équivalent)
Compétences en programmation (Python, MATLAB ou équivalent) pour l'automatisation et le traitement des données
Intérêt pour les systèmes offshore, l'analyse de la fatigue et l'intégrité structurale
Esprit analytique, autonomie et proactivité dans la résolution de problèmes
Anglais courant obligatoire (langue de travail de l'équipe)

 

Location

Le stage est basé à Bois-Colombes (92).

 

Duration

6 mois

 

Vous souhaitez travailler dans un environnement multiculturel où la diversité et l’inclusion ne sont pas que des mots et participer de l’intérieur au défi passionnant de la transition énergétique ? Envoyez-nous votre candidature !

 

Subsea7 est fier d'être un employeur qui respecte l'égalité des chances et qui recrute tous les talents sans distinction de race, de genre, de religion, d’origine, d’orientation sexuelle, de handicap ou d’âge.

title: Senior Quantity Surveyor
description:
Subsea7 has one of the most capable and diverse fleet of vessels in our market segment. Modern and versatile, our fleet includes chartered and high specification owned vessels.

 
The Senior Quantity Surveyor will join a large team of experts based in our Aberdeen office who, together, ensure the operational capability of the vessels that power our global projects.

 
Specifically, the Senior Quantity Surveyor has a crucial role to play creating and owning an accurate programme for the lifecycle of each vessel repair, maintenance and refit project.  The role will also mentor and develop a team of Quantity Surveyors.

 

What experience is needed to manage these complex multi-discipline projects?  

 

Cost Estimation and Project Planning and Delivery along with Contract Management. Also, Financial Management, Procurement and Value Engineering.  

 

Is subsea / marine experience essential?

 

We recognise talent is found in many industries and so welcome candidates with transferrable skills gained in high value heavy steel Civil, Construction, Nuclear or Heavy Engineering projects.  These may include petrochemical and pharmaceutical plant construction.

 

Experience managing large scale, complex projects is essential, and transferrable skills can include large scale heavy steel works, multi HVAC instrumentation / electrical, architectural awareness and surface protection.   

 

Coupled with the drive to succeed and commitment to continuous learning, together we will enable your transition into our dynamic, exciting industry!

What will you be doing?

 

This varied and exciting role has responsibility for a broad range of high complexity / criticality products and services. This includes major CAPEX projects, vessel technical stops, modifications, upgrades, and dry dockings. Reasonable planned overseas travel will be required to accommodate site and vendor visits.
 
Effective working relationships are essential throughout the organisation. With our Technology & Asset Development team for the delivery of new builds, to support HSEQ initiatives targeting environment and sustainability improvements, and to collaborate with SCM, Contracts, Vessels, Operations and Technical departments.

 

Cost Estimation & Full Programme Planning

 

Calculating quantities and cost for materials, labour and timeframes.
Input to feasibility studies and assessment of Project viability.
Preparation and overseeing of Invitation to Tender Packages, contracts including Bills of Quantity and schedules of rates as applicable.
Evaluating tenders and producing recommendations for award based on commercial/contractual criteria.
Identifying and implementing strategies for the management of risk, value engineering and cost control measures including management of change.
Design and implementing Site Query / Instruction process, control and manage change.
Identifying opportunities to improve project value and reduce cost and schedule.

 

Contract Management

 

Lead negotiation on Contracts and work schedules.
Liaise with Team on matters such as risk and disputes.
Implementing procurement strategies along with SCM team, SOW gap analysis, reduce risk and demonstrate Best Value.
Monitoring and reporting on subcontractor performance and stages of completion.
Stakeholder Consultation to understand and deliver requirements.
Provision of advice on cost management and project delivery.
Provide guidance and direction to less experienced team members.

 

Project Delivery

 

Ensures all processes are fully understood and adhered to by participating project members.
Monitoring project progress, identify potential issues and solutions.
Ensuring Projects are completed and closed out to the required standards, with lessons learned fully shared, documented and changes implemented.

 

People Management

 

Manage, mentor and develop two direct reports, providing effective leadership to inspire team dynamics and creative thinking.
Encourage ownership of tasks, setting clear goals and expectations, while providing positive guidance to support ongoing learning and progression.
What experience would we like you to have?

 

Ideally degree level qualification in Quantity Surveying, however, relevant experience in high value complex projects will also be considered.
Experience within a marine, construction, subsea or offshore sector is desirable but not essential – support will be provided to transition sectors.
IT Proficient, including Microsoft Office and information management tools.
Credible leadership and people management skills to set and manage performance objectives and provide mentorship and development.
Demonstrates initiative and ownership to deliver workload unsupervised while flexible to support wider team activities.
Commercial acumen, experienced in contract and project management, can identify and understand the commercial drivers and challenges of the business.
The ability to engage, influence and negotiate at all levels, demonstrating credibility and professionalism.
Collaborative working, the ability to build effective business relationships in-person and remotely across a multi-cultural global workforce.
Highly numeric with experience of budget management, report writing and presenting.
Effective planning and analytical skills with a high level of attention to detail.
Effectively prioritise workload to meet multiple, often competing deadlines.
Pro-active with a solutions-based approach, and the ability to constructively challenge and be challenged.
Pro-actively maintains and shares subject matter knowledge, establishes effective working relationships with external industry and regulatory bodies.
Diligently promotes adherence to HSEQ, Company and legislative requirements.
Flexible and adaptable to meet the evolving needs of a 24/7 global business
Ability to undertaken planned travel.

title: Senior Project Surveyor
description:
Introduction

 

Drive innovation. Deliver excellence. From Survey to Success.

 

At Subsea7, we lead the global delivery of offshore energy projects, pushing boundaries through ever-evolving technology, collaboration, and performance.

 

What Lies Beneath?

Across the world, we work in interesting and challenging conditions. Survey provides critical subsea data throughout each project life cycle, delivering top-quality subsea positioning, measurement, and mapping solutions. These inform key engineering, safety and environmental decisions.

 

Part of an integrated project team, you'll review client requirements, develop associated methodologies, and take overall responsibility for the successful delivery of the survey service to both internal and external clients.

 

The role is part of our wider team of global survey experts. Through effective collaboration, they provide projects with technical advice, geomatic and GIS services, best practice and innovative techniques.

 

These are permanent onshore staff positions, offering both employee benefits and long-term career opportunities. 

 

As Senior Project Surveyor supporting our Global Project Centre, you’ll work in either our Sutton (UK) or Rio (Brazil) office.   It would be advantegeous for applicants to already reside in one of these locations.

 

 

What will you be doing?

 

Provide technical and operational input throughout the SURF project lifecycle, from tender development to execution and close-out
Liaise with internal teams, clients, and third-party providers to identify personnel, equipment, and project needs, ensuring timely delivery to worksites
Develop and review project-specific survey procedures, ensuring alignment with client requirements and industry standards
Attend and lead project briefings and debriefings with survey personnel and stakeholders to ensure clarity of scope and expectations
Manage survey deliverables, oversee third-party service providers, and ensure quality and timeliness of outputs within budget constraints
Ensure end-of-trip reports are completed promptly, with lessons learned documented and communicated for continuous improvement
Identify and implement opportunities to enhance survey processes, workflows, and technologies to improve efficiency and data quality
Mentor and support junior surveyors, providing technical guidance and training
What experience would we like you to have?

 

Bachelor’s degree or regional equivalent in Surveying, Geomatics, Hydrography, Geophysics, or a related science discipline
Membership in a professional survey association is beneficial
Demonstrable role relevant experience as onshore Project Surveyor/Senior.  A background in subsea survey operations is essential.
Demonstrated experience in subsea construction operations, with a comprehensive understanding of current techniques and technologies in ROV-based positioning, measurement, and mapping
Proficient in project planning and execution, demonstrating the ability to oversee workloads efficiently while upholding safety and quality standards
Effective communication and collaboration abilities, both written and verbal, with a proactive and team-oriented mindset
Proficiency in subsea survey software

title: 1st Engineer
description:
What will you be doing?

Subsea7 is a global leader in the delivery of offshore projects and services for the energy industry. We make offshore energy transition possible through the continuous evolution of lower carbon oil and gas and by enabling the growth of renewables and emerging energy. Seaway7 is part of the Subsea7 group and is a global leader in the delivery of bottom-fixed offshore wind farm solutions. We have over 13,000 people working in 30 countries, across our fleet of over 30 vessels. 


The 1st Engineer is responsible to the Chief Engineer for operations and maintenance of the engine rooms and propulsion equipment on board and may act as the Chief Engineer's deputy in the running of the Technical Department.


We are seeking candidates who want to understand the environment in which we operate in and support effective delivery of our offshore projects, building effective and trusting two-way relationships with internal and external stakeholders. You will have a desire to develop yourself, building individual effectiveness and capability to change and deliver. 


To be considered for this position/role, applicants will need to have completed their Certificate of Competency Section A-III/2 of the STCW Code, a recognized Seamans Book and be conversant in vessel Safety Management Systems and well as Security Awareness training relevant for the position.


Subsea7 is proud to offer an inclusive work environment where everyone has the opportunity to thrive. This means that as a Company, we will work hard to give you a springboard to develop your career and skills in a culture of feedback, and the freedom to challenge, think differently and innovate in everything you do. We want you to feel empowered to bring your real self to work, in a culture that celebrates and values diversity.

To be considered for this vacancy please click on the Apply now button.

title: Lead Material and Corrosion Engineer
description:
What will you be doing?

 

The Global Projects Centre (GPC) is Subsea 7's centre of excellence for the execution of its largest projects worldwide.
Subsea7 is hiring a Materials and Corrosion Lead Engineer  within the Materials, Welding and Coatings department where you will be responsible for providing support to projects and other departments for all questions pertaining to metallic materials (carbon steel, stainless steels, nickel base alloys) and corrosion (materials selection, CO2 corrosion, H2S corrosion, SCC).

This role provides exciting opportunities to be involved throughout all stages of projects with activities related to Flexibles, Rigid Flowlines, PIP, Subsea structures, Offshore/Onshore Fabrication and Installation.

 

Key Responsibilities:
•    Produce the material specifications for pipes, forgings, and bends.
•    Review and clarify offers received from pipes, bends, and forgings suppliers.
•    Responsible of the materials selection according to the corrosive environment and the project constraints.
•    Perform CO2 corrosion calculation.
•    Participate to meeting with Clients, Vendors and Suppliers, and interface with Client representatives as required for resolving any technical issues.
•    Support quality and SCM departments for supplier’s qualification.
•    Participate to the R & D activities on materials and corrosion.
•    Ensures effective communication is maintained with clients and other departments.

What experience would we like you to have?

 

Qualifications:

 

•    10 + years’ Experience in Oil and Gas.
•    Bachelor’s degree in Materials science or other degree in Engineering with focus on materials and corrosion.

 

Skills:


•    Good understanding of metallurgical and mechanical properties of metallic materials.
•    Experienced in providing materials support to procurement of line pipe, induction bends, forgings, and in the review of subcontractor procedures and documentation.
•    Experienced in oil and gas corrosion mechanisms (CO2 corrosion, H2S corrosion)
•    Experienced in corrosion calculation, Material Selection, Compatibility & Feasibility Design Report.
•    Have good level of familiarity of recognized industry codes and standards relevant to materials and welding discipline. (API 5L, DNV OS-F101, NORSOK, ASTM, NACE).
•    Basic/good understanding of welding processes, welding qualifications, NDT procedures (UT, MPI, DPI, RT) used during welding of components and fabrication of subsea structures.
•    Communicates effectively and articulately at all levels, internally and externally.
•    Demonstrates positive attitude and flexibility in work approach.
•    Risk focused and demonstrates good analytical skills when making decisions.
•    Commitment to self-improvement, education and development.
•    Demonstrate ability to manage interfaces with multi projects and functions in a multicultural environment.

title: Principal Engineer - Installation & Project Engineer
description:
What will you be doing?

We are looking for a Principal Installation Engineer to be part of our "Installation and Project Engineering" discipline within GPC Engineering on a Staff basis.  You will represent the discipline on tenders and projects (providing the conduit for technical challenges) and responsible for maintaining discipline expertise as well as develop new capabilities.   You will be responsible for leading the installation of subsea structures, mooring systems, risers systems, flexible flowlines and / or umbilicals.  You will prepare the scope and support the offshore crew during the operation.  You will ensure the interface with the Client, suppliers, offshore crew and the design team.

 

Your main responsibilities will:

Lead installation work packages on a Tender, FEED or Project,
Deliver scopes within budget to the agreed quality and timeframe,
Manage scope both technical and commercial scope change,
Able to lead a team of engineers and contribute to their professional development,
Technical point of contact for specific installation subject matter,
Manage interface topics with all stakeholders; external (clients, suppliers) and internal (other disciplines, installation, manufacturing, purchase),
Ensure the delivery of high-quality documents and studies related to tenders, FEEDs and Projects.  This shall be through example and robust reviews,
Lead engineering activities related to the preparation and installation of products,
Plan, develop and review specific procedures/task plans and associated calculation notes (design lifting slings),
Support vessel mobilization and installation phases on vessel to support successful project delivery,
Ensure activities are conducted in compliance with the Project standards in terms of Quality, Cost & Time,
Maybe required to be the Technical Owner for a subject/product and provide decision making for choice of subcontractor and technical oversight of their work,
Validate concepts and manage changes accounting for HSEQ criteria,
Actively participate in the development of our discipline and mentor junior engineers,
Taking ownership and promote an area of technical expertise, as required contribute to the update or development of corporate standards and guidelines,
Offer and promote innovative solutions that enable the reduction of costs.

Working conditions:

Majority of your time will be carried out from Sutton office (not a remote working position),
Requirement for international travel,
Requirement to occasionally support Offshore/Off-site location during project execution.
What experience would we like you to have?

You will be able to demonstrate knowledge, skills, experience and behaviours in the following areas:

Graduated with a Master of Engineering and relevant work experience in the energy sector,
Extensive years of experience within Offshore/Subsea installation,
Maintain expertise in two or more of the following areas;
Subsea Structures Installation,
Hook-ups or Pull-in’s,
Riser systems,
Flexible Flowlines,
Umbilicals / Flying Leads
Mooring Installation, shore-pull and other relevant experience is desirable,
Experience working in deep and ultradeep water construction,
Experience working on Tenders and Projects,
Practical experience of project or contractual management,
Developing operational documentation; procedures, task plans and rigging design,
High level of relevant operational offshore experience,
Deliver work autonomously with minimal supervision,
Capacity to priorities, plan, coordinate and communicate to enable successful delivery,
Experience co-ordinating or leading teams (including managing others workloads),
Contribute to the development of engineers,
Ability to accommodate different working cultures and behaviours,
Fluent in English.

title: Treasury Associate
description:
Overview

Subsea7 is looking for a Treasury Associate to join our Finance Resource Centre on an initial 6 month contract. This is a great opportunity for those looking to begin a career in Finance or someone with experience who is seeking a new challenge. Our team are based at our East Campus office in Westhill.

 

Our FRC Treasury function is dynamic, global transaction team who work together to ensure we pay our people and suppliers on time, efficiently and accurately. If you share our values – safety, integrity, performance, collaboration, innovation and sustainability and you are friendly, positive, accurate and consistent – you can expect to make a lasting contribution to a critical business function. This role has the potential to lead to further opportunities within Subsea 7 after the initial contract period.

What will you be doing?

Reporting the Treasury Accountant, you will have responsibility for processing payments in the online banking platforms, allocating customer receipts, bank reconciliations and bank administration tasks. You will work closely with the banks, the Accounts Payable team, Regional Finance teams, Group Treasury, and other internal departments on a regular basis to resolve receipt or payment queries.

 

You will be expected to follow processes and become the country banking expert for the legal entities you are responsible for. You will demonstrate accuracy and a genuine curiosity to learn about global banking transactions and remain vigilant of potential fraudulent transactions.

 

 Main Duties & Responsibilities:

Running and reviewing the Payment Proposal Listings
Input and review of manual payments into the bank and once approved booked into accounting system
Timely preparation of bank reconciliations, providing accurate analysis of outstanding items
Reviewing the bank balances daily on the banking system comparing it to SAP to ensure all transactions are recorded including all intercompany transactions
Regular contact with project accountants to facilitate the collection of due debts and accurately booking receipts
Daily review of team mailbox to ensure proactive responses to queries
Other ad hoc duties as required which may include cover for other team members
What experience would we like you to have?

Please note, if you don’t tick all the boxes below but feel you have some of the relevant skills and experience we’re looking for, please do consider applying. We would encourage you to apply with a CV that highlights your transferable skills and experience.

 

You need to be enthusiastic and enjoy working as part of a team. You will have a motivation to understand and follow processes and use this knowledge to resolve issues that arise.
You will have previous experience within a Banking or Accounts Payable function, or this role would suit a recent graduate looking to get experience in a finance role.
You should be able to demonstrate a high level of accuracy, attention to detail, ability to manage tasks effectively, and work together with your team mates to ensure all tasks are completed by the deadlines.
You will be able to demonstrate a focus on customer service so being able to understand and investigate queries from the Subsea 7 business and then communicating the status and conclusions of these verbally and in writing is a critical skill.
Experience of working with SAP or a similar ERP system and online banking platforms would be beneficial. You will have solid Microsoft Office skills including Word and Excel.
You will work closely with the whole FRC team to deliver a trusted, reliable global banking service.
The role offers an exciting, varied environment where no two days are the same. A proactive, hands-on approach and a willingness to get stuck in will be key to thriving here.

title: Tendering Professionals
description:
Introduction

 

Subsea7 is seeking to strengthen our UK & Global Inspection, Repair & Maintenance (IRM) Sales and Marketing Team with new talent. We’re interested in hearing from Tendering professionals at all levels who are eager to apply their expertise in a dynamic environment where they can continue to grow, develop, and build a long‑term career. The role will be based at our office in Westhill, Aberdeenshire. 

 

This role will be a great opportunity for candidates to gain commercial experience and exposure to a variety of clients, internal functions, and Subsea7 Senior Management. The Tendering team have direct involvement in estimating and implementing the tendering process and will be involved with most facets of the UK/Canada/Northern Europe and Global IRM business.

 

We are keen to encourage candidates from a variety of backgrounds who feel they match the skills and experience for the roles but would be especially keen to encourage applications from professionals with estimating or costing experience.

What will you be doing?

 

The role is highly varied but some of the main responsibilities will be:

 

Involvement at all stages of tender preparation for potential Oil/Gas and Renewable Developments from Early Engagement through to Late Life interventions, as well as Decommissioning Projects.
Assist the Field Developments Group with preparation of cost estimates and cost reports in support of Concept, Feasibility, pre-FEED and FEED Studies.
Prepare accurate and economic costing of tenders with due regard to risk assessment, competitor positions, supply chain and market trends.
Organise the workload of the tender team to achieve tender completion on time in order that the necessary approvals are obtained prior to submission to clients.
Preparation of internal tender authorisation papers, presentations and documents which may include presenting or supporting presentations to Senior and Executive Management.
Development of winning bid documentation for submission to Clients.
Assist in the negotiation of terms and conditions of tenders with clients to achieve the best commercial, technical, and contractual position.

Please note, if you don’t tick all the boxes below but feel you have some of the relevant skills and experience we’re looking for, please do consider applying. We would encourage you to apply with a CV that highlights your transferable skills and experience.

 

Relevant previous experience in a tendering environment and ability to demonstrate estimating skills.  A background in use of Excel or specific estimating software is essential.
Ideally degree qualified in a relevant subject, however consideration will also be given to candidates who are qualified by experience.
Where appropriate for level of experience and position, proven ability to review and qualify contracts.
It is essential that candidates are in possession of advanced communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills to allow effective interaction with people at various levels within the organisation and externally.
Proven organisational skills and the ability to review work methods in support of continually developing smart and efficient work methods.
Keen to share learning and experience with others to promote continuous improvement and knowledge transfer within the organisation.
Desire to contribute to the day-to-day workings of the wider tendering team and, where appropriate for level of experience and position, contribute to supervision, mentoring and development of other team members.

title: Graduate Engineer Development Programme 2026
description:
Do you want to join the team who makes energy transition possible? 

 

If you are passionate about making a positive impact on securing the world's energy future, we invite you to join Subsea7’s industry-leading Graduate Engineer Development Programme and contribute to our mission of shaping a sustainable tomorrow. 


 

The Graduate Engineer Development Programme 

 

The Graduate Development Programme allows the graduates to gain a variety of experiences, which include formal training sessions and on-the-job development, spanning from detailed design engineering to opportunities to work offshore. 


Subsea7 provides an environment that promotes and supports the development of both business skills and technical knowledge, which enables our graduates to work effectively within our global organization. As a graduate, you will become a valuable member of the team and collaborate across disciplines.

 

 

We are recruiting Graduates to join the following disciplines:

 

Project Engineering
Mechanical Design
Materials, Fabrication and Corrosion


 

Our commitment to you: 

 

Support from both our local and corporate offices 
Opportunities to develop your technical and non-technical skills by attending courses, through field trips, offshore experience and in your day-to-day job 
The chance to network with experts and the global Subsea7 community 
To be an employer that cares about you and your personal development and welfare 
An extensive Sports & Social club with tailored activities and events 

 

 

Qualifications: 

 

Our engineering graduates typically have an engineering degree within one of the following areas: Mechanical, Civil, Structural, Marine/Naval Technology, Material Technology, Offshore Technology, Energy and Environmental Engineering. 

 

 

What we want from our people: 

 

The energy industry is constantly evolving, and we expect our graduates to be adaptable, quick learners, and open to embracing new technologies. We are looking for graduates who live our values: Safety, Integrity, Sustainability, Performance, Collaboration and Innovation. 


The positions are based in Stavanger with onboarding in September 2026. 


Graduate Engineer Development Programme is just the beginning - your professional and personal development journey continues throughout your career at Subsea7. 

  

Temporary transcript or other document describing subjects and grades achieved to this point must be uploaded. Applications without the requested documents will not be considered.

  

Visit our Norway recruitment site Being7.no for more information. 
 

Subsea7 uses Semac for background checks to verify information that appears in the CV and other documentation for relevant candidates. This background check is not carried out without the consent of the applicant, and relevant applicants will receive further information about this.

title: Project & Installation Engineers - Registration of Interest

description:
At Subsea7 and Seaway7, we are always interested in hearing from Project and Installation Engineers at all levels. Whether you're early in your career or bring a wealth of experience, we operate in diverse and dynamic environments around the world and are keen to connect with individuals who are passionate about delivering complex projects safely and sustainably.

 

If you're ready to explore where your next career move could take you, we encourage you to register your interest today. By submitting your details, you will be joining our global talent community and may be considered for future opportunities that align with your expertise and career interests.  Please be aware this is not a live position so you may not receive a response from us.

  

Our Project and Installation Engineers provide engineering skills to projects, tendering activities, engineering studies, vessels, equipment and offshore engineering processes. The engineer will usually work as part of a team and may also be required to provide information and engineering guidance to other functions within the business. Work may be carried out onshore, onsite or offshore.

 

What experience would we like you to have?

 

Please note, if you don’t tick all the boxes below but feel you have some of the relevant skills and experience we’re looking for, please do consider applying. We would encourage you to apply with a CV that highlights your transferable skills and experience.

 

Experience within the offshore energy industry, ideally within one of the following disciplines: Subsea IRM, Construction, Diving, foundations (piling, jackets), cables / umbilicals, heavy lift or reel lay discipline (i.e., Reel Lay, J-Lay, S-Lay).
Degree qualified in an engineering discipline: Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Naval Architecture, Marine, Offshore Engineering or similar (BEng / BSc or MEng / MSc).
A collaborative mindset with the ability to work effectively within multidisciplinary teams across multiple projects.
Ability to support interfaces within a project structure, including other disciplines, drawing office, document control, project management, client and suppliers.
A proven ability to deliver work within time and budget constraints.
A working knowledge of offshore operations, planning processes, and risk assessment practices.
Willingness to work offshore and travel as required as roles may involve short-term overseas assignments.

title: Graduate Project Surveyor
description:
The Survey Graduate Development Programme allows the graduates to gain a variety of experiences, which include formal training sessions and on-the-job development, spanning from detailed design engineering to opportunities to work offshore. 

Subsea7 provides an environment that promotes and supports the development of both business skills and technical knowledge, which enables our graduates to work effectively within our global organization. 

As a Survey graduate, you will become a valuable member of the team and collaborate across disciplines. The main function of the role is to provide technical expertise and support in the definition and supply of survey related requirements to Subsea7 projects and tenders. The role will involve working as part of an integrated project team to review client requirements, develop associated methodologies, procedures and budgets and facilitate between internal functions and external suppliers to deliver the required services. 

 
Our commitment to you: 
 
•    Support from both our local and corporate offices 
•    Opportunities to develop your technical and non-technical skills by attending courses, through field trips, offshore experience and in your day-to-day job 
•    The chance to network with experts and the global Subsea7 community 
•    To be an employer that cares about you and your personal development and welfare 
•    An extensive Sports & Social club with tailored activities and events 

 

Qualifications: 
 
Our Survey engineering graduates typically have an engineering degree within the following areas: Geodetic Engineering/ Survey. 

What we want from our people: 
 
The energy industry is constantly evolving, and we expect our graduates to be adaptable, quick learners, and open to embracing new technologies. We are looking for a graduate who live our values: Safety, Integrity, Sustainability, Performance, Collaboration and Innovation. 

The position is based in Stavanger with onboarding in September 2026. 

Graduate Engineer Development Programme is just the beginning - your professional and personal development journey continues throughout your career at Subsea7. 
  
Temporary transcript or other document describing subjects and grades achieved to this point must be uploaded. 
  
Visit our Norway recruitment site Being7.no for more information. 


 
Subsea7 uses Semac for background checks to verify information that appears in the CV and other documentation for relevant candidates. This background check is not carried out without the consent of the applicant, and relevant applicants will receive further information about this.

title: Designer
description:
Overview of Role:


Subsea7 is looking for Designers who can strengthen the team and support our growth plans within the Global Project Centre (GPC) Engineering Team based in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. We will consider applications at all levels, Designer Level I, II or Senior, for this role.

Reporting to the CAD Deputy Discipline Manager, you will be producing 2D/3D models, procedural and design drawing for the fabrication of subsea structures and ancillaries for subsea installation of SPS, SURF, offshore renewables as well as pipeline design related drawings.

 

 

Specific Key Responsibilities & Activities:

 

Prepare design/fabrication drawings of steel structures and piping (P&IDs/Isometrics) using AutoCAD and Inventor software.
Prepare pipeline-related drawings e.g. field layouts, alignment sheets, approach drawings and crossings.
Able to support Installation activities by preparing Installation related drawings according to drawing office procedures and standards.
Design/Model subsea structures and equipment using 3D Inventor software for fabrication drawings, Conceptual FEED Studies and Tender support.
Interface with other disciplines to obtain input for designs and drawings and to develop clash free designs.
Assist in the identification of technical problems and contribute with possible solutions.
Conduct self-check on model/drawings/sketches.
Undertake checking of others work in a project or department environment within own experience and competence level with good attention to detail.
Prepare drawings and sketches consistent with good engineering practice and in compliance with company drawing office procedures.
Ensure all drawings and sketches are produced with high safety consciousness being in line with Subsea7 safety standards and expectations.
Assist Fabrication as required in the resolution of construction difficulties relating to design problems, clashes, etc.
Provide feedback and input to improve departmental standards, working methods and guidelines.
Actively participate in training and development opportunities to ensure continuing professional development.

 

 

What experience would we like you to have?

 

Technical education is preferably related to civil, structural or mechanical engineering.
Proficient in the use of Autodesk AutoCAD 2D/3D.
Experience with Autodesk Civil 3D for alignment sheet production.
Proficient in the use of Autodesk Inventor 3D modelling and drawing production.
Experience in design/drafting of (subsea) steel structures including piping and/or pipelines.
Experience in installation drafting and related drawing and sketches.
Previous Bentley MicroStation experience is an advantage.
Knowledge of Autodesk Vault Professional for data (drawings/models) management.
Ability to function within multiple disciplines design team across multiple projects.
Ability to prioritize, organize and deliver work to deadlines set by the management and project.
Good communication skills in English, both verbally and written.

title: Desenhista II
description:
What will you be doing?

Missão do cargo
Responsável por apoiar a equipe de engenharia na elaboração de desenhos técnicos, detalhamentos e documentação de projetos, garantindo conformidade com normas, padrões internos e requisitos do cliente.

 

Responsabilidades

Desenvolver e atualizar desenhos técnicos em CAD (2D/3D) conforme especificações do projeto.
Auxiliar na preparação de listas de materiais e documentação técnica.
Interpretar normas técnicas e aplicar padrões de desenho.
Apoiar engenheiros na revisão e adequação de projetos.
Garantir organização e controle dos arquivos e revisões de desenho.
Elaborar produtos (tais como desenhos de natureza técnica de estruturas, equipamentos, peças, subconjuntos e outros referentes a projetos), participar ainda de reuniões (periódicas ou não) e atender à solicitação de terceiros, dentro de suas limitações de conhecimentos técnicos
Elaborar documentação técnica de projeto e assiná-la como autor. Revisar documentação de outros desenhistas e de fornecedores. Se empenhar para cumprir as datas de emissão e revisão dos documentos. Organizar e manter atualizado todo arquivo de desenho e documentação técnica pertinente ao projeto, de forma a facilitar o acesso e possibilitar consultas futuras no sistema de gerenciamento de arquivos disponível para isso (Vault);
Analisar criticamente todo o trabalho de desenho realizado por terceiros, garantir a segurança nas operações, sugerir e avaliar oportunidades de melhoria que otimizem o trabalho, até mesmo propondo inovações
Entender seu escopo e prever duração das suas atividades, entender as etapas de elaboração, escalas e estabelecimento de formatos, observar o cumprimento dos prazos previamente estabelecidos para confecção do projeto
Observar normas, padrões técnicos definidos pelo projeto (acabamentos, tolerâncias, etc.) de forma a atender suas exigências (ex: layouts, procedimentos de manobra, desenhos de arranjos básicos e de fabricação simples, etc.);
What experience would we like you to have?

Requisitos

Formação Técnica em Mecânica ou áres afins.
Conhecimento em Mathcad.
Conhecimento das normas aplicáveis a desenhos técnicos e projetos de engenharia (ex.: ABNT, ISO, ASME, API, AWS)
Inglês técnico.

title: Pilota(o) de ROV
description:
What will you be doing?

Somos líderes em engenharia, construção e serviços submarinos para a indústria global de energia offshore.

•      Somos obstinados por segurança

•      Temos compromisso com a performance

•      Prezamos a colaboração em tudo que fazemos

•      Somos motivados pela inovação

•      Fazemos o certo mesmo quando ninguém está vendo

Valorizamos a diversidade e vemos as diferenças como oportunidades ao invés de barreiras, assegurando condições de pleno desenvolvimento dos nossos profissionais e, também, para a sociedade.

* Todas as nossas vagas são elegíveis para pessoas com deficiência e/ou reabilitadas*

Buscamos uma(um) Pilota(o) de ROV para compor o nosso time Offshore e nos apoiar na entrega de projetos e serviços desafiadores para a indústria de energia.

Missão do cargo: Execução de manutenção e das operações de ROV, de acordo com a solicitação do seu gestor imediato e atividade da embarcação PLSV.

Responsabilidades e atribuições

·      Manter-se informada(o) e atualizada(o) com os procedimentos da empresa em geral, promovendo melhorias contínuas nas atividades operacionais, e de segurança na embarcação.

·      Executar os serviços programados, seguindo os procedimentos, políticas e valores da empresa.

·      Identificar quaisquer incidências de comportamentos e/ ou atitudes, condições, processos inseguros e/ou outros correlatos, relatando ao superior imediato, e registrando ou solicitando o registro de acordo com as ferramentas no sistema da empresa.

·      Zelar pela sua segurança e das equipes durante as operações, bem como monitorar e providenciar as medidas preventivas e/ ou corretivas caso necessário.

·      Operar os equipamentos do Sistema de ROV de acordo com padrões e procedimentos técnicos aplicáveis, utilizando-se do aprendizado adquirido com o objetivo de obtenção dos melhores resultados.

·      Realizar a manutenção dos equipamentos de ROV, diagnosticando defeitos e falhas de operação, reparando e substituindo componentes mecânicos e eletroeletrônicos, visando a recomposição das condições normais de operação.

·      Trabalhar seguindo as normas de segurança, higiene, qualidade e preservação ambiental.

·      Desempenhar demais tarefas auxiliares a ele designadas, exercendo atividades com orientação do seu superior imediato.

What experience would we like you to have?
Requisitos e qualificações

·      Técnico em Eletrônica (CFT ativo);

·      Experiência offshore na função;

·      Experiência nos ROVs: Hercules – SMD, XLX-EVO (Forum), XLXC-Triton (Forum) e CENTURION SP - SMD;

·      Inglês Avançado.

title: Analysis Engineer (Pipeline Installation)
description:
What will you be doing?

We are looking for a motivated Installation Analysis Engineer to join our team at our Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia office on a full-time, permanent basis.

 

Our Pipeline Analysis Engineers are well-regarded for their skills in evaluating the entire installation process, from preparing and delivering installation analyses to overseeing offshore operations until completion. You will either be a part of a team of installation analysis project engineers, dealing with rigid pipeline installation analysis in project, FEED or tender.

 

What will you be doing?

 

Performs detailed feasibility studies and installation analyses, considering all associated risk and ensure that all safety rules are considered for various operations such as pipe laying, riser installation, pipeline structure in line installation.
Determines and optimises operations installation steps, laying methods determination (S-Lay, J-Lay, reeling).
Interfaces with associated subsea related disciplines and understand the interfaces within a project environment.
Provides engineering support during operations with occasional periods offshore,
Ensures all relevant safety objectives and legal requirements are observed,
Contributes to the knowledge consolidation within the PG department.
Proposes innovative solutions allowing cost & risks reduction.
What experience would we like you to have?

Please note, if you don’t tick all the boxes below but believe you have some of the relevant skills and experience, we’re looking for, please do consider applying. We would encourage you to apply with a CV that highlights your transferable skills and experience.

 

Previous experience within an Analysis Engineer or similar position
Experience with Finite Element Analysis methods
Demonstrable familiarity with relevant software such as Orcaflex, Abaqus, Python, VBA, etc
Demonstrates good communication skills, with the ability to engage effectively with a wide range of stakeholders. Comfortable managing tasks efficiently as well as collaboratively within a team
Good report writing skills with the ability to self-check and produce accurate work, as well as the ability prioritise and organise your work accordingly to meet deadlines set by management.
This role may involve short spells of overseas travel so candidates may need to show a willingness and flexibility.

title: Senior Project Surveyor
description:
Exciting Opportunity in Renewables!

 

Are you a Senior subsea Project Surveyor seeking a new challenge within the renewables industry?  Or a highly experienced Project Surveyor ready for the next step?

 

This is an exciting opportunity to work with fantastic projects, people and technology.  

 

By joining Subsea7 you become part of a globally recognised leader in the energy industry, successfully delivering subsea projects for over 50 years.

 

Office based in Zoetermeer, Netherlands, you’ll form part of an integrated project team.  You'll review client requirements, develop associated methodologies, and take overall responsibility for the successful delivery of the survey service to both internal and external clients.
 

The role is part of our wider team of global survey experts who, collaboratively, provide projects with technical advice, geomatic and GIS services, best practice and innovative techniques.

 

Your assigned projects will be for Seaway7’s Offshore Renewables work.  Seaway7, part of the Subsea7 Group, supports developers to bring sustainable, renewable energy to the world through the construction of offshore wind farms, contributing to an efficient and sustainable energy supply for the future.

What will you be doing?

 

Primarily supporting the Seaway7 Foundation Installation Delivery (FID) team the successful candidate will provide technical expertise and support in the definition and supply of survey related requirements to tenders, projects and operations performed related to foundation installation and associated heavy lift operations.

 

Periodically you may be assigned to support other areas of Seaway7 and Subsea7’s operations which may include projects across submarine power cable installation, SURF and IRM.

 

You will work as part of an integrated project team to review client requirements, develop associated methodologies, procedures and budgets and facilitate between internal functions and external suppliers to deliver the required services.

 

Provide survey support to Seaway7 renewables projects throughout the project life cycle.
Ensure that all Survey related activities are undertaken in accordance with Subsea7 HSEQ procedures.
Provide technical and commercial input to tenders.
Develop project procedures and quality plans in alignment with Subsea7 processes.
Ensure that offshore personnel requirements are identified and communicated in a timely manner to the Survey Operations Manager and survey Offshore Crewing & Logistics team.
Identify required equipment and communicate these requirements to the internal survey engineering support group to ensure timely delivery of equipment to worksites.
Support project during Client meetings.
Attend onshore calibrations, SIT/FAT, at various locations and worksites as required.
Manage and lead 3rd party service providers ensuring that the services are provided in line with agreed specification and internal standards.
Undertake project briefings/ debriefings during periods of vessel mobilisation / demobilisation with key survey personnel / other project personnel.
Act as liaison on behalf of project both with internal and external interfaces.
Ensure that projects are closed out in a timely manner with lessons learned being captured and communicated.
Ensure final client deliverables are of suitable quality and delivered on time and within budget.
Collaborate with other Project Survey Support and Engineering personnel as required.
Any other duties as directed.
What experience would we like you to have?

 

A degree in a Survey related science subject or professional association is preferred.
Demonstrable experience in an offshore and/or onshore survey position in the offshore energy industry is essential, preferably in the Offshore Renewables and Heavy Lift industry.
A high level of knowledge and understanding of current offshore Renewables/Heavy Lift/Construction survey techniques and technologies, and best practice.
Ideally additional experience in an onshore survey project support role
High level of competence with standard business applications such as Microsoft Word & Excel.
Strong English language skills in both written and verbal communication.
Familiar with EIVA survey acquisition and post processing software (e.g. NaviPac, NaviModel) or other similar hydrographic survey software suites.
Proficiency in use of CAD and ESRI GIS packages preferred but not mandatory.
Effective team working skills are essential together with a high degree of self-motivation.
Flexibility in working hours and location to meet business needs

title: Structure and Piping Design Lead Engineer
description:
What will you be doing?

En tant que Lead Engineer Structure au sein du département Structures & Piping Design du "Global Project Center" (Centre d'Excellence dédié aux Grands Projects du Groupe), vous piloterez et serez responsable d'un package de structures sur des projets d’envergure internationale. Vous coordonnerez les activités de conception, gérerez les interfaces techniques, encadrerez une équipe d’ingénieurs en garantissant la qualité des livrables dans le respect des délais, du budget et des standards HSEQ.
Vous contribuerez également à l’amélioration continue des méthodes de travail et au développement technologique de la discipline.

 

As Lead Engineer Structure within the Structures & Piping Design Department of the Global Project Centre (Subsea7’s Centre of Excellence for Major Projects), you will lead and be responsible for a package of structures on large-scale international projects. You will coordinate design activities, manage technical interfaces, and supervise a team of engineers, ensuring the quality of deliverables while meeting deadlines, budgets, and HSEQ standards.
You will also contribute to the continuous improvement of work processes and the technological development of the discipline.

What experience would we like you to have?
Organiser et planifier les activités de conception structurelle et tuyauterie
Organiser la production et valider les livrables techniques (calculs, spécifications, procédures…)
Être l’interlocuteur technique auprès des clients, fournisseurs et parties prenantes
Encadrer et faire monter en compétence les ingénieurs de votre équipe
Contribuer à l’amélioration continue et au développement technologique de la discipline

 

Organize and plan structural and piping design activities.
Manage the production and validation of technical deliverables (calculations, specifications, procedures…).
Act as the technical point of contact for clients, suppliers, and stakeholders.
Supervise and support the development of your engineering team.
Contribute to continuous improvement and technology development within the discipline.
Competencies
Diplôme d’ingénieur ou équivalent
Minimum 8 ans d’expérience en conception de structures offshore (SURF, Oil & Gas, énergies renouvelables)
Expertise pour organiser et prioriser sa propre charge de travail et celle des autres, gérer le temps et le contrôle des changements en conséquence
Expérience à un niveau équivalent, y compris une période en tant qu'ingénieur Senior, dans les activités liées à la conception structurelle d'équipements dans les domaines Pétroliers et Gaziers, Subsea ou d'Energie Renouvelable Offshores
Solide expérience en construction métallique en général, connaissances et expérience concrète en conception d'ouvrages permanents du secteur (ILT, PLET…) obligatoires; experience en fabrication sera un plus
Maîtrise des codes de conception (AISC, API, DNV, Eurocodes…) et des logiciels (SACS ou équivalent, ANSYS,…)
Connaissances solides en matériaux, soudage, tuyauterie et fabrication
Leadership reconnu, sens de l’organisation et excellentes capacités de communication à tous les niveaux de l'organisation, écrite et orale
Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais indispenables
Être motivé et posséder des capacités interpersonnelles bien développées 

 

Engineering degree or equivalent
Minimum 8 years of experience in offshore structural design (SURF, Oil & Gas, Renewables)
Expertise in organizing and prioritizing own and others’ workload, managing time and change control accordingly
Experience at a similar level, including time as a Senior Engineer, in structural design activities related to Oil & Gas, Subsea equipment, or Offshore Renewables
Strong background in steel construction and permanent structure design (e.g., ILTs, PLETs); fabrication experience is a plus
Proficiency in design codes (AISC, API, DNV, Eurocodes…) and software (SACS or equivalent, ANSYS…)
Solid knowledge of materials, welding, piping, and fabrication
Recognized leadership, strong organizational skills, and excellent communication abilities at all levels, both written and verbal.
Fluency in French and English is essential
Self-motivated with well-developed interpersonal skills

title: Senior Project Operations Engineer
description:
Overview
We are excited to share a newly created opportunity for a Senior Project Operations Engineer to join our team on a permanent basis. While the role is ideally based in Paris, we are open to considering candidates located in other countries where Subsea7 has an office.
 

The Senior Project Operations Engineer (SPOE) assists the Project Operations Manager planning, managing and executing Operational scopes assigned to them. Typically taking care of a strategic installation vessel and its support spread, from readiness through execution. They will mentor, develop and manage POEs assigned to them.

 

The SPOE applies advanced operational knowledge typically obtained through work experience to support the POM. They are able to work independently delivering part of the Operations scope of work (with limited supervision and guidance).

 

The SPOE can also be assigned to a specific tender where they will develop the Execution Plan, the associated offshore schedule, define the marine spread requirements and associated logistics plan for onshore and offshore purpose

What will you be doing?

Vessel Readiness:

Responsible for his assigned marine spread assurance in coordination with the Marine Assurance experts supporting him (S7, Client and local requirements); he coordinates and organizes supporting surveys and audits as required.
Check & Ensure Country regulations requirements are followed.
Check Communication means/ VSAT availability for chartered vessels.
Organise Manning of chartered vessels with support of Offshore Crewing Group (Define, Allocate, Logistic).
Define personnel requirements (POB) for the entire vessel (with support of VOM when applicable) as well as support the POB definition for project specific subcontract quantity/ functions.
Follow-up of chartered vessel management as Vessels Operations Manager (VOM) for Audits, POB definition, Mobilization/demobilization, HSE, Emergency Plan, Scope of work.
Develop required operational procedures for the execution of the scope

 

Planning, Budget & Co-ordination:

Ensure Spread availability, external spread booking
Attend regular country operations meetings, Construction Review, etc…
Ensure 3rd party services costs and planning are tracked and monitored.

 

Logistic Support to Operations:

Communication with S7 country organization (or local agent) for logistic purposes (Project Equipment and Material) In and Out of Subsea7 Base.
Monitor local logistic support and participate in improving when possible or when required. Understand and follow the logistic strategy in the country of operations, including crew change, importation/exportation of project equipment and material, as well as vessel clearances in country of Operations.

 

Mobilisation:

Prepare and lead the full assigned spread readiness process.
Co-ordinate Yard activities and load-out sequence for timely delivery of fabricated items.
Organise timely mobilisation of subcontracted personnel.
In co-ordination with project HSE manager, ensure resources (Medivac, security boats etc.) to support Offshore Bridging Document (including Emergency Response Plan) are available.
Review safety reports and participate in closing necessary remedial actions.

 

Operations:

Daily Management of support spread in line with vessel requirements (incorporable, fuel, water, food).
Participate in daily conference call organised by POM, for progress follow up and coordination.
Support POM liaising with Client regarding assigned scope. Support SIMOPS management as required.
Provides all documentary evidence necessary to prepare any contractual claims, which may arise for assigned spread.

 

Demobilisation:

Ensure all project equipment are timely demobilised and returned to suppliers.
Ensure liaison with Yard for return of fabricated installation aids and re-certification of rigging

 

Feedback / Knowledge management:

Participate in Lessons Learnt meeting.
Provide input in preparation of Project Operations Debrief Report.
What experience would we like you to have?

Please note, if you don’t tick all the boxes below but feel you have some of the relevant skills and experience we’re looking for, please do consider applying. We would encourage you to apply with a CV that highlights your transferable skills and experience.

 

Educated to degree level in engineering degree or related discipline.
6+ years of relevant experience in offshore industry, including experiences in offshore operations.
Good knowledge of logistic rules and principles on which immigration, customs and importation / exportation laws of countries where operations take place are based.
Fluent in English.
Good ability to synthesize information.
Communication & organisational skills.
Capacity to adapt quickly to changing situations.

title: Senior Project Surveyor
description:
Introduction

 

At Subsea7, we drive the global delivery of offshore energy projects, advancing technology with innovation, collaboration, and performance

 

Our Kuala Lumpur offce are looking for a seasoned onshore based Senior Project Surveyor to join our collaborative team managing projects in our APME Region.  The role will be based in Kuala Lumpur.

 

Join a supportive team focused on delivering top-quality subsea positioning, measurement, and mapping solutions.  With Subsea7's extensive global presence, you'll engage in complex and interesting offshore energy projects, utilising our fleet of pipelay and construction vessels.

What will you be doing?

 

The role will work as part of an integrated project team to review client requirements, develop associated methodologies, procedures and budgets.   Duties are as follows:

 

Provide technical and operational input throughout the SURF project lifecycle, from tender development to execution and close-out.
Liaise with internal teams, clients, and third-party providers to identify personnel, equipment, and project needs, ensuring timely delivery to worksites.
Develop and review project-specific survey procedures, ensuring alignment with client requirements and industry standards.
Attend and lead project briefings and debriefings with survey personnel and stakeholders to ensure clarity of scope and expectations.
Manage survey deliverables, oversee third-party service providers, and ensure quality and timeliness of outputs within budget constraints.
Ensure end-of-trip reports are completed promptly, with lessons learned documented and communicated for continuous improvement.
Identify and implement opportunities to enhance survey processes, workflows, and technologies to improve efficiency and data quality.
Mentor and support junior surveyors, providing technical guidance and training.
What experience would we like you to have?

 

Bachelor’s degree or above in Surveying, Geomatics, Hydrography, Geophysics, or a related science discipline.
Membership in a professional survey association is beneficial.
Demonstrable role relevant experience in a similar position, with a background in offshore survey operations.
Demonstrated experience in subsea construction operations, with a comprehensive understanding of current techniques and technologies in ROV-based positioning, measurement, and mapping.

title: Senior Cathodic Protection & Corrosion Consultant
description:
What will you be doing?

The Global Projects Centre (GPC) Engineering is Subsea 7's centre of excellence for the execution of its largest projects worldwide.

Based within the Design & Analysis group of GPC Engineering, you will be part of the Materials, Welding, and Coating (MWC) discipline and work on large EPCI projects, FEEDs, and tenders.

This a position for a Contractor.

This role provides exciting opportunities to be involved throughout all stages of projects with activities related to Flexibles, rigid flowlines, PIP, Subsea structures, offshore/onshore fabrication and installation.

Within the Materials/Welding/Coating discipline, you will:

Provide technical support to projects and other disciplines within Subsea 7 with regard to Cathodic Protection (CP).
Prepare CP design report for subsea flowlines, risers, and structures.
Perform CP calculations for subsea flowlines, risers, and structures in accordance with international standards.
Prepare anode specifications and Material Take Off (MTO) for tenders and projects.
Review and clarify anode Suppliers’ offers and perform technical evaluation of the offers.
Be the single point of contact for project teams for cathodic protection.
Perform corrosion assessment and CO2 corrosion rate modelling of pipelines.
Participate in meeting with Clients, Vendors and Suppliers, and interface with Client representatives as required for resolving technical issues.
Provide support to fabrication and installation teams, Quality, and Supply Chain Management (SCM) departments.
Ensures effective communication is maintained with Clients, Suppliers, and other disciplines within the organisation.
What experience would we like you to have?
Demonstrates commitment to and promotes Subsea7 visions and values.
Experienced in CP system design and calculation, preferably extensive years experience in the subsea Oil and Gas industry.
Experienced in providing support to procurement of anode and in the review of Suppliers’ procedures and documentation.
Assumes responsibility for CP project related targets and deliverables.
Good understanding of corrosion mechanisms for subsea systems.
Communicates effectively and articulately at all levels, internally and externally.
Demonstrates positive attitude and flexibility in work approach.
Is risk focused and demonstrates good analytical skills when making decisions.
Demonstrates professional approach when representing Subsea7, builds and enhances relationships with client and manages interfaces effectively.
Shows commitment to self-improvement, education and development.
Demonstrate ability to manage interfaces with multi projects and functions in a multicultural environment.
Have a degree in Materials science or a related Engineering discipline.
Preferably, holds ISO/NACE certifications on CP.

title: Engineer Level II - Materials/Welding
description:
What will you be doing?

·    With minimal supervision, independently evaluate, organize, & prioritize your projects.
·    Review and become familiar with client specifications during Tender and Projects.
·    Provide specialist skills & knowledge in key areas of materials and welding engineering.
·    Produce data sheets for component (forging, pipe, bend, etc) procurement and provide technical oversite of component procurement.
·    Review fabricators submitted Material Test Reports, Welding Procedure Packages and Non-Destructive Testing Procedures in accordance with industry codes, standards & client specifications.
·    Contribute to training & development while innovating solutions.

What experience would we like you to have?

•    Bachelor of Science degree in Weld Engineering, Metallurgy or Material Science with 7 years’ practical experience in Weld Engineering.
•    Must have fluent written and verbal communication skills in English
•    Proficient with most common business software tools and packages.
•    Welding and fabrication involving typical subsea material combinations including base materials of carbon steel pipe, forgings, CRAs (including nickel alloys, duplex and super duplex stainless) as well as inlay and overlay cladding of these materials.
•    Subsea fabrication, manufacturing, and welding experience with any of the following; PLET’s, PLEM’s, jumpers (rigid or flexible), umbilical’s and related structures (SUTA, TUTA), manifolds, subsea connection systems, subsea valves, pigging equipment, pull-in heads, suction piles and other subsea foundations.
•    AWS Certified Welding Inspector or Certified Welding Engineer (current or past)
•    NDE Certifications such as ASNT Level II or preferably Level III in multiple NDE methods (current or past)
•    Experience and familiarity with various offshore operator’s (majors and independents) materials and welding specifications.
•    Welding of both the pressure containing kit and fabricated steel structures (skids, frames, mudmats, mooring) used in typical subsea structures.
•    Experience with manufacture and testing of line pipe
•    Experience with hot induction bending of pipe
•    Forging and materials processing techniques for controlling mechanical properties.
•    Experience with flanged connections and bolting.
•    Experience with subsea cathodic protection systems, and the material related issues of CP (HIC) in the subsea environment.

title: Geotechnical Engineer
description:
Subsea7 has an exciting opportunity for a Geotechnical Engineer to be part of the geotechnical team, based in Stavanger. We are a multicultural and diverse team, regularly use the various FEA packages for foundation design and we work together as a team to solve problems and learn from each other. The applicant should have relevant offshore geotechnical competence. Programming skills in python or similar is not a requirement but an advantage for the position.


We hope you will be the next team member and look forward to hearing from you.

 


The tasks you will solve:


•    Complete geotechnical engineering aspects of tenders, studies, and projects
•    Interpret and use offshore site investigation data and be able to integrate results into parameters for detailed design of subsea infrastructure
•    Undertake detailed design and installation of gravity based, piled and suction installed foundations
•    Use of 2D and 3D finite element software (Plaxis and/or OptumCE)
•    Carry out soil/pipeline interaction analyses
•    Complete offshore trenching and rock dumping assessments
•    Possibility to attend offshore trenching or rock dumping as client representative

 


What you get from us:


•    A very good working environment and collaboration culture
•    Challenging and exciting workdays
•    Personal development and career opportunities
•    Competitive terms including an attractive insurance policies and pension schemes
•    Sports clubs and social- and recreational activities for both you and your family
•    Workplace flexibility

 


What we want from you:


•    Master’s degree or equivalent in Civil Engineering with specialization in Geotechnical Engineering
•    Minimum 2 years relevant offshore geotechnical design working experience, either in oil and gas or offshore wind
•    Good knowledge of codes and standards within the field of Geotechnical Engineering
•    Preferable experience with programming in python or similar
•    Strong analytical skills
•    Creative problem solving - able to suggest and develop new methods and ways of working
•    Understanding of clients’ needs and ability to suggest and apply “fit for purpose” solutions
•    Sound communication skills – able to communicate ideas and results to various stakeholders (both in written reports and in meetings, presentations etc.) particularly in English
•    The ability to work in a team as well as individually with a minimum of supervision

 


The position is based in Stavanger.  
For queries regarding the position please contact Christian Linde Olsen, Discipline Manager – Geotechnics Norway: Christian.LindeOlsen@Subsea7.com / +47 51 72 12 25


 

Subsea7 uses Semac for background checks to verify information that appears in the CV and other documentation for relevant candidates. This background check is not carried out without the consent of the applicant, and relevant applicants will receive further information about this.

title: Tender Estimator
description:
Overview

Subsea7 has a fantastic opportunity for a Senior Estimating Engineer to join our team in Paris on a full-time, staff basis.

 

Reporting to the GPC Estimating Manager, the Estimating Specialist is establishing cost estimates and commercial deliverables in accordance with ITT requirements, technical constraints, and commercial aspects. It is a cross-functional role that provides an overview of our business and projects, ideal for technical profiles wishing to acquire commercial and project management support skills.

What will you be doing?

 

Main duties and responsibilities include (but are not limited to):

 

Build accurate cost estimates for commercial proposals while ensuring full compliance with Subsea7’s Business Management System (BMS) and internal procedures, ensuring accountability, quality, and continuous improvement throughout the estimating process.
Develop the execution plan with the Project Manager (Tender Lead) and the Tender Engineer (Commercial Lead) to produce a complete, accurate, and optimized cost estimate.
Perform cost simulations to evaluate alternatives (e.g., J-lay vs. Reel Lay, flexible vs. rigid) and support the tender team in identifying the most cost-effective solutions.
Integrate deliverables from all departments involved in the tender process, including Project and Operations, Engineering, Business Delivery Functions, Legal, Finance (including Tax and Treasury), and Insurance. Provide proactive input to support their contributions.
Contribute to initiatives that enhance collaboration between Estimating and support functions, with the aim of developing more competitive and value-driven proposals.
Prepare commercial deliverables for proposals, including price schedules for Lump Sum, options, and unit rates.
Analyse project expenses and revenue over time to support favourable payment terms and cash flow conditions in contracts.
Implement cost impacts during contract clarification and negotiation phases.
Perform product-based cost analysis for each tender, ensuring clarity and accuracy in the breakdown of cost components.
Ensure smooth handover to the project team after contract award, following Group S&M guidelines.

 

What experience would we like you to have?

Please note, if you don’t tick all the boxes below but feel you have some of the relevant skills and experience we’re looking for, please do consider applying. We would encourage you to apply with a CV that highlights your transferable skills and experience.

 

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Finance, Cost Engineering, or equivalent
Previous experience within a similar role
Good understanding of Subsea7’s products and activities
Experience in estimating or project services in similar industries
Precision and attention for detail
Proactive, analytical, and highly curious
Flexible and available to meet demanding deadlines
Team-oriented with transparent and collaborative work style
Ethical and trustworthy with confidential information
Able to take a broad view and apply critical thinking
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
